loans.name: Natalia Diana

texts.es:
La señora Natalia Diana E. H., es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac”, vive en una casa alquilada en la Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 1252, Distrito de Catac - Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró 02 carneros para venderlos a los pobladores del lugar, tiene 1 año de experiencia en la venta de carne y en la venta de abarrotes 03 años.
En la actualidad, continúa con ambos negocios, siempre ubicado en su casa alquilada donde vive.  
Con este préstamo de S/.  500.00 comprará 04 carneros para venderlos en Catac.
Natalia es una mujer muy trabajadora y les enseña a sus hijos la actividad que ella desarrolla.
texts.en:
Natalia Diana E. H. is a member of "Las Triunfadoras de Catac" ("The Winners from Catac") Community Bank and lives in a rented home on 1252 31st of May Avenue, district of Catac, province of Recuay, department of Ancash. She lives with her partner and has two children who depend on her. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased two rams to sell for mutton in town. She has one year experience selling meat and three years selling groceries. Currently, she's continuing both businesses, which are located in her home. With the loan of 500 soles she is requesting, she plans to buy four rams to sell for mutton in Catac. Natalia is a hard-working woman who teaches her children the ways of the businesses she developed.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase four rams to sell for mutton

loans.name: Luzmila Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Luzmila Bertha H. Ramírez, es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Ac. 31 de Mayo Nº 381, Distrito de Catac, Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash.  Es conviviente, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 niña.  Está esperando a su segundo bebé.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 100.00 adelantó el pago de 01 silla giratoria que compró a plazos para realizar los cortes de cabello ya que ella terminó de estudiar cosmetología y siempre trabajó con los pocos implementos que tenía.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, ubicado en la casa de sus suegros, donde presta el servicio a los pobladores de Catac.
Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 terminará de cancelar la silla giratoria y también comprará 01 silla giratoria pequeña para niños.
Hoy se siente muy segura porque ha podido culminar sus estudios de cosmetología , gracias a ello podrá obtener mayores ingresos para la educación de sus hijos.
Se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por apoyarla con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luzmila Bertha H. Ramírez is a member of “The Winners of Catac” Communal Bank. She lives at 381 31 de Mayo Street, in the district of Catac, province of Recuay, department of Ancash. She is a common-law wife, 26 years old, and is a mother of a girl. She is expecting her second child. With her first loan of 100 soles she paid a down payment on a swivel chair that she bought on a payment plan so she can do haircuts. She finished her cosmetology studies and has always worked with the few tools that she has had. Currently she continues with the same business, which is located in her in-laws’ home, where she provides her services to the residents of Catac. With this loan of 300 soles, she will complete her payments on the swivel chair and will buy a small swivel chair for children. Today she feels very secure because she was able to complete her cosmetology studies, and thanks to these studies, she will be able to earn more money for her children’s education. She is very grateful to Kiva partner The Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting her with these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay off the swivel chair she bought on a payment plan and buy one more swivel chair for children

loans.name: Lourdes Benita

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes Benita H. Ramírez, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Villa turística de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 414, Distrito de Catac, Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años de edad y es madre de 03 niñas que dependen de ella, su esposo es constructor y le apoya en todo.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró materiales para su centro de tipeos. Trabaja con Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, en el lugar donde vive, presta sus servicios a los estudiantes del lugar.
Con este préstamo de S/.  300.00 comprará 01 impresora multifuncional porque la que tenía se le ha malogrado.
Lourdes es Técnico en Enfermería y se siente orgullosa de haber logrado culminar su carrera apoyándose con los trabajos de tipeo que realiza.
Lourdes, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos porque le permitió valorarse como mujer y poder continuar sus estudios y así conducir bien su negocio.
texts.en:
Lourdes Benita H. Ramírez belongs to the “Villa turística de Catac” Communal Bank. She lives at Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 414 in the Catac District (Recuay Province, Department of Ancash). She is 28 years old, married, and takes care of her 3 daughters. Her husband is in construction and helps her with everything. With her first loan for S/. 300.00 she bought supplies for her typing service. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for a year. She still has the same business, located in her home, and she offers her service to local students. With this loan for S/. 300.00 she will buy a multifunctional printer because the one she had broke. Lourdes has an Associate's Degree in Nursing and is proud to have finished her studies by supporting herself with her typing services. Lourdes is grateful to Manuela Ramos because it allowed her to have pride in herself as a woman, to continue her studies, and to manage her business well.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase one printer

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es una esposa abnegada y madre trabajadora, desde que su pareja se enfermó ha estado pendiente de él y de sus hijos, a pesar de sentirse  mal, ya que hace 2 meses sufrió un derrame cerebral. Pero pudo salir adelante y retomó su trabajo, ya que tienen que mantener sola las necesidades de su casa. Alicia vende ropa, pero también picarones (postre típico peruano) en la esquina de su casa, lugar que gracias a la presencia de vehículos de transporte público, concentra a muchas personas, lo cual es beneficioso para ella. Esta actividad la realiza todos los días, desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche, pues no puede quedarse mucho tiempo por la presencia de delincuentes que suelen molestarla, pero esto no la desanima, sino que la alienta a agilizar sus metas de instalar un puesto de comida en su casa o en un lugar con mayor seguridad. Tener su noveno crédito con MFP es un indicador de la responsabilidad y orden dentro de su grupo, lo cual han sido determinante para su desarrollo. Los 2000 soles que solicita serán para adquirir algunos utensilios y muebles para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alicia is a struggling wife and a hardworking mother. Since her partner fell ill she has been taking care of him and of their children even if she is not well either, having suffered a stroke 2 months ago. But she pulled through and started work again to keep up with the household expenses. Alicia sells clothing, but she also sells Picarones (squash and sweet potato donuts) from her house. The location is very good given the public transportaiton that runs through and brings by many people. She works her business every day from 3pm to 7pm. She cannot stay too long because there are bandits in the neighbourhood wanting to harm her. All of this doesn't stop her, but instead she is even more driven to realize her dreams of setting up a restaurant in her house, or in a locale with greater security. Having her ninth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) is an indicator of her responsibility and the good working conditions of her group, the driving force for her development. The 2000 soles will be used to purchase utensils and furniture to better serve her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase utensils and furniture for her business.

loans.name: Carito

texts.es: Carito tiene 42 años, contrajo matrimonio hace 15 años y fruto de su unión tuvo un pequeño hijo, junto a su esposo tratan de velar por el progreso de su familia. La venta de cosméticos es una tarea muy ardua, pues todos los días recorre las calles rumbo a las casas de sus clientes, que en su mayoría son amistades y familiares, quienes le hace pedidos cada quincena, y siendo sus clientes más estables trata de visitarlas con más frecuencia. Aun así sale a otros lugares para relacionarse con otras personas e incrementar sus ventas, sin embargo lo difícil es administrar adecuadamente su tiempo, ya que como madre tiene que realizar sus roles en su hogar para luego salir a las calles a trabajar. Carito trata de agilizar sus labores con la finalidad de tomar un descanso algunos días junto a su esposo, con quien tiene proyectado  realizar un negocio de venta de bebidas, por lo cual están ahorrando para la compra de una congeladora e iniciar el próximo verano su proyecto. El ánimo y apoyo que se brindan como grupo, son las cosas que le agradan de su grupo, el cual está conformado hace más de cuatro años, este es su octavo crédito con MFP. Los 2000 soles solicitados están destinados a la compra de productos de belleza, pues desea aprovechar las ofertas de temporada.
texts.en:
Carito is 42 years old and has been married for 15 years, and the fruit of her marriage has been a little boy. Together with her husband they try to advance their family. Cosmetics sales is a very difficult occupation, especially because she has to roam the streets and to go clients' homes daily, most being friends and family who place orders every second week. She tries to visit the steady clients more frequently. But she still heads out to other places to engage new people and increase her sales. It is difficult to manage her time because she also has to manage her household responsibilities, even before going out into the streets. Carito is trying to improve her sales so that she might be able to take some days off together with her husband. She hopes to set up another business in partnership with him, selling drinks. They are saving up to purchase a refrigerator to start up the business next summer. The friendships and group support are the things she likes best from her group, with which she has been for more than four years now. This is her eighth loan with MFP (Kiva field partner). The 2000 soles requested will be used to purchase beauty products, wanting to take advantage of the sales this season.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Ida Martina

texts.es:
La señora Ida Martina R. Huamán, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 316, Distrito de Catac, Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Es conviviente, tiene 35 años de edad y es madre de 02 niños que depende de ella.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró productos de belleza de las marcas Ebel y Unique para ofrecerlos a sus amistades.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, en un espacio que su mamá le ha proporcionado para la venta de sus productos en su domicilio.  También vende ropas y las coloca a sus amistades quien pagan en partes y al contado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 comprará más ropa según los pedidos que le están haciendo sus amistades y así poder incrementar su capital que ya tiene formado.
Es una mujer independiente, manifiesta que apoya en los gastos de la familia con el negocio que ella tiene.
Agracede el apoyo que le viene brindando el Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le permite crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Martina Romera H. is a member of the Community Bank "Las Triunfadoras de Catac". She lives in Av. 31 de Mayo Nunber 316, in the district of Catac of the province of Recuay in Ancash. She is common law married, she is 35 years old and she is mother of 2 children who still depend on her.

With the first loan of S/.300 she purchased beauty products of the Ebel and Unique brand to sell to her friends.

Currently she carries on with the same business in a space that her mother has remodelled to sell products from her home. She also sells clothing, supplying her friends who make cash and credit purchases from her. With this loan of S/1000 she will purchase more clothing to fill orders placed by her friends, so to increase her capital that she has been forming.

She is an independent person and she supports the family expenses with her business. She is grateful for the support that has been given her by the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner), especially because it permits her to grow as a small business owner.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchas items of clothing.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio para ayudar a su madre con quien vive, pues sólo se tienen la una a la otra. Siempre le gustó la comida, sus gustos la motivaron a aprender de cocina, su madre le enseñó a preparar diversos platos y variedad de aperitivos, y desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de comida, pues heredó los dotes culinarios de su madre quien siempre está con ella para ayudarla en la preparación, cuando son grandes cantidades. Al terminar su labor en la cocina sale a repartir los pedidos a las diversas obras de construcción, ya que sus pensionistas son obreros albañiles. Esta actividad le dio la posibilidad de crecer económicamente y de ayudar a su madre, con quien tiene proyectado a futuro, instalar un restaurante para dejar de lado las caminatas y el esfuerzo que tiene que hacer para distribuir los pedidos de comida. Ella es una las seis personas que conforman actualmente su banco comunal, y todas ellas trabajan con mucho esmero para incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar su economía, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP. Los 1500 soles que solicita serán utilizados para la compra de utensilios y muebles para instalar un puesto de comida que pronto estará en funcionamiento, primer paso en la obtención de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is very hardworking and very dedicated to her business to help support her mother with whom she lives, especially because they only have each other. She has always loved food and her tastes motivated her to learn cuisine. Her mother taught her how to prepare many dishes and appetizers. And for a few years she has been selling her foods, having inherited her mother's culinary equipment, although her mother is always helping her cook, especially for large orders. When she is done cooking she goes out to deliver her foods to the different construction yards, with most of her clientele being labourers. Her business has allowed her to grow financially and to help her mother and they hope to set up a restaurant together, to stop altogether the long distances she has to walk to deliver her foods. She is one of six people in the group of her Community Bank, and like them all she works very ardently to increase her earnings and improve her finances. This is her eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). The 1500 soles she is requesting will be used to purchase utensils and furniture to outfit her food stand that will soon be ready to run. This being the first step in establishing her restaurant.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase utensils and furniture for her business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza es una mujer emprendedora y su entrega como madre y esposa es un indicador de la calidad de persona que es. Siempre ha sido responsable, durante el tiempo que trabajó para diversas empresas era muy puntual y rápida con los trabajos, pero un día tomó la determinación de independizarse y tener su propio taller de costura. Pero la falta de máquinas limitaba su trabajo, hasta que adquirió una máquina de coser con la cual viene trabajando desde hace 10 años. Maritza supo aprovechar algunos contactos con empresas para ofrecerles sus servicios como costurera, y la contrataron por temporadas, esto incrementó el costo de su labor, y en poco tiempo tuvo mayores recursos para implementar un taller de costura en su casa donde ha contratado a dos señoritas para cumplir con los trabajos que las diversas empresas le solicitan. Ahora, Maritza tiene el anhelo de ampliar su taller en el segundo piso de su casa, y este paso lo avizora como el inicio de una empresa exitosa. Cerca de siete personas conforman su Banco Comunal en Microfinanzas PRISMA, pero este es su primer crédito individual, oportunidad que se ganó por la responsabilidad que mostró desde hace 4 años. Con los 3500 soles que solicita cubrirá los costos de producción que realiza con cada pedido, además de la cancelación de su nueva máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Maritza is an entrepreneurial woman and it shows in the quality of mother and wife that she is. She has always been very responsible, especially when she worked at various companies she was timely and a very fast worker. But one day she made the determination to go independent and start her own sewing business. But the lack of equipment limited her work until she purchased a sewing machine 10 years ago.

Martiza did take down some contacts with companies to offer her services as a seamstress and contracted temporarily which increased the cost of labor and soon she had the resources to implement a sewing business at her house where she employs two ladies which comply with the requirements for the various companies they service.

Now, Maritza has a desire to expand her studio on the second floor of her house as it is needed to start a successful business. Nearly 7 people make up her microfinance community bank of PRISMA, but this is her first personal loan and it’s an opportunity to show how accountable she has been for the last 4 years. With 3500 soles loan she can cover the cost of production for each order, as well, she cancel the order for the new sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and cancel the order of a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria Huamán R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 316, Distrito de Catac, Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Está separada de su esposo, tiene 06 hijos y solo vive con 01 de ellos.  Los demás son independientes.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.  300.00 compró abarrotes para su tienda instalada  en su propia casa.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, donde vende sus productos a los pobladores de la ciudad de Catac.  Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará fideos, azúcar, aceite, leche, arroz, jabón, detergente, etc.
Siempre fue una mujer independiente y con el negocio que conduce logró darles una profesión a todos sus hijos por ello se siente muy orgullosa.
Manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por seguir confiando en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria Huamán R. belongs to the Community Bank 'The Winners of Catac' and lives at 316 May 31st Avenue in the District of Catac, Recuay Province, Ancash Department. She is separated from her husband, has six children, and lives with just one of them. The others are independent. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 she bought groceries for her store located in her own house. Presently, she continues with the same business where she sells her products to the residents of Catac city. With this loan of S/. 800.00 she will buy noodles, sugar, oil, milk, rice, soap, detergent, etc. She has always been an independent woman and with the business she runs she managed to provide with all her children an occupation which makes her very proud. She expresses her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for continuing to have confidence in her.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy noodles, sugar, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor de Maria tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja Moisés y sus dos hijos, Oscar y Coraima, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 9 años, debido a que es muy habilidosa en las artes culinarias, su madre desde pequeña le enseñó los secretos para obtener deliciosos platillos y siempre la ha ayudado en su trabajo, logrando entre las dos obtener muy buena clientela, la cual es siempre muy fiel a su sazón. Flor de Maria acondicionó un espacio en su casa como un pequeño restaurante, y le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite generar sus propios ingresos y hacerlo de manera independiente, es por ello que le pone muchas ganas a su negocio, con las esperanzas de hacerlo crecer y que en un futuro pueda ser más grande y mejor equipado; y sabe que trabajando mucho logrará todas su metas. Flor de Maria se encuentra en su sétimo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y es muy puntual en sus pagos, ya que su banco comunal es muy exigente con el cumplimiento de las cuotas. Con este nuevo crédito quiere comprar ingredientes al por mayor (alimentos no perecibles), para preparar más platillos, además de ahorrar, ya que gasta más cuando compra diariamente.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria is 34; she lives with her two children, Oscar and Coraima, and their father in her own house. She has been selling meals for nine years. She is very talented in the culinary arts. From the time she was little her mother taught her the secrets to making delicious dishes. She always helped her mother, and together they have obtained good customers who are always very loyal to her cooking. Flor de Maria set up a special place in her house as a small restaurant. She really likes her work because it allows her to generate her own income in an independent manner. For that reason she puts a lot of effort into her business. She works with determination in the hope of making it grow and seeing it become larger and better equipped in the future. She knows that with much work she can achieve her goals. This is Flor de Maria’s seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very punctual with her payments. Her community bank is very demanding about making the payments. With this new loan she will buy ingredients wholesale (non perishables) to make more dishes, not just because of the savings; but she spends more when she shops daily.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Pedro D. 46 años, quien es su compañero desD. hace mucho tiempo, tienen 3 hijos; Nely D. 30, Edwin D. 28 y Elizabeth D. 25 y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila a lado D. su esposo. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. polleras (faldas), mantos y mandiles, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido por los clientes, ya que las prendas que venD. son D. muy buena calidad y tienen costos muy accesibles. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, quienes siempre la mantienen bien informada D. las cosas que suceden en el mercado. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su puesto sin poder realizar otras actividades. Adela anhela para el futuro tener una tienda D. ropa más granD. donD. pueda vender con más comodidad, sabe que su trabajo es sacrificado, pero se siente muy segura D. poder continuar y alcanzar sus metas. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y siempre participa en todas las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más polleras para aumentar el stock D. su puesto, así dará más variedad a su mercadería.
texts.en:
Adela, 56, is a fighter and a hard worker. She lives in her own house with her husband, Pedro, who is 46. They have been together for a very long time. They have three children; Nely, 30; Edwin, 28; and Elizabeth, 25. What she wants most of all is to live her old age tranquilly by her husband’s siD.. She sells polleras (skirts), shawls, and aprons. Her stand is located in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). The market is very well attended by customers since the articles she sells are a very good quality and a reasonable price. What she likes best about her work is talking to the neighboring vendors who always keep her well informed of what is happening in the market. She has been doing this for fifteen years. What she likes the least if having to stay all day insiD. her stand without being able to do anything else. Adela aspires to have a bigger clothing store in the future. Then she could sell more comfortably. She sacrifices a lot for her work, but she feels very secure in being able to continue and reach her goals. This is her second loan with MFP. She was very punctual with her first loan, and she expects to do the same this time as well. She is an active member of her community bank who always participates in the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 46 años, es un padre que siempre se esforzó por darle lo mejor a sus hijos, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Se dedica a la fabricación de artesanías, desde muy joven aprendió esta labor y ahora teje de todo; desde chompas, chalinas, ponchos, chullos (prenda que se usa en la cabeza), etc. Luego de elaborar estas prendas las distribuye en los distintos puestos de venta de las ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y espera para más adelante tener su propio puesto de artesanías, donde él mismo pueda vender los tejidos que realiza. Lo que no le agrada es transportar sus tejidos hasta las ferias, ya que le resulta muy cansado y costoso, aun así sabe que es parte de su trabajo y que tiene que afrontarlo y salir adelante cueste lo que cueste. Este es el tercer préstamo de Antonio con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para fabricar una mayor cantidad de tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 46-year-old father, and home owner, who has always tried very hard to give his children the best. His greatest desire is to improve his family's quality of life. He makes handicrafts for a living, a skill he learned as a young boy. Nowadays he can weave anything from sweaters to scarves to ponchos to hats, etc. After making these articles of clothing he distributes them to various stalls to sell at the fairs in Juliaca. What he likes most about his job is weaving. He’s been doing this for 16 years and hopes to have his own stall to sell his handiwork in the future, where he himself can sell what he makes. What he doesn’t like is transporting his work to the fairs since it’s very tiring and costly, even though he knows that it’s part of his job and he has to do it to get ahead no matter what it takes. This is Antonio’s third loan with MFP. He knows that he has to pay his installments back on time if he wants to receive another loan from his communal bank. He is a very reliable and active member of the bank. He will buy more wool to make a better quality product with the thousand soles he is asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de lana

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es: Bilma tiene 30 años, desde muy joven buscó constantemente la forma de salir adelante, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijas, Sadit de 4 y Melisa de 2 años y lo que más desea es brindarles una buena educación. Es propietaria de una camioneta (combi), la cual a apuesto a trabajar en una empresa de transportes de pasajeros que brinda servicio urbano, ella es la encargada de cobrar los pasajes en dicho transporte, de paso que aprovecha para estar siempre vigilando que no le pase nada a su carro, la ruta que sigue la combi es muy concurrida, por lo cual siempre para está de personas, quienes dejan buenas ganancias al final del día. Lleva 6 años realizando este trabajo, y lo que más le gusta es bromear con los pasajeros, para así hacer más amenos los largos recorridos, para más adelante espera comprar una combi más, y así poco a poco ir creciendo. Lo que le causa mayor dificultad es permanecer todo el día parada viajando, ya que ella aprovecha hasta el último espacio para acomodar a las personas. Este es el tercer préstamo de Bilma con MFP y está muy feliz de la oportunidad, sabe que tiene que invertir el dinero en su negocio para que sea más productivo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita hará arreglar su camioneta para que funcione mejor y brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Bilma is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her two daughters, Sait who is four years old, and Melisa who is two years old. Bilma has looked for ways to get ahead since she was very young and what she desires most is to be able to provide her daughters with a good education. She owns a van (Combi) that she has put to work as in a transportation business serving an urban area. Her job is to collect fairs from riders. She takes advantage of her post to keep an eye on her van to make sure nothing happens to it. The route they travel is very busy, which is why there are always a lot of people from whom they make good money by the end of the day. She’s been doing this work for 6 years and what she likes best is joking with the passengers which makes the long trips more enjoyable. She hopes to buy another Combi in the future and in this way, bit by bit, continue growing. What causes her the most difficulty is that she has to spend the entire day standing while they travel since she gives up the last seat to her clients. This is Bilma's third loan with MFP and she is very happy for the opportunity. She knows that she must invest the money in her business so it can be more productive. She is a very active member of her communal bank. She will makes some repairs to her van with the two thousand soles she's asking for, so it works better, and can provide better service to her passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparación de su camioneta

loans.name: Candy

texts.es: Candy es una joven muy activa y trabajadora, tiene 27 años, es soltera y vive en una habitación  alquilada junto a su único hijo Alberth de 3 años, ella tiene muchas ganas de mejorar su vida y salir adelante. Su negocio es la venta de ropa para niños, vende buzos, pantalones, casacas, etc, en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ofrece a un buen precio y accesible para todos, y como le gusta vender, acaba toda su mercadería. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es trasladar la ropa hasta su puesto de venta, ya que le es muy cansado y el transporte le sale muy caro. Candy tiene 7 años en este negocio y espera incrementar la cantidad de ropa que tiene en stock, porque es conciente que solo así podrá incrementar su economía y darle una mejor educación a su hijo. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y está dispuesta a pagarlo por completo y puntualmente, para acceder a uno nuevo, por ello confía plenamente en que sus compañeras de su banco comunal harán lo mismo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Candy is a young woman, very active and hard working. She is 27 years old, she is single and she lives in a rented room, together with her only son, Alberth, who is 3 years old. She wants so much to improve her life and to be a success. Her business is selling children's clothing including jumpsuits, pants, jackets etc. in the San Jose market (the market is a large market in the city of Juliaca). She offers good deals that are accessible to everyone, and since she likes sales, she always sells out her merchandise. The hardest part of her work is to bring the clothing for sale to her stand - it is very physically taxing and other transportation is very expensive. Candy has been running this business for the past 7 years and she hopes to increase her stocks of clothing. She knows this is the only way she will be able to improve her finances and therefore provide her son with an education. This is her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she is ready and able to pay it off completely and on time, to be elligible for a new loan. She trusts her community bank colleagues completely because they will do the same for her. With the two thousand neuvos soles requested, she will purchase more clothing to increase her sales and improve her income.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Jonatan

texts.es: Jonatan tiene 20 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres, es muy atento y preocupado, además, tiene muchas ganas de forjarse un buen futuro. Se dedica al tejido artesanal, actividad que aprendió desde muy niño de su padre, y es muy feliz realizando este trabajo, puesto que es una actividad que le trae muchos beneficios y con la cual ha podido pagar sus gastos. Jonatan disfruta mucho de trabajar en su máquina de tejer, donde con mucha dedicación coloca los ovillos de lana para la elaboración de sus diversas prendas. Lleva 7 años en esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y pueda tener más máquinas para aumentar su producción, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo, es tejer durante todo el día sin descanso, ya que si no lo hace su producción puede disminuir y sus ganancias bajarían. Jonatan sabe que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero está dispuesto a trabajar duro para mejorar su vida. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y está muy contento por la oportunidad, ya que piensa invertirlo bien, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que siempre es muy respetuoso y responsable. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de tejidos que produce.
texts.en:
Jonatan is 20 years old, he is single and lives at home with his parents. He is very interested and involved, and he wants so much to forge a good future for himself. He is an artesan, having learned knitting as a small child from his father. He is very happy carrying out his work and it has brought him very many benefits, in addition to being able to cover his expenses. Jonatan enjoys sitting at his knitting machine, lovingly setting the spools of wool to create his diverse items of clothing. He has been working at his business for the past 7 years and he hopes that it will grow and later have more knitting machines to increase production. He says the most difficult part of his work is to have to knit an entire day without rest, something he is forced to do so that his production and earnings will not suffer. Jonatan knows his work is very difficult but he is ready to work hard to improve his life. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is very grateful for the opportunity. He plans to invest it the funds. The community bank to which he belongs has high regards for him, always being very respectful and responsible. With the two thousand five hundred neuvos soles he is requesting, he will purchase more wool to increase the quantities of items he creates.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Lenin

texts.es: Lenin tiene 25 años, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila y digna. Cuando tenía 15 años, tuvo que dejar junto a sus queridos padres su natal Conima (Comunidad del departamento de Puno) y buscar un trabajo, puesto que en su casa no tenían el dinero necesario para correr con los gastos familiares, así fue que empezó a trabajar en varios oficios, y después de intentar en muchos trabajos, encontró uno donde se siente muy cómodo. Se siente feliz siendo conductor de una camioneta (combi) urbana y no se puede quejar, ya que este trabajo le da el dinero necesario para ayudar en los gatos a su familia. Ya lleva 5 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es la libertad que tiene en su trabajo, ya que puede conducir tranquilamente por las calles de Juliaca en busca de clientes, aunque lo que menos le gusta es arreglar el carro cuando sufre algún desperfecto. Para el futuro, Lenin anhela tener un negocio más rentable, tal vez un taller mecánico, aun no se decide, pero lo que sí sabe es que tiene que trabajar duro para lograrlo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, quiere pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere causarles problemas a sus compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es uno de los pocos varones y siente que tiene el compromiso de ser muy responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados mandará a reparar las fallas que está presentando su combi.
texts.en:
Lenin is 25 years old, he lives at home with his parents, and his greatest wish is to give them a tranquil and dignified old age. When he was 15 years old, he had to leave his beloved parents and his home town of Conima (a community in the Puno region) in search for work. At home they did not have enough money to cover the family expenses, so this is how he started out working holding various jobs. And after trying out many different types of work, he finally found one where he felt very at home. He is very happy being the driver of a minivan, and he can't complain, because this work provides him with the needed funds to cover the family expenses. He has been working at this job for 5 years now and what he loves best is the freedom in his work. He can calmly drive through the streets of Juliaca looking for clients. The thing he likes least about his work is having to repair the car when it breaks down. In the future Lenin strives to have a more profitable job, perhaps a mechanic's shop, but he hasn't decided that yet. What he does know is that he will have to work very hard to achieve his goals. This is his fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He vows to make his payments on time, to avoid any problems for his colleagues at the community bank. He is one of the few men and he feels like he needs to be especially responsible. With the two thousand neuvos soles requested, he will make some needed repairs to his minivan.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his minivan.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine es una joven soltera muy colaboradora con sus padres, con quienes vive y está involucrada en el progreso económico de su hogar. Las ganas que tiene de apoyar a su familia fueron el punto determinante para empezar a trabajar, buscó muchas posibilidades y eligió hacerlo como costurera en una fábrica de ropa, ya que los pagos que recibe por sus servicios ayudan a cubrir algunas necesidades de la familia. Pero sus deseos están basados en obtener experiencia y dinero suficiente para iniciar su propio negocio dentro de su hogar. El tiempo trabajando en esta fábrica le dio la posibilidad de conocer a varios propietarios, quienes le comunican que gustosos solicitarían sus servicios cuando inicie su negocio propio, y también atendería los pedidos de personas particulares. Katherine está muy contenta porque ya cuenta con una parte del capital para la comprar su máquinas. Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, y en todos estos ciclos de crédito ha trabajado con mucho empeño junto a sus compañeras de grupo, asumiendo todos los retos y sacrificios que requieren para mejorar progresar con su banco comunal. Con los 1000 soles que solicita adquirirá una de las máquinas que requiere para iniciar su negocio propio, el cual promete ser prospero.
texts.en:
Katherine is a single, young, woman who lives with her parents whom she helps out a lot. She is very much involved in the economic progress of the household. She decided to get a job because of her desire to help her family and investigated several possibilities, finally settling on sewing in a clothing factory. The payment she receives helps cover some of her family’s needs. Katherine would like to obtain enough experience and money to start her own business in her home. Since she’s been working at the factory, she has met several property owners who have let her know that they would be happy to hire her once she gets her own business going. She will also honor requests from private clients. Katherine is very happy because she already has part of the capital necessary to buy her machines. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she has worked very hard, together with her fellow bank friends, all of this time taking on the challenges and sacrifices necessary to progress with her communal bank. She will buy the machines she needs for her business with the 1000 soles she’s asking for, which will bring her prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una máquina de costura

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una dulce señora de 51 años, tiene la responsabilidad de velar por el bienestar de su familia, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su expareja quien los abandonó, pero con la ayuda de sus hijas trabajaron muy duro para obtener su casa y algunos bienes. Desde que llegó a la capital buscó la manera de solventar sus gastos, ya que los ahorros que tenía fueron gastados en el día a día. Pero con el apoyo de sus hijas lograron encontrar una actividad que les genera buenos ingresos, esta actividad está ligada a la artesanía, pues realizan adornos a base de retamas (plantas) que traen del norte del Perú y las utilizan para realizar sus artículos, lo cuales venden a las tiendas artesanales del centro de la capital. Las artesanías de doña María  son muy solicitadas por la creatividad que plasma en cada uno de ellas, y frente a esta demanda tiene que trabajar duramente durante todo el día junto a sus hijas para elaborar y distribuir los pedidos semanales, dejando un tiempo de descanso para disfrutar con su familia el fruto de su esfuerzo. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, y su permanencia la ayudó a conocer a las personas con quienes fue asumiendo responsabilidades y retos para lograr el desarrollo del banco que formaron. Los 1000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de materia prima para desarrollar sus artesanías e incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Maria is a sweet woman of 51 years. She is responsible for looking out for the wellbeing of her family, since does not receive any help from his expartner who abandoned them. But with the help of her daughters they worked very hard to buy a house and a few other things. Ever since she arrived in the capital city she sought out ways to cover her expenses. All the savings they had were spent on day to day living. With the support of her daughters they managed to set up a business that generates a good income. Their business is an artesan business, making decorations from plant materials that they bring from northern Peru. They sell their items in artesan shops in the downtown of the capital. Maria's decorations are very popular, given their unique originality in each one. Given the demande she has to work very hard all day long together with her daughters, to make and distribute the weekly orders placed. They always have time to spend with each other to enjoy the fruits of their efforts. This is their eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and their connections helped them meet people who assumed responsibilities and goals and formed the bank they now belong to. With the 1000 soles she is requesting, she will invest the funds in the purchase of materials to create their decorations and increase their production.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for their crafts.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora, los motivos que tiene para progresar son la superación de sus hijos, por quienes se esfuerza día a día, junto a su esposo. La posibilidad de tener su propia su casa le dio la oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comida, pues la ubicación de su domicilio la beneficia. Esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años junto a sus hijos, quienes la apoyan para atender a sus clientes hasta altas horas de la noche, sobre todo los fines de semana, ya que las reuniones sociales elevan el nivel de ventas. Mercedes está ambientando su casa para ofrecer mejores atenciones, ya que hasta la fecha  sólo ha podido atender en la puerta, pero pronto tendrá un lugar adecuado y cómodo para que puedan disfrutar de los deliciosos platillos que prepara con mucha dedicación y cuidado, pues una de las cosas que quiere brindar a sus clientes es garantía de salubridad. Los años que tiene con MFP le sirvieron para desarrollarse como persona y como parte importante dentro de su grupo, ya que la participación solidaria es una de las características de su banco comunal. Los 1700 soles que solicita los usará para comprar alimentos de primera necesidad para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a hard-working woman, she is motivated to progress because of her children, for whom she and her spouse put in a lot of effort every day. The possibility of having her own house gave her the opportunity to start her own business, in food sales, since the location of her home lends itself well to this. She has been doing this for 5 years together with her children, who help her serve her customers until late at night every weekend, since the social meetings increase sales. Mercedes is adapting her house to better serve her customers, because currently she can only serve them at the door, but soon she will have an adequate and comfortable place so that they can enjoy the dishes she prepares with such dedication and care, since one of the things she wants to offer her customers is a guaranty of health sanitation. In the time she has been with MFP, they have helped her develop as a person and as an important part of their group, since supportive participations is one of the characteristics of their communal bank. The S./ 1700 that she requests will be used to buy basic foods for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies for making her dishes

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot es una mujer muy sincera y honesta, tiene 25 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea dar una vejez tranquila. Se dedica a la venta de gas en los mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca, es muy alegre y conversadora, por lo cual sus clientes prefieren comprarle a ella, trabaja muy duro para ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar y no le importa quedarse vendiendo hasta altas horas de la noche con tal de conseguir el dinero deseado. Margot disfruta mucho de conversar son sus vecinas de venta, mientras vende su producto, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es que después de cada día termina muy cansada, ya que tiene que cargar los pesados balones de gas. Pare el futuro, desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender gas y otros productos, para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y por ende su calidad de vida. Es el tercer préstamo de Margot con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más balones de gas, para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.

loans.use: Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nelida a sus 36 años ha pasado por muchos sacrificios para mantener a sus dos hijas, Mayumi de 14 y Lesly de 8 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Richard de 29. A lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para brindarle a su familia las comodidades necesarias, actualmente está en el negocio de la confección y distribución de buzos, realiza pantalones y casacas que distribuye en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca. A Nelida le gusta mucho trabajar en la confección y crear modelos novedosos, aunque siempre le es difícil y demora en armar las prendas parte por parte, en espera de que le queden muy bien. Lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y desea tener en el futuro su propio puesto donde pueda vender sus confecciones, para así mejorar sus ingresos y darle una vida más digna a su familia. Es el tercer préstamo de Nelida con MFP y tiene mucha confianza en que podrá pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy tranquila y disfruta de trabajar en equipo con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará tela para fabricar más buzos y poder distribuir a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Nelida, 36, has experienced many sacrifices in order to support her two daughters; Mayumi, 14; and Lesly, 8. She lives in her own house with her 29 year old husband, Richard. Throughout her life she has worked hard to give her family the necessary comforts. She currently makes and distributes jogging suits. She makes pants and jackets to distribute in different markets in the city of Juliaca. Nelida really likes making and creating new styles, even though it is difficult and takes time to put the articles together piece by piece in the hopes that they fit well. She has been doing this for seven years. In the future, she hopes to have her own place where she can sell her clothing. This way she can improve her earnings and give her family a more decent life. This is Nelida’s third loan with MFP. She is very confidant that she will be able to make all of her payments on time. With her community bank she is very calm. She enjoys working as a team with the rest of her colleagues. With the 2,500 PEN she will buy fabric to make more jogging suits to distribute to other places.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to make more garments

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive en su propia casa, lo que más desea es forjarse un buen porvenir. Es una muchacha muy alegre y bromista, y la encargada de cobrar los pasajes en la combi número 11 que brinda servicio urbano por las calles de Juliaca. Su día comienza muy temprano por la mañana, teniendo que permanecer en su labor hasta casi las 9 de la noche. Ya lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede conversar con sus pasajeros y hacer más ameno el viaje, anhela tener su propia combi. Lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día parada, ya que los pasajeros ocupan todos los asientos. Nilda sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas y está dispuesta a hacerlo con tal de mejorar su vida. Es el tercer préstamo de Nilda con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y lo hará, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida y admirada. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados planea apoyar en el arreglo de la combi donde trabaja, ya que si se malogra tampoco tendrá trabajo.
texts.en:
Nilda, 22, is single and lives in her own house. What she wants most of all is to forge a good future. She is a happy girl who likes to joke. Her job is to collect fares from riders of van number 11, which offers urban transportation service in the streets of Juliaca. Her day starts very early in the morning, and she has to stay at her work until almost nine at night. She has been doing this for two years. What she likes best about her work is being able to talk with the passengers to make the journey more pleasant. Her biggest wish is to have her own van. What she likes least about her work is having to stand all day, because the passengers occupy all of the seats. Nilda knows that she has to work hard to meet her goals, and she is prepared to do so in order to improve her life. This is her third loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay on time, and she will do so. She does not want to cause problems for her community bank where she is a dear and admired member. With the 1,500 PEN she plans to help with the repairs on the van where she works. If the van breaks down, she will not have work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the van she works with

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa tiene 29 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y decidida, vive con su única hija Flor de 3 años en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es que su hija tenga unos buenos estudios. Desde hace 4 años trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros, es la encargada de cobrar los pasajes en la combi numero 12, que brinda servicio urbano por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, su carisma y alegría han hecho que sea una de las cobradoras más conocidas de la empresa, lo cual le ha ayudado a tener más pasajeros que el resto. A Ninfa le gustaría tener su propia combi para conducirla ella misma y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, pero lo que le resulta difícil es permanecer todo el día parada a un costado de la puerta soportando el frío, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y tiene que realizarlo de la mejor manera si quiere progresar en la vida. Es el tercer préstamo de Ninfa con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Ninfa planea invertir los mil nuevos soles que solicita en el arreglo de la combi donde trabaja, ya que gracias a ella tiene un trabajo donde desenvolverse.
texts.en:
Ninfa, 29, is a very hard working and determined woman. She has a three year old daughter, Flor, and they live in her parents’ house. What she wants most of all is to give her daughter a good education. For four years she has worked in passenger transportation. She collects the passenger fares in van number 12, which offers urban service in the streets of the city of Juliaca. Her charm and happiness have made her one of the most well known fare takers in the business. This has helped her have more passengers than the others. Ninfa would like to have her own van to drive. This way she would improve her earnings. What is difficult is standing at the side of the door and putting up with the cold all day long. Even so, she knows that this is her work, and she needs to do it in the best way if she wants to progress in life. This is her third loan with MFP. Just as she has done with her previous loans, she wishes to pay it back on time and without problems. She is much respected in her community bank because she is an active and engaged member. Ninfa plans to use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to fix the van where she works. Thanks to the van, she has a job she can manage.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the van she works with

loans.name: Richar

texts.es: Richar es un joven muy responsable y trabajador, tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive en cuarto alquilado, tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida y mejorar su futuro. Se gana la vida llevando clientes en la combi que maneja, junto a su inseparable amigo y cobrador, recorren las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de personas que deseen tomar la ruta número 12 para llegar a su destino. A Richar le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede recorrer las calles de la ciudad y distraerse, le gusta tanto conducir, que apenas cumplió la mayoría de edad, decidió ponerse a trabajar en una empresa de transportes y ya lleva 3 años en este negocio. Anhela tener algún día su propia combi y administrarla él mismo, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es permanecer todos los días sentado manejando, dejando de lado las cosas que desearía hacer, aun así, sigue trabajado todos los días sin descanso, en busca de alcanzar sus metas y está dispuesto a hacer todo lo posible para lograrlas. Es el segundo préstamo de Richar con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que siendo uno de los pocos varones, no quiere quedar mal ante el resto de sus compañeras. Los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita los aportará en el arreglo de la combi en la que trabaja, para así brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Richar is a very responsible and hardworking young man. He is 21 years old, is single, and lives in a rented room. He would really like to stand out in life and improve his future. He makes a living transporting clients in the minibus he drives. With his inseparable friend that collects money, he travels through the streets of Juliaca city in search of people that wish to take route number 12 to arrive at their destination. Richar really likes his work since he can travel through the city streets and enjoy himself. He likes to drive so much that as soon as he was old enough, he decided to put himself to work at a transportation company. He already has worked in this business for 3 years. He wishes to one day have his own minibus and to manage it himself. He believes the most difficult part of his work is to stay seated every day while driving, leaving behind the things he would like to do. Even so, he continues working every day without rest, in hopes of realizing his goals. He is ready to do everything possible to achieve his goals. This is Richar's second loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to pay all of his installments on time. In his community bank, he is very responsible. Since he is one of the few males, he does not want to look bad in front of the rest of his partners. The one-thousand five-hundred nuevos soles that he is asking for will support them [Richard and his friend] in fixing the minibus in which they work in order to offer a better service to their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the minibus that he uses for work

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem K., 50, lives in the province of Pursat, Cambodia, where she owns and runs a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught this by her grandfather. She is currently a good mother of four children, all four of them are single and help with their mother's farm work when they are not studying. To help meet a little more of the family's needs, her husband makes charcoal for sale.

In the past, Yem K. always hired the neighbor's cow to plow the farmland in order to grow crops. She has been planning to buy a cow but could not due to the family's financial problems. Therefore, she has decided to seek a loan on Kiva to buy a pair of cows to support her farming business.

loans.use: To buy a pair of cows

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila es una mujer de 29 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edwin de 31 años y tiene muchos deseos de progresar y salir adelante. Aunque todavía es joven, sabe que tiene que trabajar mucho para mejorar su vida, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de carteras en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca) donde atiende durante todo el día, siempre que entran clientes los recibe con una sonrisa y los trata muy bien, ya que le gusta mucho vender y conversar con sus clientes. Teofila espera mejorar su puesto incrementando la cantidad de carteras que vende, y de esta manera conseguir más clientes, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio, ya que es muy frígido, pero eso no le es un impedimento para luchar por alcanzar sus sueños de tener una mejor calidad de vida. Teofila se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MPF, y promete pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por las demás socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más carteras y así podrá incrementar el stock de su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Teofila is a 29 year-old woman, is very happy and hardworking, and lives in her own house with her husband, Edwin, who is 31 years-old. She has many wishes to progress and to be successful. Even though she is young, she knows that she has to work a lot to improve her life. She has a small purse stand in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca) where she works all day. Whenever clients enter, she receives them with a smile and treats them very well since she really likes to sell to and converse with her clients. Teofila hopes to improve her stand by increasing the quantity of purses that she sells and thereby attract more clients. What she likes least about her job is spending the entire day inside of her store since it is very cold. However, this is not an obstacle to fighting to realize her dreams of having a better quality of life. Teofila finds herself in her second loan with MPF and promises to pay it back punctually since she does not want to cause problems for her community bank where she is very well-liked by the other members. With the one-thousand five-hundred nuevos soles that she is requesting, she will buy more purses and in this way, she will increase the stock in her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en:
Nhoem M. was born in 1952 and is a resident in the rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. His wife, Chim Morn(pictured) is aged 56. The couple are rice cultivators and they will use the loan money on Kiva to purchase a cow to plow their farmland in order to grow crops during the farming season. 

Beside the farming business, Nhoem M. also catches fish to sell and to cook for the family’s meals. The family now have three children: one is single and two are married and live independently. One of their sons is employed as a local construction worker.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow their farmland

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long L. is a 30-year-old villager in the Pursat Province of Cambodia. She is a local rice farmer and is a good housewife who cares for four teenage children, all four of whom are students. Her husband (pictured) helps meet the family's food needs by driving a motorbike taxi, as well as working as a requirement worker. 

Recently, Long L.’s husband is facing difficulty with his old motorbike that has broken down frequently. In order to solve this problem, Long L. would like a loan to add with her savings for her husband to buy a new motorbike to replace the existing one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to replace the existing one

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Roeun S., 35, lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she owns a plot of farmland for growing crops. Her husband (pictured here)helps her with the farm work, and he also buys oxen from the people who live in rural area to fatten them a while in his house and then sell to make a profit. The couple now lives with three children who are still single. The family doesn't have enough money to equip the village’s cultivating machine in order to support their farm work. In view of the problem, Roeun S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL. She will use 20% of the loan to buy fertilizers to grow crops.

loans.use: To equip the village’s cultivating machine

loans.name: Ailyn Mae

texts.en:
Ailyn Mae D. married at the early age of 18. Her husband is Khem G. D., 23 years of age. Though they don't have children, they consider it a blessing because they are given the time to plan and prepare the beautiful future of their children.

Ailyn runs a fruit-vending business in the market. She has the strong desire to improve this business to bring in more income for the family. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000, her first loan from HSPFI. If granted, Ailyn considers this opportunity as a perfect time to work hard and enhance the business she has.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for her business

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men M. was born in 1939 and his wife, Ouk Ry (shown in the photo) is aged 59. The family earn their daily revenue by growing different kinds of crops on their own farmland. They inherited the farmland from their grandparents who have been dead for a long time. Besides their current farm work, Men M. is also a domestic building worker in the village.

In the past, the family always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to plow their plot of land for growing crops. They want to own a cow and that is why Men M. is applying for a loan to buy a cow so they can use it to plow a field as well as raise its offspring.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Hak P. is 53 years old, married, and is the mother of six children: two are single and the other four are married and live separately. Most of her children are employed at different occupations. Her husband, Yeam, age 62, earns his daily income by providing a lottery service for a commission.

Hak P. currently sells fish and chickens in the local busy market. She has been running her business since early 2000 and is able to make her revenue of $7 each day.  She will use the loan to buy fresh fish to make into dried fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to make into dried fish to sell

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S., a 38-year-old mother of six children, all teenagers and attending school, generates her daily income by selling stone with her husband. Purchasing large stone blocks from people who live near the mountains, they break down and carve them into small pieces, finally selling the pieces to people who need them to build their houses. This stone-selling business is the family's main source of income, and But S. is now applying for a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase additional stone blocks for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional stone blocks for resale.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean K. is a villager in Phnao Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer in the local village. She is now about to cultivate rice because the rainy season is coming. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to conduct this cultivation. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and she will use the rest of money to hire laborers to work on the field.

She is 52 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is working in a company and the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Meas Nhinhj, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C. lives in Pour village in Takeo province and she is farmer. It is now the rainy season so she needs to cultivate rice. In order to grow rice, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. She would use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and fuel to support her field.

Mrs. Sopheap C. is 27 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old. Her husband, Mr. Nget Samith, is a grocer in the local village.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel to support her field

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Mrs. Norn C. is a villager in Leab village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder and she sells duck eggs in the local market. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand this business in order to earn more income to support the family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy ducks for breeding. She hopes to improve her family living.

Her husband, Mr. Haem Keo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land for rice cultivation. Mrs. Norn C. is 45 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is an environment officer while another is employed in a garment factory, one is attending the local school and the others stay at home to do housework to help their parents.

loans.use: To buy ducks for breeding

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mrs. Thol C. lives in Rolus village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She faces a problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad affect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field and to make her crop more productive. She would use the rest of the money to buy ducks to boost her poultry business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Toem Mom, is a hard working man who has been hired by the others villagers to do something. Mrs. Thol C. is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also presented on the left of her in the photo.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun K. is 38 years old and she now lives in Pnao village in the Takeo Province. She is both a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice and a pig breeder. Now she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Additionally, she needs the money to buy piglets and pig food for her pig breeding business. Her husband, Mr. Chhin Troen, is a rice miller who has been hired by the other farmers in the local district. Mrs. Aun K. has six children. Two of them are employed in a garment factory, three are attending the local school, and the youngest is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru: Насимжон Узбеков 1961 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей(на фото сын Узбекова Н). С детства умеет ухаживать за скотом. Он помогал родителям и это ремесло досталось ему от родителей.  Когда он подрос отец ему порекомендовал заняться бизнесом скота. Он сам работает электриком. Сейчас он постепенно передает свой бизнес сыну, когда его вызывают на работу сын ухаживает за скотом. По этому он продолжает развивать бизнес скотоводства. Кредит получил  в первые. На кредит приобрел 2 скота.
texts.en:
Nasimjon U. was born in 1961. He is married and has three children (that's his son in the picture). Since childhood, Nasimjon has cared for cattle. He assisted his parents and learned the trade from them. When he grew up, his father advised him to go into the cattle business. He also works as an electrician. At present he is gradually handing his business over to his son. When Nasimjon goes out on a job, his son cares for the cattle, and therefore he is continuing to develop his cattle business. With the loan he took out, he purchased two head of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Kdep

texts.en: Kdep R. is 34 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City. She currently earns a living as a rice farmer. Beside her farm work, she is a good mother who is caring for three teenage children. All of her children are students in the local public school. Her husband is Mr. Phat (shown in the picture), who is 34 years old and works as a driver for an organization in Phnom Penh. He gets a specific salary of $120 a month in order to help pay for his family's living expenses. Kdep R. hopes to earn additional income with another suitable investment but she is lacking the capital. Therefore, she would like a $500 loan from Kiva to purchase a trailer-motor (tuk tuk) for her husband so that he can begin running a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer-motor

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru: Абдувохид 1981 года рождения , женат детей пока нет. Закончив школу , поступать в университет не смог. Имеет бизнес откорм скота. Сам работает слесарем в автобазе.работа тяжелая но кормить ново создавшую семью необходимо.  Дядя помогает  выводить скот на рынок. По совету и дяди он начал этот бизнес. Первый кредит получил в 2006 году на приобретение одной коровы. Сейчас имеет несколько голов скота благодаря кредит от КИВА и Микроинвест, к тому же он благодарен за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abduvohid was born in 1981. He is married, but has no children yet. He graduated from high school, but was not able to go to college. He has a business raising cattle, but also works as a metalworker at a vehicle depot. It is heavy work, but feeding his new family is a must. His uncle helps transport the cattle to market. Abduvohid started this business on his uncle's advice. He took out his first loan in 2006 to purchase one head of cattle. Now he has several head of cattle thanks to Kiva and MicroInvest loans, and he is grateful to them for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en: Mrs. Doeun T., 36, who lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, earns a living by selling grocery inventory, including cooked food and sweets for children from home, a business she has operated for many years. Doeun is married and currently takes care of four children, all single and attending school, while her husband works as a local trader. He buys and sells cows as well as plots of land on a commission basis. Doeun is requesting a loan to buy three oxen to fatten in her home for resale at a profit and also to purchase extra grocery items for her business.

loans.use: To buy three oxen to fatten for sale.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар Кахорова 1963 года рождения , замужем имеет 2 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. за кредитом обратилась в 2006 году. Кредит потратила на расширение бизнеса. Торгует на рынке конфетами и другими сладостями почти 12 лет. Когда получила первый кредит ей необходимо было провести свадьбу но с оборота денег не хотела  брать. Тогда решила обратиться за кредитом. Провела свадьбу, а бизнес продолжал развиваться. Раньше торговала мелочами. Сейчас благодаря КИВА  расширила свой оборот до большого размера.
texts.en:
Gavhar K. was born in 1963. She is married and has two children, but did not go to college. She came to MicroInvest in 2006 for a loan, which she spent to expand her business. For nearly 12 years, she has sold candy and other sweets at the market. When she received her first loan, she had to put on a wedding, but did not want to take the money out of her working capital, so she decided to apply for a loan. She was able to put on the wedding, and her business continued to grow. In the past she dealt in small items, but thanks to Kiva has increased her turnover dramatically.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Gayrat

texts.ru: Абдуазимов Гайрат Пирмаматович 1973 год рождения ,женат имеет 4 детей .Жена Абдуазимова Турсуной . Место жительства Шахристанский район к/ул. Бураген . Клиент занимается животноводством уже около 10лет .Дома имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота .Клиент берёт заем 1000 сом. на 5 мес. Другой семейный доход  клиент занимается сельском хозяйством и переработкой молока. Кроме этого клиент работает на х/д «Бегбутабобо».На полученный кредит планирует купить бычка на откорм.
texts.en:
Gayrat A. was born in 1973. He is married and has four children. His wife is Tursuna Abduazimova, and they live on Buragen street in Shahristan district. Gayrat has raised cattle for nearly ten years. At home he has seven head of large-horned cattle, and would like to take out a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni. Other family income comes from agriculture and dairy products. In addition, Gayrat works at Begbutabobo. With the loan he will receive, Gayrat plans to purchase a steer to fatten.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Джураев Баходир -мужчина 33 лет. Баходир женат отец 3-х детей. Баходир недавно приехал с Российской Федерации с заработок. Баходир раньше был пастухом. Баходир хочет на полученный займ купит у знакомых пастухов скот и перепродать по выгодной ему цене. Жена Баходира домохозяйка воспитывает детей. Баходир очень рад, что сотрудничает, с нами наш займ является, для него удобным и доступным
texts.en:
Bahodur J. is a 33-year-old man. He is married and the father of three children. Recently, Bahodur returned from Russia where he had been working. In the past, Bahodur was a shepherd. With the loan he will receive, Bahodur wants to purchase livestock from his fellow shepherds and resell it at a profit. Bahodur's wife is a housewife, who raises their children. Bahodur is pleased to collaborate with MicroInvest, as the loan is opportune and affordable.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Муазамов Далер Орифович 1984 год рождения .Женат имеет 1 ребёнка ,жена Абдухамитова Манзура .Место жительства г. Истаравшан пос. Курушкада .Клиент работает на СП «Оби Зулол» работником  техники  безопасности уже около 4 лет . Клиент берёт заем 3000 сом. на 11 мес. Он хочет купить автомобиль .Другой доход-клиент сам мастер по ремонту автомобилей .
texts.en:
M. Daler Orifovich was born in 1984. He is married and has 1 child; his wife is Abduhamitova Manzura. His place of residence is the city of Istaravshan, the village Kurushkada. The client has been working at company “Obi Zulol” as a safety worker for around 4 years now. The client is taking out a loan of 3000 somoni. He would like to buy a car. His other income – the client repairs cars.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a car

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun S. (pictured here) is a 46-year-old, married woman and a good mother who has given birth to four children. They are all teenagers and attend school. Hun S. is a local rice farmer and has been earning around US$ 3 per day since 1990. She is married to Mr. Noun, age 42, who is a domestic ox-trader. He always goes to purchase oxen from the people who live in rural areas. Then he raises the oxen a while in his family home and re-sells them at a profit.

Because Hun S. thinks her husband's business selling oxen is a profitable one and in order to increase his working capital, Hun S. has decided to request US$ 1000 as a loan to buy additional oxen to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional oxen to sell

loans.name: Monadniso

texts.ru: Монаднисо 1983 года рождения , замужем, имеет 2 детей. Закончила  педагогический университет. После этого устроилась в школу своего села, работает педагогом. Нехватка заработной платы пр вела его к тому что она начала разводит дома скот. Раньше муж содержал скот  для собственных нужд. Сейчас из-за нехватки средств занялись бизнесом скотоводства. Год назад посоветовавшись  с мужем она купила  2 коровы что бы можно был откормить и продать позже. От этого им оставался хорошая прибыль , они до сих пор продолжают развивать этот бизнес и благодарны за это КИВА.
texts.en:
Monadniso was born in 1983; she is married and has 2 children. She finished teaching college. After that she got a job at her village school and works as a teacher. Her salary not being enough led her to raising livestock at home. Previously her husband kept livestock for personal needs. Now due to a lack of resources they started a livestock business.
