A year ago after discussing it with her husband, she bought 2 cows so that they could fatten them and resell them later. They were left with good profits from this; they still continue to grow this business and are grateful to KIVA for this.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.ru: Давлятов Хусниддин Аскаралиевич 1973 год рождения ,образование высшее .Женат, имеет 1 ребёнка ,жена Муротова Ширин .Место жительства Шахристанский район р. Шахристан .Клиент занимается животноводством уже около 10 лет .Клиент берёт заем 1600 сом .на 5 мес.для выращивания и откорма скота .Дополнительный семейный доход клиент занимается переработкой молока и сельским хозяйством.Хусниддин планирует продолжить сотрудничество с нашей оранизацией.На следующие кредиты он хочет построить большой просторный коровник.
texts.en:
D. Husniddin Askaralievich was born in 1973. He has a university diploma. He is married with one child. Husniddin and his wife, Shireen Murotova. live in Shakhristan. For the past ten years Husniddin has been involved in cattle breeding. He also earns money from milk processing and agriculture. Husniddin is applying for a 1600-som loan that he is planning to repay within five months. Husniddin is planning to cooperation with our organization. He would like to use future loans for building a large, spacious barn.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ismatullohoja

texts.ru: Исматуллохожа 1983 года рождения , раньше его отец получал кредит на откорм скота в 2006 году, сейчас передал свой бизнес ему. Более 30 лет отец ухаживал , разводил  скот. Дело не легкое , в холодное время необходимо запастись кормом и жмыхом. Всему этому ему показывал отец и своевременно давал советы. Благодаря поддержки КИВА поголовье скота увеличилось и сейчас находится на пастбище. И так будет находиться до глубокой осени.
texts.en:
Ismatullohoja was both in 1983. He overtook the business of his father, who used to be our client and spent over 30 years doing cattle farming. Cattle farming is not easy - one needs to stock a lot of fodder. The father passed his knowledge onto the son and helps him with advice. Thanks to Kiva's support the family has now more cattle, which will stay on the pastures till late fall.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dushaboi

texts.ru: Гафоров Душабой Наврузбойевич 1971 год рождения ,образование выше , национальность узбек .Место жительства Шахристанский район  к/ул. Бураген.Клиент берёт заем для животноводства. Дома имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота .Клиент занимается животноводством уже около 12 лет .Он берёт заем 1600 сом. на 5 мес.Дополнительный семейный доход клиент занимается сельским хозяйством и он член ФСХ «Ибрат».На полученный кредит планирует купить дойную корову.
texts.en:
Dushaboi G. was born in 1971. He has a university diploma. He is Uzbek. He resides in Shahristan. For about 12 years he has been involved in cattle farming, and he is going to use his loan for the purchase of a dairy cow. He already has 7 cows at home. He earns additional money in agriculture. He is a member of FSH Ibrat.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Avazzhon

texts.ru: Эргашев Авазжон- мужчина 19 лет. Образование среднее. Занимается продажей скота. Авазжон хочет купить стадо овец и перепродать на рынках Аппон и Булок Аштского района. Авазжону присматривать за скотом помогает отец и брат. Авазжон покупает скот с Киргизии у чабанов. Также у Авазжона есть  знакомые клиенты мясники, которые покупают у него скот. Когда у Авазжона дело пойдут хорошо он хочет поступить в университет  и получить высшее образование.
texts.en:
Avazzhon E. is 19 years old and has a high school diploma. He buys cattle from sheep herders in Kyrgyzstan and sells it to his regular clients (butchers). Avazzhon would like to purchase a herd of sheep in order to resell them at Appon and Bulok markets of Ashtsky region. Avazzon's father and brother helps him in his business. If his business runs well, Avazzon will be able to enter a university and get higher education.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Tavakkal

texts.ru: Муминов Таваккал Рачаббоевич 1974 год рождения ,женат имеет 3 детей .Жена Нематова Хусния .Место жительства г. Истаравшан к. Суфи-Ориф .Клиент берёт заем для сельского хозяйства ,он занимается  этим уже около 10 лет .Кроме этого он ,ему помогает жена .Клиент берёт заем 1200 сом. на 10мес. Дополнительный   семейный доход клиент занимается частными строительными работами.
texts.en:
Tavakkal M. was born in 1974 and is married with 3 children. He and his wife, Husniya Nematova, reside in Sufi-Orif, Istaravshan. For the past 10 years Tavakkal has been working in agriculture. His wife helps him around. He earns extra cash by doing construction work. He is planning to use his loan for planting onions.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plant onions

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
" I was working in Singapore before, and my earnings were used to construct our house all made of concrete, and to start a new business. I stopped working abroad because I wanted to see my children grow up. Now, I am engaged in a commercial business which really helps me to be able to contribute to the family income," says Marichu B., 42-year-old mother of two children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. She thinks that with her loan, she could be able to grow her business even more.

CEVI is helping promote small business growth. They provide not only credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Ahmad Tabash Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Tabash is the group leader of Ahmad Tabash group. There are three members in this group and they want to expand and progress their businesses. They have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani.

Aahmad Tabash wants to take a loan for his video shop.

Farhnaz wants to take a loan for her bead-working business. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business.

Balqas wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new machine for her business.

They are confident that, with the money they receive, they can have a good profit and can run their businesses in a good way. They say that it will support the entrepreneurs a lot.

loans.use: To expand his video shop

loans.name: Muhtorali

texts.ru: Мухторали 43 года. Он женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Мухторали занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление лета для Мухторали – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Мухторали экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Мухторали продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Muhtorali is 43 years old. He is married and is a father of three children. His wife does not work. She stays at home and does housework and feeds the cattle. Muhtorali breeds and sells cattle. The summer is the season to buy cattle for Muhtarali because in the spring the cattle and fodder cost cheaper. So he does not have to spend a lot. The cattle eats mountain grass and Muhtorali saves on the fodder. With the arrival of winter he sells part of the grown cattle, but he does not buy more. He buys fodder for feeding of the rest of the cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
" I started my business using my own savings of Php 2,000. I was a saleslady before in a mall and I was not happy about my job and decided to quit. I'm happy with my business now. I am the boss of my own business and hope to make it prosper in the coming months. The income that I get from fish selling really helps a lot in buying all our needs," says Merlinda F., 38-year-old mother of six children.

She would like to add to the amount of fish she sells. She wants to access a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional fish to sell. The loan will really help her increase the income for her family.

CEVI provides credit to support small business growth. In addition to that, they also offer training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Раъно Массобирова - женщина средних лет, 1958 года рождения. Разведена и имеет 2-х детей. Раъно развелась с мужем много лет назад, и теперь живет со своими детьми и растит их одна. Она открыла лавку у своего дома и продает там разные товары и принадлежности для хозяйства. Недавно она закупила мужскую обувь (кроссовки), чтобы расширить свой ассортимент. Раъно кредитуется в нашей организации уже три года. За этот период она расширила ассортимент своего товара и расширила свой бизнес. За это она благодарна кредиторам за поддержку в ее бизнесе.
texts.en:
Rano M. is a middle age woman, she was born in 1958. She is divorced and has two children. Rano has divorced her husband many years ago and now lives with her children and raises them by herself. She has opened a small kiosk next to her house where she sells different kind of products for home. Just recently she bought men's shoes (sneakers) to expand the assortment of goods. Rano has been taking loans from our organization for three years now. During this time she has increased the assortment of her merchandise and expanded her business. She is grateful to the lenders for the support of her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of household products and shoes

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
"I sell fish and earn enough money for my family. My husband is a fisherman and all his catch is mainly intended for our own consumption. Aside from selling fish, I have a store where I sell various types of goods to supplement our income. My store business is doing great and I hope to maintain the good sales in the coming days," says Anabel D., 35-year-old mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store and fishing materials for her fishing boats. She thinks that by accessing loans to improve her fish selling and store, she will earn better income for her family.

CEVI gives not just loans; they also provide training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additonal merchandise for her store and fishing materials for her fishing boats

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Гулнора- женщина 30 лет. Замужем мать 2-х детей. По специальности Гулнора Врач-Акушер. Работает в родильном доме акушеркой. Так у нее заработная плата маленькая она вынуждена найти дополнительный источник доходов. Поэтому она занимается купли продажей скота, который дает хороший, прибыл. На полученный займ она хочет, купит овец, и перепродать на рынке. В свободное время Гулнора занимается переработкой пряжи. Гулнора  признательный,а  что кредитуется у нас ей нравятся все наши условия.
texts.en:
A. Gulnora is a 30 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 2 children. Gulnora is an obstetrician by profession and works at a women’s hospital as an obstetrician. Because her salary is low she needed to find an additional source of income. This is why she buys and sells livestock which provides a good income. She would like to use her loan to purchase sheep and to resell them at the market. In her free time, Gulnora processes yarn. Gulnora is grateful that she is our borrower, she likes all of our terms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa T. owns a small parcel of land. She is 34 years old and has 5 children. Her husband, Domingo T., is also a farmer. They have been tilling land since the start of their marriage.

" I would like to access a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. I have just started improving the size of my farm. I need enough capital to buy 1 quart of herbicides and insecticides", she said. Marissa believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest from her farm. In that way, she will be able to buy her children everything they need.

CEVI provides not just loans. CEVI also offers training and insurance coverage as well to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase 1 quart of herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Urazgul

texts.ru: Уразгул – молодая женщина 23 лет, замужем но пока детей не имеет. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как Уразгул готовится стать матерью. За счет займа Уразгул и её муж хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли. Уразгул кредитуется в нашей организации больше одного года. Это ее третий займ за этот период. Уразгул всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ и поэтому она смогла помочь мужу для увеличения количества своего скота. Она благодарит нас и КИВУ за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Urazgul is a young 23 year old woman, married, but does not have children yet. Her husband is in the business of buying and reselling cattle on the market. She feeds the cattle at home. She helps her husband in growing of the business because she wants to make more profit to expand their family as Urazgul is getting ready to become a mother. Urazgul and her husband want to use the loan to increase the number of cattle and make more profit. Urazgul has been taking out loans from our organization for more than one year. This is her third loan. Urazgul has been always using the loans purposefully and this is why she was able to help her husband to increase the number of cattle. She is thanking us and Kiva for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Nasema Group

texts.en:
Nasema is the group leader of Nasema group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for their business, so the have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani.

Nasema wants to take a loan for her bakery business that she runs from her house. With this loan she wants to buy stock for her bakery.

Makey wants to take a loan for her husband’s vegetable shop. He wants to buy necessary materials for his business.

Ghancha Gull wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store.

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock for her bakery

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Рахматуллоева  Фотима- женщина 57 лет. Фотима мать 4-х детей. Муж у Фотимы нету, поэтому она вынуждена сама воспитывать детей. Фотима занимает купле продажей скота. Старший сын Фотимы находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Фотима со своей невесткой также занимаются переработкой  пряжи. Накопив, деньги Фотима хочет выдать замуж дочку, поэтому она должна заработать на свадьбу. Сын также высылает деньги. Фотима очень рада, что с нами сотрудничать.
texts.en:
Fotima R. is 57 years old and a mother of 4 children. She has no husband and, thus, has to raise her children by herself. Fotima is involved in livestock sales. Her oldest son is a migrant worker, currently living in Russia. Fotima and her daughter-in-law are also involved in yarn processing. Fotima wants to save money for her daughter’s wedding. Her son also sends money home. Fotima is very happy to be collaborating with us.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok T. is 44 years old and a married woman. She currently lives in Kompong Cham Province where she earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house, raising them for their offspring and for slaughter. She has been running her business for years. Her husband's name is Phon (shown in the photo), age 50, who works with her business raising pigs. Beside the pig-raising, they also cultivate rice during the farming season.

The couple has five children who are single. Two of their children are employed: one daughter is a garment worker in Phnom Penh City and one son is a local farmer. Sok T. will use all the loan to purchase feed and piglets to raise and to support the entire farming business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
"I work on a 1-hectare farm. My parents owned the farm and we have been working it for 15 years already. Aside from the farm, I raise ducks. There 300 ducks in my farm which I use to supplement my income," says Nestor R., 39 years old, not yet married, from Agusan Del Sur. He would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase 2 sacks of feed for ducklings and 1 sack of fertilizer. The loan will help grow his duck and rice farm business.

CEVI aims to help small businesses to grow. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of feed for ducklings and 1 sack of fertilizer

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina R. is the mother of 5 children. Her husband is an on-call carpenter and, at the same time, a farmer. Life hasn't been that easy for the two of them, especially since they have 5 children to raise. Segundina's initiative in helping her husband is through her variety store where they live.

Though her store appears to have a lot of customers, Segundina has to know a lot and update her business according to the needs of her customers to be able to supply their demands. For that purpose, she is requesting the loan amount of PHP 11,000 from HSPFI as a micro-finance loan.

loans.use: purchase stocks for her variety store and ingredients for her food display

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Mr. Kean R. is 44 years old and lives in Kompong Cham Province. He earns a living raising pigs in a stall behind his house and sells them for slaughter six months after he begins raising them. His wife, Em Soeun, 39, helps him in raising pigs. The family are widely known and can raise at least two pigs per year.

They have four children, all of whom are single. To help meet the family's food needs, two of their children are employed in different jobs: one son is a construction worker and one daughter is a garment worker. Kean R. is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to buy more feed and piglets to raise for profit.

loans.use: To buy more feed and piglets to raise for profit

loans.name: Irsalat

texts.ru: Ирсалат женщина 50 лет. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Ирсалат откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Ирсалат продает их на скотном рынке. Ирсалат кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она успешно закончила два предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Ирсалат планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ирсалат очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Irsalat is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. Together with her husband, she is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Irsalat feeds the livestock at home; then, once the livestock is ready, Irsalat’s husband sells it at the market. She has been a borrower at our organization for 1 year. She successfully repaid two previous loans and now wants to obtain another one. Irsalat plans to increase the quantity of her livestock, which will increase profits for her family. Irsalat likes the terms of our lending very much, and happy that there are such organizations that support the society.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling livestock

loans.name: Kodir

texts.ru: Кодир Хусанов проживает в районе Турсунзода. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Кодир уже 24 года занимается земледелием. Это является основным источником дохода. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы закупить зерно пшеницы, посеить, собрать и продать.
texts.en:
Kodir H. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. Kodir has been involved in agriculture for 24 years. This is his main income source. He wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase wheat seeds to sow, harvest and sell.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Tursunjon

texts.ru: Ширинбекова Турсунжон- женшина 39 лет. Замужем мать 2-х детей. Турсунжон занимается купли продажей скота. Имеет большой работы в сфере купли продажи скота.  Турсунжон третьей раз получает кредит у нас и ей очень нравятся наши условия. Муж Турсунжона находится в Российской Федерации на заработках и высылает своей семье деньги. У Турсунжона есть дойная корова, который приносит хороший прибыл семейному бюджету. Сын Турсунжона в этом году заканчивает школу Турсунжон   хочет чтобы его сын поступил в ВУЗ.
texts.en:
Tursunjon S. is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. She is involved in livestock sales. She has a lot of experience in the field of livestock sales. This is Tursunjon’s third loan, and she likes our lending terms. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and sends money to his family. Tursunjon owns a dairy cow that brings a good income to the family budget. Tursunjon’s son is graduating from school this year, and she wants him to get accepted to a university.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru: Немат Узоков проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Немат занимается земледелием со своим сыном. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Старший сын тоже работает таксистом. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы закупить зерно пшеницы. А в дальнейшем собрать благоприятный посев для продажи.
texts.en:
Nemat U. live in Tursunzode. He is 46 years old and is married with 4 children. Nemat and his son are agricultural workers. Nemat has been working in agriculture for over 20 years. His elder son works as a taxi driver. Nemat is applying for a loan in order to purchase wheat grain. He would plant it and sell the harvest later.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wheat grain

loans.name: Shodimurat

texts.ru: Шодимурат Мамараупов проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Шодимурат занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 8 лет. Старший сын находится на заработках в России. Младший помогает отцу по бизнесу. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы закупить минералы. И использовав, собрать хороший урожай для продажи. А на полученный доход хочет улучшить жилой быт, т.е. купить мебель.
texts.en:
Shodimurat M. lives in Tursunzade. He is 54 years old and is married with 3 children. His elder son works in Russia. Shodimurat is an agricultural worker. He has been working in agriculture for over 8 years. Shodimurat is planning to use the loan for the purchase of fertilizers. He is planning to get a good harvest, sell the produce and buy furniture.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая женщина 21 года. Она замужем но пока детей не имеет. Шахноза занимается пошивом женской одежды на заказ. Она училась у хорошей швеи пол года. Теперь она самостоятельно берет заказы и шьет разную женскую одежду, в том числе национальные платья, юбки, сорочки, брюки и т.д. Шахноза впервые берет кредит в нашей организации. Она хочет приобрести машину "Аверлог" для своего дела. Шахноза надеется, что кредит поможет ей расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a young 21-year-old woman. She is married, but does not yet have children. Shahnoza is involved in making custom-tailored women’s clothing. She spent six months learning the craft from a good tailor. Currently, she takes orders on her own and sews different women’s clothing, including traditional dresses, skirts, night gowns, pants, etc. This is Shahnoza’s first time obtaining a loan at our organization. She wants to purchase the Averlog sewing machine for her business. Shahnoza hopes that this loan will help her expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Oltinoy

texts.ru: Сохибова Олтиной- женщина 44 лет. Замужем мать 4-х детей. Олтиной занимает торговлей женских тканей. Олтиной закупает товар на рынках «Гули Сурх» города Истаравшана и Атушбазара Б. Гафуровского района. Олтиной второй год как кредитуется у нас. В свободное время она занимается переработкой пряжи. Олтиной имеет 10-летный стаж в сфере торговли. Олтиной торгует на рынках Оппон и Мархамата Аштского района.
texts.en:
Oltinoy S. is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. She is involved in sales of women’s fabrics. Oltinoy buys her goods at the Guli Surh markets in the cities of Istaravshan and Atushbazar in the B. Gafurov district. This is Oltinoy’s second year of working with our organization. During her free time, she processes yarn. Oltinoy has 10 years of experience in the sales field. She sells at the Oppon and Marhamata markets in the Asht district.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of women's fabrics

loans.name: Fred's Group

texts.en:
K. Fred is the leader of Mabira development group. He is a 38-year-old married man with 5 children aged 13  to 5 months as he cares for 6 dependents. He is a hard-working man with a drive to succeed in life, with a business of a cosmetics shop and a salon. 

He started his business 9 years ago and usually his business type being seasonal affects his income somehow as does the limited capital that he has. He has been a member of his lending group for 9 years and the 26 loans he has received so far have helped him in restocking his shop. He works so hard in order to ensure that his children attain the best education as well as to be able to build a respectable family house. Fred needs a new loan to help purchase more stock in large quantities.

loans.use: Buying more salon stock and cosmetics for his shop.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод Худойкулов проживает в районе Турсунзода. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Дилшод уже более 5 лет занимается животноводством. До этого он работал по своей специальности, крановщиком 10 лет. Т.к. заработной платы не хватало, он решил заняться своим бизнесом. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы приобрести бычка для откармливания и в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en:
Dilshod H. lives in Tursunzode. He is 33 years and is married with 4 children. Dilshod has been doing cattle farming for over five years. He had spent 10 previous years working as a crane operator. Since his salary was not enough, he decided to start a business. He is applying for a loan in order to buy a bull calf that he would raise and sell.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita A. is a farmer. She owns a small parcel of land and grows rice for her family. Her husband manages their farm. They work very hard to be able to provide the needs of their family. "We started farming a small hectare farm. Because it is small, we also have a small harvest. We have just finished harvesting our rice. Now we are starting to prepare the land for the next planting," she said.

She would like to ask a loan of  5000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase 1 quart of herbicide and fertilizer.

CEVI is reaching a lot of farmers in the Philippines. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase 1 quart of herbicide and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Satorullo

texts.ru: Саторулло Джураев живет в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Саторулло более 20 лет занимается земледелием. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить зерна и минералы. Он хочет посеить пшеницу и картофель. Ему в этом помогают сыновья. На полученный доход от земледелия, хочет сыграть свадьбу сыну.
texts.en:
Satorullo J. resides in Tursunzade. He is 43 years old and is married with 5 children. Satorullo has been an agricultural worker for the past 20 years. He is applying for a loan in order to plant wheat and potatoes. His sons help him around. He would like to use the profit from the harvest for his son's wedding.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grain and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Z. Paul is the leader of Kwesitukira group in Lugazi. He is a friendly and hard-working man with a farming business, selling produce mostly from his farm. During the 10 years that he has run this business, he has been faced with a few challenges, like the high transport costs to deliver his produce to his customers, and the high cost of purchasing the produce when he does not have enough to supply to his customers.

This is his 14th loan from his group and he is able to make a profit of 200,000 UGX in a month. Paul has a dream of buying his own truck to transport his goods, as well as having an educated family. He is a 41-year-old married man with 10 children; the eldest is 21 years old and in school. He also cares for 10 dependents, some of whom are orphans. He requests a loan to purchase produce like cassava and sweet potatoes for his business.

loans.use: Buy more produce (cassava and sweet potatoes) to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
"I started tilling a small parcel of rice farm. I am also a tricycle driver. When I am not busy driving, I check the farm to ensure a good harvest for our family," says Mr. Robert M., 32-year-old father of two children.

He is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from CEVI. He plans to use the loan to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizers. The loan will really help increase his harvest and income as well.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase 2 sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Nosirjon

texts.ru: Мусоев Носирчон проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 26 лет. Женат, имеет одного сына. Носирчон занимается земледелием более 3 лет. Помимо этого, он  еще работает трактористом 5 лет. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы минералы и посеить овощи. А на полученный доход хочет сделать дома пристройку.
texts.en:
Nosirjon M. lives in Tursunzade. He is 26 years old and is married with one son. Nosirjon has been an agricultural worker for 3 years, and he has also been a tractorist for 5 years. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase minerals and plant vegetables. He would like to use the profit for expanding his house.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem H., 32, lives in Kompong Cham Province where she owns and runs a pigpen next to her home. The pigs she raises can be sold to the slaughterhouse within three months after she begins to raise them. She can make several sales each year. Her husband, Oun Loung, 33, works with her in the business. The couple is very responsible to their two children who still live in the family home. To make the family's transportation easier, Hem H. is applying for a loan to purchase a used vehicle for the family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase a used vehicle for the family's needs

loans.name: Nabijon

texts.ru: Джуманов Набижон- мужчина 32 лет. Набижон женат отец 4-х детей. Набижон занимается торговлей скота. С 2008 году он кредитуется в нашей организации. Набижон покупает скот в Киргизии. Набижон параллельно занимается переработкой сельхоз культур. Набижон на полученный займ хочет купить овец и перепродать мясникам по выгодной цене.
texts.en:
Nabijon D. is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. He is involved in livestock sales. He has been a borrower at our organization since 2008. Nabijon buys livestock in Kyrgyztan. He is also involved in agriculture. Nabijon wants to use this loan to purchase sheep and resell them to butchers at a profitable price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.ru: Эшов Хабабуло проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Хабибуло занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Старший сын находится на заработках в России. А другие помогают отцу по бизнесу. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить семена пшеницы для посева. А потом собрав, продать. На полученный доход от бизнеса, хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Habibulo E. lives in Tursunzade. He is 46 years old and is married with 7 children. He is an agricultural worker, and he has been for 20 years. His elder son works in Russia and the others help his father. Habibulo is planning to use the loan for the purchase of wheat. He would like to plant wheat and sell the harvest. He will use the profit for home renovation.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wheat grain

loans.name: Phina's Group

texts.en: S. Phina is the leader of Ddembe group in Lugazi. She is a hard working and friendly poultry farmer in Buikwe town where she keeps 600 chicks (400 layers and 200 broilers) for both eggs and meat. She has had her business since 1995 and is now able to make a weekly profit of 150,000 shillings. She dreams of increasing the number of chicks to 300 broilers and 800 layers with a hope to increase her income and profits. She also hopes to have a better family house and to see all her children attain the best education. She is a widow with 4 children, aged 16 to 27, and cares for 7 dependants. This is Phina's thirtieth loan and it will help her purchase more chicks to increase her stock and the supplies to feed them.

loans.use: To increase her stock of chicks and feed.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Юнусова Мехринисо занимается животноводством, более 5 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Возраст 35 лет. Проживает она в районе Турсунзаде. Муж находится в России, на заработках. Мехринисо с сыном продолжает деятельность мужа. Она просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить бычка, для откармливания. А в дальнешем продать.
texts.en:
Mehriniso Y. has been doing cattle farming for over five years. She is 35 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Tursunzade. Her husband works in Russia while she and her son continue the business her husband started. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase a bull calf which she plans to sell at a profit later.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice N. is the leader of the Twezimbe group in Lugazi. She is a hard working lady. She has been farming and selling agricultural products since she was married in 1963,. She grows food for her customers and for home consumption and she is able to make a profit of 50,000 per week. Her dream is to expand her farming practices. With her share of this loan, she is going to grow and sell tomatoes and she hopes to make something big out of it.

Alice is a widow with six children. She also cares for eleven dependents, including her step children who have no mothers.

loans.use: To buy supplies to grow tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.ru: Юсуф Азизов проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 44 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Старший сын в России, на заработках. Юсуф печет хлеб для продажи. В этом ему помогает вся семья. Этим видом бизнеса занимается, более 20 лет. Юсуф просит к нас кредит, чтобы построить еще одну национальную хлебопечку. Чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Yusuf A. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. He is 44 years old. He is married and has four children. His oldest son is workign in Russia. Yusuf makes bread for resale. His whole family is helping him in this. He has been in this business for more than 20 years. Yusuf is asking for a loan to build one more national bakery to increase his turnaround.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng M. and her husband Kimheng are both 27 years old and reside in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. They own a plot of land close to their village where they make a living as vegetable cultivators. They grow crops like cabbages, morning glories, cucumbers, and Chinese kale and they are able to plant twice a year. Besides their farm work, Kimheng also repairs boats. The family have three children, who are all single and attending school.

Heng M. is applying for a loan to purchase boat repair materials to support her husband's business. She plans to use some of the loan for farming activities.

She and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase boat repair materials.

loans.name: Barbara's Group

texts.en:
Barbara S. is the leader of the Kisimba group in Lugazi. She is 29 years old and married with three children, aged between five and ten years. She also cares for five more dependents.

Barbara is a determined and hard-working lady with a grocery business. She has sold farm produce for five years in the Najja trading centre. This is her third loan with the group and she is happy that the loans have helped her increase her stock and maintain it, even in instances where she has to repay her loan. She plans to own a well-stocked grocery with nothing missing. With her determination, she believes she will achieve it.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce for her store.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila C. has been selling fish since 1999. She is 48 years old and has nine children. Her husband, Capistrano C., is a fisherman but the fish her husband catches is mainly intended for family consumption. Leonila buys fish from other fishermen and sells them to the village with a 40% mark-up value to earn a living. She has a big family and she and her husband really work very hard to meet all their needs.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials, like baits and nets. She will also buy more fish to sell in the village.

CEVI provides people with not just loans. They also offer training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials, like baits and nets, and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah N. is 49 years old. She is the leader of Kisimba group in Lugazi. She is a devoted and hard-working lady. She has had a clothing store for 20 years in the Najja trading centre.

She is married with seven children. Two of her children are graduates while five are still in school. She cares for twelve dependents, though she does not stay with all of them.

Faridah has been successful in business because of her networking tricks and good customer care. She makes sure that she knows what is available at the market and ensures that her customers get the best outfits. She needs a loan to help restock her shop with more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
"I learn now how to manage and market my product well to people to sustain my business. I am a homemaker but I am not content to just sit in the house and take care of our seven children. I buy old, not functional pumpboat engines. What I do is repair them and sell them to fishermen. I really want to help my husband earn a living to buy our needs," says Estrella L. , a 43-year-old from Talibon, Bohol.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will really help a lot to grow her business even more.

CEVI provides credit assistance to support small businesses. It also provides training and insurance coverage services to all clients to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her business

loans.name: Nasreen Younas Masih Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of Y. M., who has lived in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Nasreen baji is a very hard-working lady. She manages all her household work and keeps her family happy. Her husband belongs to a cloth-selling business. He buys cloth from a city famous for its varieties named Lahore and sells to his native city Vehari. He has 6 years of experience in this business. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy cloth for her husband’s cloth-selling business.

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Shaista baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy a movie camera for her movie-making business. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy ready-made garments to sell. Naziran begum baji wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cloth for cloth selling business

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila L. is from the village of Mansabay. She is 66 years old. Zoila is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Zoila owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zoila has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Zoila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zoila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Zoila is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Zoila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey N., 38, lives in Kampong Chhnang Province where she earns her living growing rice and vegetable crops on her own farmland. She takes 3 months to grow those crops and then she sells them when they are mature, earning on average US$ 2 a day. She has been growing them for over ten years now, so she has a lot of experience.

Mey N. is married and has six children, two of whom are employed: one is a garment worker and the other one works as a dealer in a casino. Her husband, Somnang, age 41, is a generator repairer. The family has been building their house for a long time but the construction is still not completed. Therefore, Mey N. has decided to request a loan on Kiva in order to use it to finish building their house.

loans.use: To finish building their house

loans.name: Jamila Begum John Masih Group

texts.en:
Jamila begum baji has been a citizen of a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is an uneducated lady; she wanted to study but her father couldn’t pay for her education expenses because he had few financial resources. Her husband is a salesman and sells candies to shops. He has 2 years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to buy candies wholesale so that he will be able to sell them to the shopkeepers and earn more income.

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Sheena Mahak baji wants a loan to buy medicines to resell. Kishwar baji wants a loan to buy computer spare parts to sell. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Salma baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: buying candies wholesale to sell to shops

loans.name: Noor Suraiya M.ameen Group

texts.en:
Noor Suraiya baji is the wife of M. A. who has lived in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband is a tailor and runs a tailoring center in the community. He charges for simple stitching US$ 2 and for designer clothes US$ 3. Noor baji also operates a cottage knitting business to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine for her husband’s tailoring center.

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Nasir Gull baji and Saima Mai baji and Maryam baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Akhtari baji wants a loan to buy paints to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for tailoring center

loans.name: Suraiya Karamat Masih Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is a citizen of a mid-sized city named Vehari, Pakistan. She is a very hard-working lady. She sews clothes day and night and earns money. She saves her income for a rainy day. Her husband prepares embroidered dresses on orders which he collects from the clothes shops. He completes 1 dress in 15 days. Suraiya baji is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) so that her husband fill the orders of his customers.

Suraiya baji is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread) for her embroidery business. Abida baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Shazia khursheed baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for embroidered clothes

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo C. owns a boat. He uses it for transportation service. People hire him to bring them to the neighboring islands or to the mainland. Bernardo is the 49-year-old father of 2 children. His wife, Diosdada C., is very supportive of him and his business.

While he takes care of their livelihood, his wife takes good care of their children. He needs a loan of Php 4,000 to repair his boat. Repair will cost a big amount and what he has is not enough to pay for the repair without the loan to add to his savings.

CEVI reaches out to a lot of poor communities to allow people to start up and run their own business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To repair his boat

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy C. is from the village of Barra Puntod. She is 44 years old. Lucy is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucy owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Lucy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lucy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lucy is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Lucy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rozi Begum Michael John Masih Group

texts.en:
Rozi begum baji is the wife of M. J. M. who has lived in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband runs a tailoring center in the community where he stitches clothes for people and charges them different rates. He charges US$ 2 for simple stitching and US$ 3 for designer clothes.

Rozi baji also prepares embroidered dresses on orders which she collects from clothing shops. She saves her income in a "committee" and plans to renovate her house when it is her turn to get the full "committee" amount. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her husband’s tailoring center.

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Christina Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy medicines to resell. Bable baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rukhsana Rani baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven S., 35, is a domestic rice trader. She owns a rice-mill in her home which she uses to hull rice to earn a profit. She usually goes to buy rice in bulk from people who live in rural area, then stores the rice in her home for sale or hulling. Her husband (pictured), works with her in hulling rice as well as buying and selling oxen for earning additional profit. Most of their customers are village rice farmers.

Because this is the rice-harvesting season, Ven S. hopes to buy rice to store in order to resell it later to gain income but she is lacking capital. That is why she has decided to request a loan from Kiva's partner HKL.

loans.use: To buy rice to store

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Mrs. Adelaida A., 48 years old, is married and a resident of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is blessed with seven children: one is now having a family, two are now working and the rest are still dependent on her. Her husband is a carpenter and at the same time does fishing activity at night and at times when he is free from carpentry work.

To help support her big family, Mrs. A. engage in salted pry vending locally known as “Oyap”. She inherited this kind of business from her parents. They deliver their goods to the neighboring towns and cities here like Ozamiz, Oroquieta and even Pagadian City. As a 4th cycle loaner of the PDP-LP program of Paglaum MPC, she is applying for P5,000 to add to her capital for purchasing pry in order to meet the demands of her loyal customers.

Her hope and aspiration is to give her children a better education for a better future. She is also thankful that she learned how to use money wisely from the education she received from PMPC.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for "Oyap" vending

loans.name: Bashiran Sadiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is the wife of S. M. who has resided in a city named Kasur, Pakistan for the past eleven years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and for its shrines.

Bashiran baji couldn’t get an education because of her parents’ small financial resources, but she decided to give her children (two sons and one daughter) a good education. Currently they are all in school and getting an education. Her husband runs a leather-selling business. He sells leather to the factories. He has been in this business for the past five years.

Bashiran baji operates a business sewing clothes and, from the income, she pays off the school fees of her children. She is applying for a loan to buy leather so that her husband is able to complete the orders of his customers.

She is the group leader of seven other women from her locality:

Rukhsana baji, Razia baji, Shazia bano baji, Noreen J. baji, Razia baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy leather to sell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

loans.use: To buy leather for her husband's business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
"I got bored just staying in the house waiting for my husband to come. That is why I started my own business. It is a sari-sari (variety) store that helps us to supplement our limited income. I started my business using my own savings. I am happy that I was able to sustain it for years," says Elma N., 36-year-old mother of three children. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. The loan will really help a lot to grow her store even more.

Elma is planning to expand her business. Through CEVI, she will be able to improve her sales and make it more established.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty M. is 29 years old and from the village of Biasong. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Betty operates a family member's business manufacturing clay products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling them to local businesses and community members. Betty has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Betty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw materials to manufacture more products. This loan will be Betty's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Chuob

texts.en:
Chuob H. has been a grocery seller for many years. She is 39 years old and married with five children, one of whom is employed as a garment worker. Her husband drives a taxi around the community.

Chuob H. currently sells such items as cooking ingredients and sweets for kids. Her customers are her fellow villagers. She is a self-sacrificing woman who is working hard to meet all her children's needs.

She has requested a loan in order to purchase a plot of farmland near her house. She hopes to earn additional income by leasing this land out to local rice farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie A. started her business using her own capital. She sells fish. She is 30 years old and has three children. Her husband, Bernabe A., is a factory worker. Both of them work so as to be able to meet all their family needs.

Menchie is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials and fish to sell. She is also looking for other possible income areas to help her family.

Menchie is planning to expand her fish-selling business. Through CEVI, she will have ready access to a starting line of credit as well as to trainings and insurance coverage services. With CEVI's assistance, she hopes to make her business grow.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and fish to sell

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Каримов Акбар Холикулович 1969 год рождения ,женат имеет 6 детей .Жена Хасанова Мутабар Боборахимовна .Место жительства Шахристанский район к/ул. Бураген .Клиент берёт заем  1300 сом. на 5 мес. для животноводства .Дома имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота .Дополнительный семейный доход клиент занимается сельском хозяйством  и  работает на ФХД «Эхсон».
texts.en:
K. Akbar Holikulovich was born in 1969; he is married and has 6 children. His wife is Hasanova Mutabar Boborahimovna. He lives in the Shahristan region. The client is taking out a loan for 1300 somoni for raising livestock. He has 7 heads of livestock at home. In addition, he also earn money through agriculture and works at company “Ehson.”

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Bakali's Group

texts.en: N. Bakali, 29, is the leader of the Kisimba group in Lugazi. She is a down-to-earth lady who is married with three children between the ages of 5 and 10. She cares for 10 dependents. She has managed a grocery store in the Kisimba village for four years, selling stuff like sugar, salt, cooking oil and paraffin plus many other items. For the two years that she has been getting loans, her shop stock has increased and she makes 50,000 more profit per week than before the loans. She is happy that right now there are not so many shops in her area, so she has more customers and hopes to increase her stock. Bakali hopes to see all her children attain the best education as they grow up. She needs a new loan to help restock her grocery store.

loans.use: Buying for more stock for her shop

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Mrs. Delma C. is a 56-year-old widow and resident of Sta. Maria, Tangub City. She is the mother of six children but only one is living with her as her dependent. Her child is now studying in college. As the sole breadwinner since her husband passed away when her children were still young, she engaged in the fish-vending because it was the only way she could easily earn money to support her family. Since the public market is miles away from her home, she decided to put a mini-market in her home, where she displayed the goods to save the fare expenses of delivering them to the market.

Now as a borrower in her second loan cycle with PAGLAUM MPC under the PDP-LP Program, she is applying for the amount of P4,000.00 to add to the capital of her fish-vending business.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим Баходуров - мужчина 55 лет , занимается торговлей продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров.Его точка продажи расположена на рынке города Худжанда.За товаром он ездит сам на оптовый рынок Истаравшана. Иброхим ездит за товаром два раза в месяц. Во время его отсутствия его замещает  сын, как раз на снимке он.Кредитуется Баходуров уже шестой год, займ использует на расширение товарооборота.Вначале его ассортимент был не очень разнообразный, но постепенно он благодаря кредитам смог расширить свой оборотный капитал.Слудующий кредит хочет потратить на завоз продуктов питания.
texts.en:
Ibrohim B. is a 55 year old man; he sells food and household products. His sales location is at the market in the city of Khujand. He travels for the products himself to the Istaravshan wholesale market. When Ibrohim is absent his son takes over; he is in the photo. This is the sixth year that B. has been a borrower; he uses the loan to increase his turnover. At the beginning his product assortment was not very big, but gradually, thanks to loans he has been able to grow his working capital. He would like to use his next loan to purchase food products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Ибрагимова Гавхар Тургуновна 1972 год рождения ,национальность узбек ,образование среднее .Замужем имеет 4 детей .Муж Ибрагимов Абдумачид .Клиентка берёт заем 1500 сом. на 5 мес. для животноводства .Она занимается этом уже около 18 лет .Клиентка берёт заем для выращивания и откорма скота .Клиентка имеет фермерское хозяйство..Она занимается переработкой  молока. Место жительства Шахристанский район к. Карачи .Ей нравится своя работа,так как занимается животноводством с юных лет.
texts.en:
I. Gavhar Turgunova was born in 1972, her nationality is Uzbek; she has a high school education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is Ibraghimov Abdumachid. The client is taking out a loan for 1500 somoni for raising livestock. She has been in this business for around 18 years. She is taking out a loan to grow and fatten livestock. The client has a farm. She processes milk. She lives in the Shahristan region in the village Karachi. She likes her work, because she has been raising livestock since she was young.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purhase livestock

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia Y. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Vergenia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Vergenia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling mangoes to the community. Vergenia has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Vergenia joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergenia is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer for mango production. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Vergenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for mango production

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie Q. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old, married, and has a school-aged child. Eddie owns and operates a business manufacturing hollow blocks. Eddie has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Eddie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Eddie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eddie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for equipment repair. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his equipment

loans.name: Siek's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. Siek K., 50, is married with one married daughter who still lives in the family home. Her daughter has a job as a grocery seller, whilst her son-in-law repairs electronic items. Siek K. is currently a poultry seller. She usually sells the poultry that she buys in bulk at a better price from people who live in the rural area. To help support the family's daily expenses, her husband rides a motorbike taxi around the community. Siek K. will use the loan to increase her daughter's business capital in order to purchase grocery items to resell.

The other three borrowers are: A., who sells fresh fish in bulk in the market and requests a loan to buy fish to sell; V., a bread seller who seeks a loan as capital to buy bread to sell; and P., who raises poultry at home and wants to purchase poultry to raise. P. was not available for the photograph so her husband is shown in the photo instead. All the borrowers live in Battambang Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet D. is from the village of Kauswagan. She is 34 years old. Juliet is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing cargo transport services to local community members. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Juliet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her business

loans.name: Sakina Karamat Ali Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is the wife of K. A. who has resided in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 10 years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and its shrines. Sakina baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates a kite-making business. In Pakistan, kids and elders are fond of kite flying; some kids take this activity as a hobby. She earns a good income from this business and saves it in a committee for a rainy day. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. He has three years of experience in this business. Sakina baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop. 

She is the group leader of seven other women from her locality. Mussarat baji and Farzana baji each want a loan for their kite-making business. Firdous baji, another Firdous baji, Shazia baji, Tariza baji and Suraiya baji each want a loan for their leather-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: B. Betty is the leader of Zibula atudde women's group of Kyetume. She is a hard working lady with a business selling used shoes of all kinds that she buys from Owino and Kisekka market areas in Kampala and sells from her home area in Kyetume Central market. She is married and her six children are all still in school. This is why she works so hard to clear their school fees on time every term. She has also been a tailor for six years, and she does both jobs concurrently, making double profits in addition to the cows and pigs that she also keeps at her home. She plans to sell two pigs to cater for her children’s school fees and the loan will help to buy more shoes and school uniform materials for tailoring. She is so grateful that people are helping her and the rest of the members with loans.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothing materials

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугафор кредитор в Микроинвест шестой год.Пользуется кредитами для расширения своего основного бизнеса, продажей канцелярских товаров.Следующий кредит он хочет использовать для завоза партии пишущих ручек , фломастеров, карандашей и.т.п.Его устраивают условия Фонда и он с благодарностью продолжает кредитоваться.На снимке Абдугафор в день выдачи.
texts.en:
This is the sixth year that Abdugafor is a MicroInvest borrower. He uses the credit to grow his main business, school supply sales. He would like to use his next loan to purchase writing pens, markers, pencils, etc. He is happy with the Fund terms and he gratefully continues to borrow. In the photo is Abdugafor on the day that he received his loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of books and school supplies

loans.name: Шокирчон

texts.ru: Норкулов Шокирчон Хабибович ,национальность-таджик ,серия паспорта А 3851988 ,выдан ОВД г. Истаравшан 31,03,06 .Женат ,имеет 3 детей .Жена Норкулова Гулчехра Юсуповна 1982 год рождения образование среднее.Место жительства г. Истаравшан к. Обджувоз. Норкулов Шокирчон по профессии сварщик у себя дома изготавливает железные ворота .двери ,решётки ,тележки .Хочет взять кредит на сырьё и материалы (металлический жест ,трубы ,угольники).Клиент берёт заем 1000 сом. на 5 мес.

loans.use: для расширения товарооборота

loans.name: Saidali

texts.ru: Сайдали Салихов проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 48 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Сайдали имеет столовую, собственную. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается вместе со своей семьей, более 10 лет. Его старший сын занимается покупками продуктов, дочка официантка, жена повариха и т.д. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать столовую и еще запастись продуктами питания.
texts.en:
Saidali S. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 48 years old, married, and the father of seven. Saidali owns his own cafe. He and his family have been in this area of business for over 10 years. His eldest son does the shopping, his daughter is the waitress, his wife the cook, etc. This client is seeking a loan from us to make repairs to the cafe and stock up on groceries.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to Cafe

loans.name: Sumera M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Sumera baji is the wife of M. A.. They have lived in a city named Kasur in Pakistan for the past 15 years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat. Her husband has a clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from cities (Multan and Lahore) and sells them in Kasur to earn income. Sumera baji is a very supportive lady. She sews clothes to share the financial burden with him. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Parvaiz baji, Lubna baji, Abida baji and Farzana baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Kosar M. Afzal Group

texts.en:
My name is Kosar and I have lived in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 18 years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat. My husband's name is M. A. and he belongs to a garment-selling business. He has four years of experience in this business. I’m responsible for paying school fees for my kids, and utilities, which I pay from my wooden items making business. People buy these to decorate their homes. I’m applying for a loan to expand my husband’s garment business.

I’m the group leader of two other women from my locality. Zubaida baji and Farida baji each want a loan to buy garments to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four people who live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Vuth M., age 38, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. Vuth M. and her husband are currently local fishermen. They depend on catcH. fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake. That is the main place for fish's sheltering. They have been fisH. for a long time and earn at least $5 per day. This income they use to support her family's living expenses and especially to make sure their five children get the highest education. Vuth M. is applying for a loan in order to buy a machine to connect to their boat so that they can use it to fish more quickly. The other three borrowers are:
Mrs. S., a fish hunter, who is applying for a loan to purchase nets for fisH..
Mr. H., who is asking for a loan to buy more tools for his fisH. business.
Mrs. K., a local fish catcher, who is requesting a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a machine to connect to their boat

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia P. is from the village of Kauswagan. She is 58 years old. Leocadia is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Leocadia owns & operates a fish-selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Leocadia is just starting this business.

In 2008, Leocadia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leocadia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Leocadia is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Leocadia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Bahtyor

texts.ru: Донабоев Бахтиёр Камолович –таджик ,1982 год рождения ,женат  имеет 4 детей. Имеет два средних образования :средне –техническое (педагогическое)и средне- техническое (медицинское). Место жительства г. Истаравшан к. Обджувоз. Жена Мансурова Зайнура Муминова 1982 год рождения. Клиент занимается изготовлением кирпича из глины ,за один день лепит 1200-1500 кирпичей у себя дома .Хочет взять кредит для 10 тонн глины и 40тонн воды для лепки кирпичей .Клиент берёт заем 1600 сом. на 5 мес.
texts.en:
Born in 1982, Bahtyor D. is married and has 4 children. He has two secondary-technical degrees – teaching and medical. He lives in the city of Istaravshan. His wife, Zainura, was also born in 1982. Bahtyor is involved in manufacturing bricks from clay. He makes 1200-1500 bricks per day at home. Bahtyor wants to obtain a loan for 10 tons of clay and 40 tons of water, both needed for making bricks.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brick-making supplies

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru:
Наргиза 24 летняя женщина , мать двоих детей.Проживает и торгует на рынке города Гафурова. Она Занимается бизнесом продажи женской одежды уже четыре года. Для начала бизнеса,финансами  ей помог её муж.Узнав,что Микроинвест выдаёт займы на расширение бизнеса, решила обратится и попробовать увеличить свой оборотный капитал в кредит. Она планирует съездить в Истаравшан за весенним ассортиментом товаров. 
Её муж работает охранником на консервном заводе.Его заработная плата не хватает на полноценную жизнь семьи. Поэтому он помогает жене по бизнесу. Он замещает её во время её отъезда за товаром.
texts.en:
Nargiza is a 24 year old woman, the mother of two children. She lives and trades at the market in the city of Gafurov. She has had a business selling women’s clothing for four years now. To start her business her husband helped her with the finances.
