Having found out that MicroInvest gives out loans to develop businesses, she decided to apply and to try to increase her working capital via credit. She plans to travel to Istaravshan to purchase a spring assortment of products. Her husband works as a security guard at a canning factory. His salary is not enough for a full quality of life for the family. This is why he helps his wife in her business. He substitutes for her when she travels for products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of women's clothing

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en: My name is Ramzan and I have lived in a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. My husband's name is K. B. and he is a driver by profession and drives a 32 seat coaster. He is buying this vehicle on instalments. I am applying for a loan to pay the remaining instalments on our vehicle so that my husband can work without any tension regarding the instalments.

loans.use: To pay the remaining instalments on vehicle

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.en:
D. Saidahmad is an ordinary man in the district of Rudaki in Tajikistan. He is a very responsible person who since his youth has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family, his wife and 3 children. Saidahmad needs to purchase calves and goats to reproduce them and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meat. Once he has these products from his flock he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Saidahmad is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Davlat

texts.ru: Пулотов Давлат Рофиевич 1977 год рождения ,национальность таджик  ,серия паспорта А 3809817 ,выдан ОВД г. Истаравшан 02,09,05 . Образование средне –техническое .Женат имеет 4 детей .Жена Пулотова Хуршеда .Место жительства г. Истаравшан к. Обджувоз .Клиент сварщик занимается изготовлением железных ворот ,решётки и т.д дома . Клиент хочет взять кредит на материалы и сырьё ,железные трубы ,металлический жест .Имеет электросварочный аппарат.Клиент берёт заем 1600 сом. на 5 мес.
texts.en:
P. Davlat Rofievich was born in 1977, is Tajik by nationality. He has a secondary-technical education. He is married and has 4 children. His wife is Pulotova Khursheda. He is a resident of the city of Istaravshan, village of Obdzhuvoz. The client is a welder who makes metal gates, lattices, etc. at home. The client would like to take out a loan for raw materials (metal pipes, tinplate). He has a welding instrument. The client is taking out a 1600 somoni loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Манучехр Курбонов занимается торговлей. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Манучехр занимается торговлей на рынке. Торгует он колесами от машины. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы поплнить свой ассортимент другими запчастями от автомашины.
texts.en:
Manuchehr K. works in sales, an area of business he has been in for over 5 years. He lives in the Vahdat district. He is 28 years old, married, and has two children. He sells auto tires at the market and is requesting a loan to expand his inventory into other auto parts.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Arslon

texts.en:
K. Arslon is 35 years old. He has been married for about 10 years. His wife is a housekeeper. Arslon has been running his business for about 7 years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of housewares. His business is their main source of income. Arslon is trying to have a wide range of goods of good quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income.

Today, Arslon requests $1500 USD that will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the range of his goods for sale. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new housewares to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn M. is 32 years of age, married, and presently residing at Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She has four children who are all in school. Her husband works as a gold miner and mines in the traditional way.

Madelyn supports her husband through her variety store. Her established buyers are her neighbors in their village. She decided to pursue this business to improve her income. For her 3rd loan, she is applying for PHP 11,000 from HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase rice and other goods for sale

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 38 years old. Merlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business is sales of daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar is a 32-year-old married mother of three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur and Muyassar started her business five years ago in order to support her family. All year she sells fruit that she buys from local farmers. Twice a week, Muyassar travels over 60 km to sell her produce at attractive prices at the busy market. With the loan of $1500 USD from Kiva, she plans to increase the range of her selling goods, and to buy more fruit to sell. Muyassar strives to give her children a better life than she has, including supporting them through a good education. Muyassar is a well-spoken, friendly businesswoman who is worthy of the support of Kiva partners.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Mukambar

texts.ru: Кузиева Мукамбар Хомитовна  1959 год рождения ,узбечка ,образование среднее .Место жительства Шахристанский район к. Карачи .Вдова имеет 5 детей.Муж Хайдаркулов Х. Клиентка занимается животноводством  уже около 28 лет .Клиентка берёт заем для выращивания и откорма  скота .Она имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота  .Дополнительный семейный доход клиентка занимается сельским хозяйством  и переработкой молока.На полученный кредит рассчитывает купить дойную корову,чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком.
texts.en:
K. Mukambar Homitovna was born in 1959, she is Uzbek, and has a high school education. She lives in the Shahristan region, in Karachi village. She is a widow and has 5 children. Her husband was Haidarkulov H. The client has been raising livestock for about 28 years. She is taking out a loan to raise and fatten livestock. She has 7 heads of large-horned livestock. To earn additional family income, the client farms and processes milk. She plans to use the loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to provide her family with milk.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: для покупки дойной коровы

loans.name: Karim

texts.ru: Карим Саидов проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Карим занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 2 лет. До этого он 16 лет работал агрономом. Сын работает таксистом. Старший сын находится в России, на заработках. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить бычков для откармливания и продажи. На полученный доход собиратся пристроить дом.
texts.en:
Karim S. lives in the Vahdat region. He is 53 years old, married and has four children. Karim is in animal husbandry. He has been in this business for two years. Before that he worked as an agronomist for sixteen years. His son works as a taxi driver. His oldest son is working in Russia right now. He is asking for a loan to buy calves for feeding and resale. He wants to use the profit to build an addition to the house.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Farukh

texts.en:
S. Farukh is 36 years old. He is married with three children. Farukh has already run his business for seven years. He sells household appliances and different cosmetics for women. The business generates a significant income for the family allowing him to improve the living conditions. Today Farukh requests $1500 USD. He is going to spend the loan to purchase new goods to sell. Having loans from IMON since 2006, Farukh had shown himself as a reliable client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Baroat

texts.en:
Y. Baroat is 40 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three adult children. Baroat is selling goods such as detergents, hair accessories for girls, batteries, blades, machine twist and treads, pens and others. She has been in this business for five years. The husband of Baroat helps and supports her always. The business is successful in bringing considerable income to the family. Today Baroat wants to expand her business and to increase her working capital to purchase new goods to sell. For this purpose, she requests $1500 USD. Being loaned by IMON five times already and having demonstrated herself as an accurate client, Baroat promises to manage this loan with accuracy.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Maret

texts.en:
Maret O. is from the village of Danao. She is 27 years old. Maret is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Maret owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Maret is just starting this business.

In 2009, Maret joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maret is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maret from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Buvrobiya

texts.ru: Ибрагимова Бувробия 1950 год рождения ,узбек ,образование среднее .Место жительства Шахристанский район к. Карачи .Вдова имеет 1 ребёнка .Муж  Ибрагимов  Яхшибой . Клиентка занимается животноводством  уже около 40лет .Клиентка берёт кредит для выращивания и откорма  скота .Клиентка имеет 7 голова крупного рогатого скота  .Дополнительный семейный доход клиентка занимается сельском хозяйством  и переработка молока. В свободное время Бувробия любит роботать в огороде,где выращивает овощи и зелень.
texts.en:
Buvrobiya I., an Uzbek, was born in 1950, and has a high school education. She lives in Karachi, a town in the Shahristan district. She is a widow and has one child. Her husband was Yahshiboy Ibragimov. This entrepreneur has practiced animal husbandry for about 40 years. She is requesting a loan to help with feeding and raising the livestock. She has 7 head of cattle. She earns extra income for the family by growing crops and processing milk. In her free time she loves to work in her garden, where she grows vegetables and herbs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Siddik

texts.ru: Сиддик- мужчина 41 года , женат имеет троих детей.Он зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси.Его жена работает учительницей с средней школе.Сиддик кредитуется уже четвёртый год.Он берёт займ на ремонт своей машины и обновления шин.Предыдущие кредиты он использовал для замены марки автомашины.Раньше у него бала автомашина марки "Москвич", а на сегодня у него "Мерседес бенс", поэтому он благодарен инвесторам за поддержку и финансирование.
texts.en:
Siddik is a 41-year-old man, who is married and has three children. He earns his living providing taxi service, while his wife works as a secondary school teacher. This is the fourth year Siddik has taken out a loan. He needs a loan to repair his car and change the tires. He used the previous loans to buy a different make of car. He used to have a Moskvich, but today has a Mercedes-Benz, so he is grateful to the investors for their support and financing.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Maguinda

texts.en:
Maguinda L., 23 years old, is married and a mother of a three-year-old baby. She lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City in Southern Philippines. Her husband works as a gold miner in their village. He uses the traditional system of mining.

Maguinda engages in banana retailing. They have a small parcel of land from which they get their supplies of green bananas. They sell a variety of bananas like saba, lakatan, lontong and bolulan. Income from her husband's and her business is not enough to provide for the needs of the family. Especially now that she has a baby. And the demands of her customers are growing. Therefore she decided to expand her business by applying for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 11,000.00. With this, Maguinda can now both provide for the needs of her family and her customers. This will be her third loan with HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lomer

texts.en: Lomer H. is 37 years of age, presently residing at Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. He has seven children, all in school. His source of income is his variety store. His wife is helping him as a housewife, taking care of the house as well as the children. Lomer is determined to reach his goal, which is to let all his kids finish their studies. He knows that it seems so hard to fulfill but Lomer, being the head of the family, is doing his best to let his store bring in more income for his family. He's requesting a loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри Давлатова занимается торговлей. У нее на рынке имеется торговая точка. Она торгует техникой, детскими игрушками и т.д. Она проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 51 год. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Мехри бизнесом занимается 5 лет. До этого она работала по своей специальности учительницой. С бизнесом ей помогают дети. Муж работает водителем маршрутного такси. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить свой ассортимент.
texts.en:
Mehri D. is in retail. She has a vendor space on the market. She sells electronics, children's toys and etc. He lives in the Vahdat region. She is 51 years old, married and has six children. Mehri has been doing business for five years. Before that she worked as a teacher. Her children help her with the business. Her husband works as a shuttle taxi driver. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Suzana Muchanga

texts.pt:
Susana Muchanga M. é natural de Gaza uma das províncias do sul de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos, sendo primeiro com 25 anos de idade e o segundo com 21 anos de idade, ambos não estudam.

Susana estudou até 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, em 1980 mudou se da província de Gaza para Maputo na companhia dos pais devido que o pai trabalhava na cidade de Maputo, em 1981 casou se em 1997 inicia actividade comercial qual desenvolve até data hoje.

Susana solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez e pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio, actualmente tem um rendimento mensal de 20000,00mt a 25000,00mt e consegue poupar algum. Diz ela que apenas procura manter o seu nível económico e social dado que se sente estável e luta por apoiar os seus filhos.
texts.en:
Susana Muchanga M. is a native of Gaza, one of the provinces in the south of Mozambique. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. The first is 25 years old, and the second is 21 years old. Neither one is in school. Susana went to school until the 4th grade and stopped because of poor conditions. In 1980 she moved from the province of Gaza to Maputo in the company of her parents because her father worked in the city of Maputo. In 1981 she got married, and in 1997 she began her commercial activities which have developed until today. Susana is soliciting a loan through Hluvuku and Kiva for the first time, and she intends to increase the volume of her business. She currently has monthly earnings of 20,000MT to 25,000MT, and she is able to save a little. She says that she is only looking to maintain her economic and social level given that she feels stable and is trying to support her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали Эшмуродов проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 59 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Курбонали вот уже 30 лет изготавливает окна и двери. В этом ему помогают двое сыновей. По специальности Курбонали плотник. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы закупить нужные материалы и увеличить свой товараоборот, т.к. сейчас много строят.
texts.en:
Kurbonali E. lives in the Vahdat region. He is 59 years old, married and has four children. Kurbonali has been making doors and windows for already 30 years. His two sons are helping him in this business. Kurbonali is a carpenter by profession. He is asking for a loan from us to buy the necessary materials and increase the turnaround because there's a lot of building going on now.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Вахобов Икром Абдукаримович 1971 год рождения ,женат имеет 1 ребёнка .Жена Вахобова Саодат  .Место жительства Шахристанский район ,район Шахристан. Клиент занимается живодноводством  уже около 10 лет дома .Клиент имеет 5 голов крупного рогатого скота .Дополнительный семейный доход клиент занимается переработкой молока. Он  сам является   сотрудником налоговой инспекции.Всем своим знакомым и друзьям Икром рекомендует нашу организацию и благодарит наших доноров.
texts.en:
Ikrom Abdukarimovich V. was born in 1971. He is married and has one child. He and his wife Saodat Vahobova live in Shahristan district. Ikrom has raised cattle at home for more than ten years, and has five head of large-horned cattle. Processing the milk is an additional source of family income. Ikrom also works at the tax revenue service. Ikrom recommends MicroInvest to all his acquaintances and friends and is grateful to our donors.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Avrod

texts.ru: Аврод Касимов занимается торговлей муки. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. У него на рынке "Автовокзал" имеется торговая точка. Этим видом деятельности она занимается вместе с сыном более 10 лет. Старший сын тоже работает, на стройке. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот. А на полученный доход удвоить свой ассортимент.
texts.en:
Avrod Kasimov sells flour. He is 50 years old, married and has five children. He has a vendor space on the market Avtovokzal. He has been in this business together with his son for more than ten years. His oldest son works in construction. The client wants to take out a loan from us to increase his commodity turnaround. He will use the profit to double his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугафор Буров более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Возраст 50 лет. Абдугафор занимается откармливанием и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Продает он на скотовом рынке "Вахдат". В этом бизнесе ему помогает младший сын. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить бычков для откармливания и продажи. На полученную прибыль хочет купить бычка.
texts.en:
Abdugafor B. has been doing animal husbandry for more than six years. He is married and has five children. He is 50 years old. Abdugafor feeds and resells large cattle. He sells on the cattle market Vahdat. His youngest son helps him in this business. The client is asking for a loan to buy calves for feeding and resale. He will buy another calf on the received profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.ru: Мушараф кредитор в Микроинвест с 2005 года.Она берёт кредит для оборачиваемости бизнеса животноводства.На сегодняшний день у неё четыре коровы и десять баранов.Следующий кредит она хочет использовать для закупа корма баранов. По словам Мушараф ,благодаря Фонду у неё постоянно меняется ( откорм и продажа)скот, с чего есть прибыль на жизнь.Продажей скота занимается её муж, когда скот готов к продаже он выводит его на рынок и продаёт за хорошую цену.Вместо чего покупает помоложе и худой скот, который Мушараф опять будет откармливать и готовить к продаже.На снимке Мушараф в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Musharaf has been a MicroInvest loan customer since 2005. She is taking out a loan for turnover in her livestock business. At present she has four cows and ten sheep. She wants to use this next loan to purchase feed for her sheep. According to Musharaf, she has MicroInvest to thank for the constant turnover in cattle, the fattening and selling that provides her with an income. Her husband handles selling the cattle; when a steer is ready for sale he takes it to the market and sells it for a good price. In turn, he purchases a younger and leaner steer, which Musharaf again fattens and prepares for sale. Musharaf is pictured on the day her loan was dispersed.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia  D. is from the village of TURNO. She is 34 years old. Gaudencia is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Gaudencia owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gaudencia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gaudencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gaudencia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Gaudencia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gaudencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан Файзулаев проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 27 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Хасан занимается производством и реализацией кирпичей. У него имеются постоянные покупатели, котроые торгуют на рынке. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается более 5 лет. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить объем производства т.е. закупить нужное сырье.
texts.en:
Hasan F. lives in the Vakhdat region of Tajikistan. He is 27 years old, married and has 3 children. For the last 5 years Hasan has been making and selling bricks. He has steady customers who purchase his wares to sell on the market. Hasan wants to take out this loan to purchase a large batch of raw materials in order to increase the amount of bricks he can make and sell.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production increase

loans.name: Rosaria Milambo

texts.pt:
Rosaria Milambo D. S. é natural de Maputo, tem 24 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de um filho com um ano de idade. Apenas sustenta o seu filho e marido.

Rosaria estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, desde a sua infância passou no bairro Inhagoa um D. bairros do distrito Urbano nº 5 da cidade de Maputo. A três anos que rosaria é gestora do seu próprio negocio que cconsiste na compra e venda de produtos diversos com destaque aos refrigerantes que adquira a caixa por 150,00mt e vende por 240,00mt.

Rosaria solicita o empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez e nunca se benificiou noutras instituições. Futuramente Rosaria pretende construir uma grande loja para diversicar mais os produtos.
texts.en:
Rosaria Milambo D. S. is a native of Maputo and is 24 years old. She is married and the mother of a one year-old son. She only supports her son and husband. Rosaria went to school until the 9th grade and stopped because of poor conditions. She grew up in the Inhagoa neighborhood, one of the neighborhoods in the Urban #5 district in the city of Maputo. For three years Rosaria has been manager of her own business that consists of buying and selling various products with the stand-out being soda which she acquires for 150MT and sells for 240MT per box. Rosaria is requesting a loan through Hluvuku and Kiva for the first time, and she has never borrowed from other institutions. In the future Rosaria intends to construct a great store to diversify her products.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of diverse products

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma M. is a working mother who supports her husband financially through her mini-grocery store. She has four children, and her husband is a farmer who also cultivates their own small plot of land with corn and vegetables. Of her four children, three are in school and the eldest is married. She has one in college, one in high school and one in elementary school; therefore she needs to double her effort to cover the budget for all the families expenses. She is planning to earn more profit, and is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 8000 as her second loan from HSPFI.

loans.use: Additional capital for her mini-grocery store

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Гуломов Муродали женат, имеет 3 детей. Возраст 37 лет. Проживает в районе Вахдат. Муродали занимается животноводством более 7 лет. Он откармливает бычков, потом продает их на скотовом рынке. Ему помогает его старший сын. Помимо этого Муродали занимается услугой такси. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить бычка для откармливания и продажи.
texts.en:
Murodali G. is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in the Vakhdat region of Tajikistan. Murodali has been raising cattle for the last seven years with the help of his oldest son. They fatten calves and then sell them at the meat market. Besides cattle raising Murodali also works as a taxi driver. He would like to take out this loan to purchase an additional calf for feeding and subsequent sale.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Agafia

texts.en:
The meat market for Agafia had its start in 2000 as a small family business. She opened a store for meat and dairy in 2005, which served local residents and restaurants as a purveyor of fine meats. With the urging of her frequent customers, she decided to increase her stock of goods. Microinvest helps Agafia to buy all she needs.

Agafia thanks Microinvest for financial support and trust.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Hafizan Muhammad Ilyas Group

texts.en:
Hafizan baji is the wife of M. I. who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Hafizan baji is a very responsible and a very hard working lady. She operates a sewing clothes business to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband deals in the clothes selling business. He has four years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s clothes selling business.

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rafia baji wants a loan to buy carpets to sell. Mussarat baji and Asma baji each want a loan to buy a donkey cart for their loading business. Kalsoom bukhari baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Telma Cândida

texts.pt:
Telma Cândida M. é natural de Maputo cidade, tem 36 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos que vive com ela com idade entre 15; 10 e 2 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta a sua família que sãos os filhos.

Telma estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por problemas sociais. Desde a sua infância nunca saiu da cidade, neste momento vive basicamente de negocio que consiste na venda de diversos produtos com destaque televisores que adquira por 1500,00mt e vende por 2700,00mt, deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal liquido de 5000,00mt.

Telma solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez, acompanha da existência desta instituição através da vizinha que já era cliente, com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o seu estoque de forma a responder da melhor maneira os seus clientes.

Futuramente Telma pretende adquirir novo empréstimo afim de ampliar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Telma Cândida M. is a native of the city of Maputo. She is 36 years old, divorced and the mother of 3 children who live with her. They are ages 15, 10 and 2. She supports only her family, consisting of her children.

Telma attended school through the 9th grade and stopped due to social problems. Since her childhood, she has never left the city, and at this time, she lives primarily from her business, selling various products. In particular, she sells televisions which she buys for 1500 meticais and sells for 2700 meticais. From this business, she has a monthly profit of 5000 meticais.

Telma is requesting a loan from Hluvuku and Kiva for the first time. She found out about this institution through a neighbor who has been a client. With this loan, she plans to increase her stock in order to better meet demand from his customers.

In the future, Telma plans to get a new loan in order to expand her house.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

loans.name: Rubina Asif Masih Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 14 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Rubina baji's husband works in animal sales. He buys animals from markets and sells them to butchers. He has 3 years of experience in this business. Rubina baji, a very responsible and sensitive soul, is a tailor. She wants to keep her family happy and labors for them. She is applying for a loan to buy animals (goats) to increase the profit of her husband’s animal selling business.

Rubina baji leads a group that includes four other women from her locality. Suraiya baji, Razia baji, and Shakeela Parveen baji each want loans to buy donkey carts for loading. Zainab Ilahi baji wants a loan to buy medicines to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to resell

loans.name: Leonida Auma

texts.en:
Leonida is a 43-year-old single mother of four children, ages 9-21 years. Her first child is already in university. Leonida was married, but her husband's family was upset that she did not give birth to more boys and chased her from her home in Nairobi. She is now suing him.

Leonida now lives in Manyatta slum, but she works in Nyamesaria. She runs two businesses, a beauty salon and a tailoring shop. Her challenges right now are too few customers. Her hopes for the future are to help her children so that in the future they can help her too. She likes running her own business, because when she makes a profit, it's hers and hers alone. She thinks women make better entrepreneurs because men often use the profits for drinking and being idle, a common refrain amongst many of the K-MET borrowers.

In this video, you can hear me (Kiva Fellow) greet Leonida saying "Idhi Nade," which is Luo for "How are you?" Leonida responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as President Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo, saying "Asante sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "Thank you," and "Erokamano," which, in Luo, means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are those of people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

loans.use: materials for tailoring, chemicals for her salon, hair extensions

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruqaiya Parveen M.iqbal Group

texts.en:
My name is Ruqaiya parveen and I have been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the last 9 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. My husband's name is M. I.. He runs a grocery shop in the community. I help my husband by operating a sewing clothes business. Through this business, I am somehow able to share the financial burden with him. I am applying for a loan to buy groceries for his grocery shop.

I am a group leader of four other women from my locality. Zareena kosar baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Maqsoodan baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy animals (goats) for their animal-selling business. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Verónica

texts.pt:
Verónica Panguene é natural de Maputo, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos sendo três a viver nas suas casas e três ainda na sua responsabilidade.

Verónica estudou até 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, nasceu e cresceu num dos bairros periféricos da cidade de Maputo, casou em 1979,  aos 13 anos inicia actividade comercial qual desenvolve até data hoje.

Verónica solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva no valor de 10000,00mt com qual pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio, dado que neste momento tem um rendimento mensal de 11000,00mt a 12000,00mt.  Futuramente sonha comprar uma viatura e conta com o credito.
texts.en:
Verónica Panguene is a native of Maptu. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. Three live in their own homes and three are still her responsibility.

Verónica was in school through 4th grade and stopped due to cirumstances. She was born and grew up on the outskirts of the city of Maputo. She married in 1979. At age 13, she started her business which she still works in.

Verónica has requested a loan from Hluvuku and Kiva in the amount of 10,000 meticais, with which she plans to increase her business volume. At this time, she has a monthly revenue of 11,000 to 12,000 meticais. In the future, she dreams of buying a vehicle with a loan.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Razia Abdul Aziz Group

texts.en:
Razia baji and her husband, A. A., have lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Borewala is famous for its sweetmeat. A. A. has run a barber shop where he cuts people hair and trims their beards for the past 2 years. Razia baji is a tailor because she wants to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy items like chairs, tables and scissors for her husband’s barber shop.

Razia baji leads a group that includes two other women from her locality. Ramzanay baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sardaran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy items for a barber shop

loans.name: Mussarat M.akram Group

texts.en:
Mussarat baji is an independent lady. She embroiders clothes. She collects orders from clothing stores and completes 1 dress in 15 days. She sells each dress for 35,000 to 40,000 Pakistani rupees (or about $425-$500 US). Her husband, Her husband, M., is a loader by profession and delivers different items like construction supplies and fruits & vegetables. Mussarat baji is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because her old cart has become rough and rotted.

Mussarat baji is the leader of a group that includes four other women from her locality. Rasheeda baji, Fazilat baji, and Parveen Akhtar baji each want loans to buy auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles). Irshad baji wants a loan to buy flour for her bread-baking business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading

loans.name: Octavian

texts.en:
This is Octavian and he has run businesses for many years. As a beginning entrepreneur, he wants to increase his stock of goods. Octavian wants to purchase seeds and build a greenhouse for cultivation. Microinvest has granted him a loan to buy the necessary wood and plastic sheeting for the greenhouse. In the future, Octavian would like to increase the number of cattle he owns by borrowing another loan from Microinvest. This will happen after he repays his current loan.

We wish him good luck and hope his business is a success.

loans.use: To purchase wood and plastic sheeting for a greenhouse

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana first started to make clothes at home, and began produce them commercially in 2008. Since 2008 Ana has made men’s clothing for merchants and also employed tailors. This year, Lora started to see the production of women's clothing added to the workshop. Profitable business led her to open tiny shops in poor districts from Chisinau City. Ana’s tailor shop began producing better quality garments with fine material. Lora decided to borrow a loan of 25 000 lei from Microinvest to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gloria Concepción

texts.es: Gloria Concepción C. D. A. vive en el municipio D. Zaragoza departamento La Libertad , Gloria está felizmente casada y es madre D. una niña D. 9 años, Gloria cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo en los gastos familiares;  ya Erick trabaja como empleado público obteniendo un sueldo fijo mensual, pero Gloria también obtiene ingresos para la manutención D. la familia ya que tiene su propio negocio que inicio hace 8 años, vendiendo productos por catálogos y comprando mercadería como zapatos, perfumes y ropa .  El método D. comercialización D. Gloria es visitar personalmente a los clientes como a oficinas, universidades y vecinos.  Gloria solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar otra variedad D. productos y así surtir más su inventario
texts.en:
Gloria Concepción C. D. A. lives in the town of Zaragoza in the department of La Libertad. Gloria is happily married and is the mother of a nine-year-old girl. Gloria has the support of her husband in the household expenses. Erick works as a civil servant and receives a monthly fixed salary, but Gloria also earns income to support the family. She has her own business that she started 8 years ago selling products through catalogs and buying merchandise such as shoes, pefumes, and clothing. Gloria's marketing method is to personally visit her clients in offices or universities or go to her neighbors. Gloria is asking for this loan because she wants to buy another variety of products and, in this way, increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is a 55-year-old father of two children. He lives and works in Nakuru where he has had a private health practice since 1989. He provides reproductive health, curative services, family planning, PAK and minor surgeries. He is trained as a nurse, in family planning, and general reproductive health.

John sees between 140 and 150 clients a month. His clients range from those in the slum to more middle class people. He says it's important to balance his clientele as oftentimes the clients from the slum cannot pay their bills. He says he sometimes feels guilty but he cannot serve everyone all the time for free.

He is asking for a loan so that he can repair his car that he uses to visit distant patients. The rest he will use for improvements to the clinic like painting, buying drugs, and repairing the floor. He said the most important aspect is the car, as many of his clients don’t have the means to come to him.

Note: Mr. M.'s interview was taped prior to an informational meeting where he and other borrowers (all primary care providers) were informed that the maximum amount they could receive for their first loan was $1200 USD . Mr. Yegon agreed that he would take $1200 USD but the interviewer did not have time to re-tape the interview.

loans.use: automobile repair, medicines

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto G. A. vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador junto a su esposa y dos hijos, A sus 59 años de edad Mario sigue en la lucha de día con día para sacar a su familia adelante como hasta el momento lo ha hecho, Mario fue empleado por años pero al no estar satisfechas sus necesidades económicas decidió poner un negocio propio, el cual lleva ya 9 años a flote es una tienda con varios productos como espejos, cuadros y otros adornos a esta tienda Mario y su familia la llamaron  “Tienda de variedades Ruben” . Ahora Mario solicita este crédito para surtir su negocio con productos alusivos al mes de las madres que están siendo muy demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto G. A. lives in Soyapango in the department of San Salvador with his wife and two children. At 59 years-old, Mario continues fighting day by day to bring success to his family and will fight until the moment he has done so. Mario was employed for years but did not meet his economic needs and decided to start his own business. He has been in business for 9 years and has a store with various products such as mirrors, paintings, and other decorations. Mario and his family call this store, "Tienda de variedades Ruben". Now Mario is asking for this loan to expand his business with allusive products for the month of mothers which have been highly demanded by his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta tiene 42 años, como madre y esposa trata de desarrollar sus diversos roles con mucha responsabilidad y cariño, sobre todo en su casa que es el lugar donde sus hijos reciben sus consejos.  Se dedica a la venta de golosinas de forma ambulante, sobre todo en las puertas de los colegios y en los parques, donde hay mayor concurrencia de personas, lo cual  beneficia a su negocio. Esta actividad la inició hace 3 años cuando estaba pasando por problemas económicos y pudo solventar los gastos de alimentación de su hogar; actualmente ha podido ahorrar, con la finalidad de juntar el capital necesario para instalar una tienda en la puerta de su casa. Pero hasta que  no llegue en momento de abrir su tienda tendrá que salir a las calles todas las mañanas desde las 7 hasta las 6 de la tarde horario de trabajo que cumple todos los días. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y con mucho respeto y colaboración ha venido trabajando con el grupo de sus compañeras que conforman su banco comunal. Con los 1000 soles que solicita incrementará la cantidad de productos que vende para cumplir pronto la meta que tiene como comerciante.
texts.en:
Benedicta is 42 years old. As a mother and wife she tries to balance her diverse roles by being responsible and loving, especially in her house since that is where her children grow and develop. She sells sweets on foot, focusing on school entrances and parks where there is a lot of foot traffic and many customers to sell her sweets to. She started selling sweets on foot 3 years ago when she was on hard times and needed a way to pay for her household expenses. She has been able to save money and plans to open a storefront in the entrance to her house once she has enough funds to do so. Until then, she begins work at 7 in the morning and works until 6 every day. This is her 6th loan with MFP. She works closely with the members of her community bank, whom she respects and collaborates with. With the loan for 1000 soles she will increase the amount of products she sells and will be able to accomplish her goal of opening a storefront.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La señora Juana R. se dedica a atender en su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado Mayoreo donde a diario desde muy temprano abre su tramo para ofrecer los perecederos a sus clientes.

El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dichas frutas y verduras por lo que espera en que Ceprodel le proporcionará el crédito lo más pronto posible para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Juana R. tends to her business of selling fruits and vegetables in the wholesale market. She opens her area very early every day to offer the perishables to her customers. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables. She hopes that Ceprodel will give her the loan as soon as possible so that she can invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia M. D. H. vive en Zacatecoluca  departamento D. la paz, A sus 38 años Marta se encuentra casada y madre D. 3 hijos . Marta y su esposo se dedican a su negocio que es una tienda donD. venden  productos D. consumo diario, esta tienda es el único aporte económico que la familia recibe, es por ello que esta pareja D. esposo se preocupan mucho por su negocio para vender productos D. calidad a sus clientes y dar los mejores precios. Marta ya ha obtenido créditos  en otras instituciones donD. actualmente  no tiene ninguno vigente, pero ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas; ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para surtir  su tienda.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia M. D. H. lives in the Zacatecoluca department of La Paz. Marta is 38, married, and has three children. Marta and her husband have a store where they sell everyday consumer goods. This store is the only economic support the family receives. Because of this, they are very concerned about their business and selling quality products at the best prices. Marta has received loans from other institutions. She currently does not have one. She has been very punctual in her payments. She is asking for a new loan to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya es una joven de 23 años que trabaja con la finalidad de ayudar a sus padres, quienes son su mayor tesoro, para ella, vivir con ellos es una bendición. Entablar rápidamente amistad con personas le ayudó a dedicar sus tiempos libres en realizar actividades productivas como brindar servicios de llamadas telefónicas en su localidad, negocio  que viene desarrollando hace 2 años a lado de unas amigas. Lo difícil de esta actividad es el riesgo de sufrir asaltos, pues dispone de varios celulares por la cantidad de personas que solicitan sus servicios y para evitar peligros trata de ser muy prudente. Con las ganancias que obtiene puede pagar sus estudios, y durante sus horas de clase, su padre cubre su puesto de trabajo para no perder clientes. Su deseo a futuro, es asociarse con su padre para instalar un centro de llamadas y venta de teléfonos en el centro de su ciudad. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará algunos celulares para mejorar e incrementar la prestación de sus servicios.
texts.en:
Cinthya is a young woman who is 23 years old and works to help out her parents, who are her greatest treasure. For her, living with them is a blessing. Her ability to make friends quickly has helped her to use her free time to do productive activities like set up a phone call service in her town, a business that she has been developing for 2 years with some friends. The difficult part of this work is the risk of muggings, as she has a number of cell phones due to the volume of customers who request her services. She tries to avoid danger by being very careful. With the profits she earns she is able to pay for her studies, and while she is in class, her father takes over the business so as to not lose customers. Her hope for the future is to partner with her father to install a call center and sell telephones in the center of the city. With the 1000 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase a few new cell phones to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cell phones

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère  de 6 enfants, Madame Aminata  Koné est âgée  de 36 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Koko  de la préfecture de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ). 
N’ayant pas pu faire d’étude pour des raisons sociales, très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment la  transformation du haricot en une sorte de pâté appelée « Fari », apprise auprès de sa maman. Nantie d’une solide expérience, elle excelle dans cette activité  depuis 15 ans.  Elle est très bien sollicitée dans ce secteur de la  préparation du Fari. 
Afin d’élargir de son activité, Madame Aminata n’a pas pris du temps à faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans.  Après  3 prêts  solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous payés correctement sans difficulté, elle est à son premier  prêt   individuel.
Elle compte acheter, 15 sacs de haricot auprès des grossistes céréaliers du grand marché de Koutiala  et effectue sa vente à son domicile à une clientèle  composée de femmes et d’ hommes au comptant surtout.  
Elle compte générer un bénéfice mensuel de  60.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des d’intérêts  du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata Koné, age 36, is married and the mother of six. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Koko district of Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region). Having been unable to go to school for societal reasons, she soon got interested in income-generating work, especially the processing of beans into a sort of paste called fari, something she learned to make from her mother. Bestowed with solid experience, Aminata has been in this business for 15 years. She is in high demand in this field of making fari. To expand her business, she wasted no time in turning towards the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid without difficulty, she is now on her first individual loan. She intends to buy 15 sacks of beans from grain wholesalers of Koutiala. She makes her sales out of her home to customers composed of women and men, most of all in cash. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that she envisions using to make loan interest payments and to help cover day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of beans

loans.name: María Lucrecia

texts.es:
La señora María M. posee su propio negocio de venta de queso en su establecimiento en el Mercado Mayoreo donde ofrece el queso a sus clientes. 

Es de importancia destacar que ella es una dama que ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por medio de los créditos para el mejoramiento de su negocio y hoy en día una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito para la compra del queso y así continuar comercializándolo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria M. has her own business selling cheese at her stand in the Wholesale Market where she offers cheese to her customers. It is important to note that she is a woman who has been successful getting ahead thanks to the support Ceprodel has provided by means of loans to improve her business. Today she has come to Ceprodel to request a new loan for the purchase of cheese in order to continue selling it through her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es: Cleofe es de la ciudad de Lima, dentro del núcleo familiar trata de esforzarse al máximo, siendo ayuda para su pareja; consejera y amiga para sus hijos. Cada mañana, inicia su turno como vendedora de verduras en el puesto que tiene en el mercado de su localidad, comenzó su negocio con algunos productos que compraba en el mercado central de la ciudad, hasta que un día decidió asociarse con las personas que distribuían a los mercados, resultando ser una alternativa para ahorrar tiempo y dinero. Hoy, ya son más de 4 años ganando aproximadamente 1800 soles cada quincena, siendo la única vendedora que ha logrado posesionarse en la venta de verduras, sobretodo del zapallo. Cleofe por ahora está dedicada solo a la venta, pero ha tomado la decisión de conseguir un camión en un futuro cercano para trabajar como mayorista en los mercados de su ciudad, para realizar este sueño trabaja hasta muy tarde, sacrificando algunas horas de descanso, pero junto a su pareja saben que lograrán el progreso de su negocio. Este es su octavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y con su banco comunal han trazaron metas para mejorar su funcionamiento y organización. Con los 3500 soles que solicita realizará pedidos al por mayor de sus productos, incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cleofe is from the city of Lima. She tries to put maximum effort into her family, as a helpmate to her partner and advisor and friend to her children. Every morning, she begins her shift selling vegetables at a stand that she has in the neighborhood market. She started her business with products that she bought in the city's central market, until one day she decided to partner with the people who distribute to the markets, which turned out to be an alternative that saves time and money. It has now been 4 years that she has been making approximately 1800 soles every two weeks, as she is the only person selling vegetables, in particular, pumpkins. Currently, Cleofe only does sales, but she has decided to get a truck in the near future in order to work as a wholesaler in the city markets. In order to achieve this dream she works very late, sacrificing some hours of rest, but along with her partner they know that they will make progress with their business. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she has outlined goals with her communal bank to improve her operations and organization. With the 3500 soles that she is requesting, she will take wholesale orders for her products, increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gustavo José

texts.es:
Actualmente, en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Gustavo García se dedica a atender su negocio de reparación y venta de bicicletas así como venta de repuestos siendo un negocio muy rentable que gracias a sus conocimientos en esta área él ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones.

Actualmente, el señor Gustavo ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los repuestos para ofrecerlos en su negocio y también para armar las bicicletas y así continuar supliendo sus necesidades por medio de su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Wholesale Market in the city of Managua, Mr. Gustavo García manages his business repairing and selling bicycles and replacement parts. This is a very profitable business and thanks to his knowledge of this area he has been able to improve his conditions. Mr. Gustavo has now come to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of replacement parts both to offer them though his business and to put together bicycles, and in this way continue to meet his needs through his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bicycle parts

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, tiene 35 años, junto a su esposo mantienen las necesidades de sus 7 hijos, quienes aun están estudiando y se necesitan altos montos de inversión en ellos, pero gracias a la compra de su casa dejaron de pagar alquiler por una vivienda. Debido al tamaño de su familia, decidió apoyar a su pareja en los gastos y buscó la manera de generar ingresos económicos, y gracias a la ayuda de una vecina se contactó con algunos trabajadores que solicitaba servicio de comida. Y fue así que desde hace 3 años está dedicada a  cocinar los almuerzos para sus comensales durante toda la semana, y les cobra cada fin de mes. Esta actividad la realiza muy alegremente, ya que sólo invierte la mañana en la preparación de la comida, para luego distribuirla, teniendo el resto del tiempo para dedicarse a sus hijos. Pero ahora Dina, quiere trabajar a tiempo completo y para ello tiene proyectado instalar un restaurante en un mercado o en un lugar comercial, donde junto a sus hijos inviertan su tiempo y dinero para hacerlo progresar. Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, ella considera que el tiempo de permanencia en esta institución le ha ayudado a madurar como persona y como parte de su grupo, ya que cada una de las integrantes se esfuerza para continuar trabajando en equipo. Con los 3500 soles que solicita adquirirá una cocina y ollas para incrementar la cantidad de porciones de comida que prepara, y así atender a nuevos pensionistas.
texts.en:
Dina is 35 years old. Along with her husband they support their 7 children, who are still in school and require a lot of financial support. Thanks to the purchase of a house, they are no longer paying to rent a home. Due to the size of their family, Dina decided to help out her husband with the expenses and find a way to generate income. Thanks to the help of one of her neighbors, she was put in touch with workers who requested a meal service. For three years now she has cooked lunches for her customers during the week and she charges them at the end of the month. She enjoys this work, as she only has to spend the morning preparing meals, to later be delivered, and she has the rest of the time to dedicate to her children. However, Dina would now like to work full time and in order to accomplish this she plans to open a restaurant in a market or commercial space, where, along with her children she can invest time and money to make it successful. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She believes that that her tenure with this institution has helped her to mature as a person and as part of the group, as each member makes an effort to work as part of the team. With the 3500 soles that she is requesting, she will purchase a cooking range and pots to increase the number of portions she can prepare, so she can provide service to new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cook top and new pots

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia Veronica

texts.es: Sonia Verónica tiene 25 años de edad, ella es soltera, ella no cuenta con sus padres, y vive con sus hermanos y hermanas.   Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica como güipiles, y también los elabora.  Esto lo ha venid haciendo  desde hace mas de seis años. Ella vende en diferentes municipios y en el departamento de Chimaltenango.  El propósito del préstamo es para incrementar su negocio en compras de más ropa típica como cortes. Sus sueños son tener un local para su negocio, y que su negocio sea mas grande para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sonio Verónica is 25 and single. She does not have her parents, and she lives with her brothers and sisters. She makes and sells typical clothes like güipiles (ponchos). She has been dong this for more than six years. She sells in different municipalities and in the Chimaltenango department. The loan is to expand her business by purchasing more typical clothing like cortes (skirts). Her dreams are to have a place for her business, and that her business grows so that she can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business of selling typical clothing

loans.name: Zainab Abdul Shakoor Group

texts.en:
Zainab baji is the group leader of this group of four ladies. They are all very hardworking ladies. They handle their own businesses and help their husbands in their employment as well. Zainab baji is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her husband’s vegetable selling business.

Of the other ladies, Zareena baji wants a loan to buy fruits to sell, Naziran baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes, and Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo en el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Ana R. se dedica a su negocio de venta de frutas y algunas bebidas en las cercanías del mercado específicamente cercana a una estación de buses.

Actualmente, la señora Ana ha venido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas para ofrecerlas. Es de importancia destacar que a sus 64 años de vida, sigue esforzándose por salir adelante en su negocio que requiere de mucha inversión.
texts.en:
With great effort, Ana R. sells fruits and drinks in the wholesale market of Managua. She is located close to the bus station in the outskirts of the market. Ana has now come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy fruits to sell. It is important to point out that at age 64; she continues to strive to get ahead in her business. The business needs a big investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario es esposa y madre de familia, responsable del cuidado de la casa que hace poco tiempo adquirió con mucho esfuerzo junto a su pareja. Cada fin de semana se dedica a venta de ropa, y con esta actividad, por más de 5 años ha obtenido los ingresos que cubrieron las necesidades económicas de su hogar. Ahora, Rosario tiene el deseo de juntar el capital necesario para instalar un bazar dentro de su casa, el cual ya está muy bien ambientado y sólo requiere de la mercadería, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando  distribuyendo sus pedidos de prendas, las cuales compra en el mercado central de su ciudad  porque los precios son muy cómodos, dándole la posibilidad de obtener mayores ganancias. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, y aunque hace algún tiempo, su grupo pasó por circunstancias negativas, supieron superarlas y ahora continúan trabajando con muchos ánimos. Con los 2000 soles que solicita adquirirá mayor cantidad de ropa para  cubrir los pedidos que tienen pendientes.
texts.en:
Rosario is a wife and mother of a family and is responsible for taking care of their house which they acquired with a lot of effort a little while ago. For the past 5 years, Rosario has sold clothes each weekend, and with this activity, she has earned income to cover the financial needs of her home. Now, Rosario wishes to put together the capital necessary to make a shop inside her house, which is already in good shape and only requires merchandise. In the meantime, she will continue working, distributing her orders for articles of clothing, which she buys in the central market of her city because the prices are very reasonable. This gives her the possibility to earn more income. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and even though it has been some time, her group passed through negative circumstances. They know how to overcome them, and now they continue working with high spirits. With the 2000 soles that she is requesting, she will acquire more clothing to cover the orders that are pending.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Cristina L. actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de cosméticos y productos personales ofrecidos en su propio tramo en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.

Ella hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito por la razón de que en Nicaragua pronto será el día de las Madres y requiere comprar más cosméticos y productos personales como carteras para ofertarlas y así tener una venta exitosa y mejorar su condición en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Cristina L. currently has a business in personal products and cosmetic sales from her own stall in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua.

Today, she has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan because in Nicaragua it will soon be Mother’s Day, and she needs to buy more cosmetics and personal products such as wallets that she can offer. In this way she can have successful sales and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and personal products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 25 años de edad, es casada, ella tiene dos hijos, el primero ya estudia su preprimaria, y la otra aun no.   Su esposo trabaja y le ayuda con su gasto de la familia, y también le ayuda en su negocio algunas veces. Hace aproximadamente 3 años y medio empezó un negocio de venta de frutas,  luego empezó otro negocio venta de ropa típica como güipiles y cortes.  Ella vende sus productos los días de mercados que son los miércoles y domingo de cada semana, en la plaza municipal su localidad.  El crédito que ella  solicita es para invertir y surtir su negocio comprando más mercadería como delantales y suéteres, porque es la época de ello.  Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y poder conseguir un local en la plaza municipal, también para tener una mejor vida con sus hijos ahora que están pequeños.
texts.en:
Isabel is 25 years old. She is married and she has two children. The first is still studying in preparatory school, and the other is not. Her husband works and he helps her with the expenses of the family, and also he sometimes helps her in her business. It has been about three and a half years since she began a business selling fruit. Later she began another business selling traditional clothing like güipiles and shorts. She sells products on market days, or on Wednesdays and Sundays of each week, in the city plaza of her area. The loan that she is asking for is to invest in and stock her business, buying more merchandise like aprons and sweaters, because it’s the season for them. Her dream is to grow her business and to be able to get a location in the city plaza, and also to have a better life with her children now while they are little.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business selling traditional clothing

loans.name: Hatun Tarpuy Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Hatún Tarpuy son D. la comunidad D. Yaruca, distrito D. Vinchos, Provincia D. Huamanga, Departamento D. Ayacucho, la comunidad se ubica a 1 hora y 45 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
Adela es casada, tiene 6 hijos el mayor D. 16 años y el menor D. 1 año, Adela compra y venD. verduras en su comunidad y también en ferias, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos, con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar cerdos para engordarlos y también verduras, Adela esta ahorrando para comprar las cosas que necesita y sueña con mejorar su negocio, educar a sus hijos.
Celestina es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, Celestina comenzó con su negocio desD. muy joven, compra quesos D. su comunidad que luego comercializa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, también teje chompas a pedido, con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar quesos y lana. Celestina sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
Paulina es casada y tiene 6 hijos, Paulina se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores en su misma comunidad, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus esposo e hijos, Paulina sueña con ahorrar lo suficiente para asegurar el futuro D. su familia y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Hatún Tarpuy are from the community Yaruca, in the district of Vinchos, in the province of Huamanga, in the department of Ayachucho. The community is located one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock. Adela is married. She has 6 children, the eldest of whom is 16 and the youngest of whom is 1. Adela buys and sells vegetables in her community and also in markets. For this she has the help of her husband and children. With this loan she would begin a project buying pigs in order to fatten them, and also vegetables. Adela is saving to buy the things that she needs and she dreams of improving her business, educating her children. Celestina is a single mother, and she has 3 children. Celestina began with her business when she was very young, buying cheeses from her community which she later sells in the city of Ayacucho. Also she takes orders for jackets. She would use her loan for her project of buying cheese and wool. Celestina dreams that her children might become professionals, and to improve her business. Paulina is married and she has 6 children. Paulina works buying and selling small animals in her own community. She manages this work with the help of her husband and children. Paulina dreams of saving enough to assure the future of her family and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals, vegetables, grains, cheese, and wool.

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Vilma C. posee su propio tramo en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde se dedica a su actividad de venta de bisuterías como lo son alcancías, cepillos, coladores, perchas, pastes, panas plásticas, entre otros ofertados todos los días en su localidad.

Ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de las bisuterías ya que requiere adquirirlas para ofertarlas y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio y continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Señora Vilma C. has her own plot in the major market of the city of Managua, where she works at the activity of selling costume jewellery and things like piggy banks, brushes, colanders, coat hangers, dish clothes, among other offerings every day in her neighbourhood.
