She is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy her wares as she needs to get them in order to sell them, and by this manner move ahead in her business and to continue maintaining her nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wares

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad nació en la ciudad de Lima hace 40 años, contrajo matrimonio, y fruto de esa unión tuvo 4 hijos. Segura de que la venta de cervezas y gaseosas le generaría buenos ingresos, inició su negocio hace 2 años, en lo cuales, su buen trato, cortesía y la alegría que trasmite le sirvieron para cautivar a sus clientes, y la demanda fue aumentando, superando sus metas e incrementando su carga de trabajo. Trinidad tiene nuevas proyecciones, siendo una de ellas la instalación de un bar en el centro de su distrito, por lo que está buscando un local en una zona atractiva donde abunden centros comerciales y de recreación para aprovechar la concurrencia de personas. Esta idea la concretará con el apoyo de su pareja, quien incondicionalmente se ha involucrado en las labores que embarga esta actividad. Este es el 8vo préstamo de Trinidad con MFP, y junto a sus compañeras del banco comunal tienen a la perseverancia y a la paciencia como las claves de desarrollo con las que trabajan. Los 3500 soles que solicita serán utilizados para aumentar la cantidad de cajas de bebidas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Trinidad was born in the city of Lima 40 years ago. She married, and the fruit of this union is the four children she had. Confident that the sale of beers and sodas would generate a good income, she began a business two years ago. Her good relations, courtesy and the joy that she transmits brought in customers, and demand grew, exceeding her goals and increasing her workload. Trinidad has new goals, including the installation of a bar in the center of her district. She is looking for a location in an attractive neighborhood with a lot of recreation and shopping centers so that she will benefit from the numbers of people. She will achieve this with the support of her partner, who has involved himself unconditionally in the labor that this will entail. This is Trinidad’s eighth loan with the MFP. Together with her colleagues in the communal bank, they have perseverance and patience as keys to the development of their work. The 3500 soles that she requests will be used to increase the number of boxes of drinks that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hanifan Amanat Ali Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a group leader of this group of four ladies. She is a very responsible and noble lady, and she manages her group well. They all handle their own businesses to support their households. Hanifan baji is applying for a loan to buy flour for her bread making business.

Of the other ladies, Ghulam sugran baji wants a loan to buy medicines to sell, Parveen kosar baji wants a loan to buy ice to sell, and Khurhseed baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy flour to bake bread

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar Muhammad Khalid Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji is the group leader of this group of four. They are all very supportive of each other. The other three members respect Naseem baji very much. They are very hardworking ladies. They handle their own businesses to share the financial burden of their husbands. Naseem baji wants  a loan to buy clothes for her husband’s clothes selling business.

Of the other ladies, Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell, Asia baji wants a loan to buy a bicycle for her bicycle selling business, and Suraiya begum baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Sumaq Huaytas De Arizona Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huaytas son D. la comunidad D. Arizona, Distrito D. Vinchos, Provincia D. Huamanga y Departamento D. Ayacucho.
La comunidad se ubica a 45 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, las actividades primordiales D. la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería.
Hilaria es casada y tiene 7 hijos, Hilaria venD. cereales que compra en su comunidad y luego los comercializa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Hilaria menciona que en su Banco aprendió a ahorrar y le gustan las capacitaciones, Hilario con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar maíz, cebada.
Consuelo es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo recién nacido, Consuelo venD. cereales que compra en su comunidad y luego lo comercializa en la ciudad D. Pisco, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. cereales, los sueños D. Consuelos son ampliar su negocio y ahorrar lo suficiente para su hijo.
Luzmila es casada y tiene 12 hijos que ya son mayores, Luzmila se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores que luego venD. en las ferias D. su zona, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. cereales variados. los sueños D. Luzmila son educar a sus hijos en la universidad y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Sumaq Huaytas Community Bank are from the Arizona community, Vinchos District, Huamanga Province in the Department of Ayacucho.

The community is located 45 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The main economic activities of the region are agriculture and livestock.

Hilaria is married and has 7 children. Hilaria sells cereals that she buys in the community and later sells in the city of Ayacucho. Hilaria mentions that through her bank she learned to save and she likes the trainings. With this loan, Hilaria plans to buy corn and barley.

Consuelo is a single mother and has 1 infant child. Consuelo sells cereals that she buys in the community and later sells in the city of Pisco. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of cereals. Consuelo’s dreams are to expand her business and save enough for her child.

Luzmila is married and has 12 children, all older. Luzmila raises young animals that she later sells in the local fairs. She works with her children. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of various cereals. Luzmila’s dreams are to educate her children in the university and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals, young animals, sugar and rice

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna es madre de 2 hijos por quienes trata de trabajar para brindarles lo mejor, y gracias al trabajo de su esposo tienen una casa donde vivir y establecerse. Cuando se casó empezó a preocuparse por su económica, ya que sus necesidades crecían y su pareja no podía solventar solo los gastos que demandaban sus hijos, por esta necesidad se inició en el comercio ambulante. Hace 3 años empezó a vender ropa y utensilios de cocina de casa en casa, pero al obtener la experiencia necesaria, desde hace 1 año comenzó a trabajar a pedidos que le solicitan cada fin de mes, y solo vende en las calles los fines de semana en los mercados. Ahora, gracias al apoyo de su pareja está terminando de construir su casa, donde piensa invertir sus ahorros de varios años de trabajo para instalar una tienda de comestibles. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, lo que le está abriendo las puertas para progresar, y entablar nuevas relaciones con las señoras que integran su banco comunal. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará mercadería, ya que sus pedidos han aumentado y no contaba con el capital necesario para cubrir la inversión, más ahora tendrá la posibilidad de distribuir sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Digna is the mother of two children, and she works to offer them the best. Thanks to the work of her husband, they have a house to live and settle in. When she married, she began to worry about their finances, since their needs grew, and her partner couldn’t afford the costs that their children demanded. For this reason she began to work as a traveling salesperson. Three years ago, she began to sell clothes and kitchen utensils from door to door to obtain necessary experience. Since one year ago, she began to work in orders at the end of every month, and she only sold in the streets on weekends at the markets. Now, thanks to the support of her partner, she is finishing the construction of her home where she hopes to invest various years of savings to install a grocery store. This is her first loan with MFP. It is opening the doors to progress and establishing new relationships with the women in her community bank. With the 1000 soles, she will buy merchandise, since her orders have grown, and she doesn’t have the necessary capital to cover the investment. Now she will be able to distribute her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Kalsoom Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom akhtar baji is the group leader of this group of four ladies. She is a very responsible lady. These ladies handle their businesses to financially support their households. Kalsoom baji  is applying for a loan to buy material (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her husband’s food selling business.

Of the other ladies, Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food selling business, Fozia baji wants a loan to buy medicines to sell, and Gulnaz baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food selling business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Eugenia es casada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Eugenia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado, en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, cereales, además Eugenia tiene teléfonos públicos.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, gaseosa, aceite y azúcar.
Los sueños de Eugenia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios universitarios y construir su casa para tener una local propio.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Communal Bank Triunfo. She is married, 44 years old, and has 2 children. Eugenia has a store in a rented locale where she sells general merchandise, vegetables, and grains. She also has a public telephone. Eugenia needs a loan of 2600 soles that will be invested in the purchase of milk, soft drinks, oil and sugar. Eugenia's dreams are that her children complete their university studies and to build her own home so she have her store there.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of milk, soft drinks, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Elberta

texts.es:
Elberta es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Elberta es casada, tiene 53 años y 8 hijos, Elberta tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende comida típica, como caldos y segundos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Elberta necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, papa y leña.
Elberta sueña con construir una tienda para tener una pollería y una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Elberta is a member of Communal Bank Triunfo. She is married, 53 years old, and has 8 children. Elberta has a stand in the city's central market where she sells typical food, such as soups and meals, which she makes each day. She needs a loan of 2400 soles that she will use to purchase rice, oil, potatoes and firewood. Elberta dreams of building a store where she can sell chickens and general merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, oil, potatoes, and firewood.

loans.name: Amna Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Amna baji is the leader of Amna M. R. Group, a group with two other women. The other group members are very happy with Amna baji because she treats them well and with respect. They all are very hardworking women who work to pay the utility bills. Amna baji is applying for a loan to buy more grocery items for her grocery store.  Mumtaz baji will use the loan money to buy wood to resell, and Suraiya baji plans to buy more clothes for her clothing sales business. 

As a group loan, the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee the entire amount of the group loan, that is, f one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Reyna es casada, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Reyna tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, leña, cereales, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su esposo. El esposo de Reyna tiene una imprenta que se ubica en el centro de la ciudad en un local alquilado.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y arroz.
Reyna sueña con ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of Communal Bank Triunfo. She is married, 31 years old, and has 3 children. Reyna has a shop in her home where she sells general merchandise, vegetables, firewood and grains. She works there every day with occasional help from her husband. Her husband has a printing press in a rented locale in the center of town. Reyna needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will use to purchase sugar and rice. She dreams of growing her business and that her children will grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sugar and rice

loans.name: Edna Patricia

texts.es: Edna Patricia C. V. D. C.  vive en San Salvador capital D. El Salvador. Edna tiene 43 años D. edad es V. y madre un hijo. Edna recibe una pensión luego fallecimiento D. su esposo. Edna es odontóloga D. profesión tiene un consultorio ubicado fuera D. la ciudad, ya que la competencia en la capital es más granD., Edna solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar un compresor para su trabajos dentales y un aire acondicionado para su consultorio.
texts.en:
Edna Patricia C. (widow of C.) lives in San Salvador, the capital of El Salvador. She is a 43-year-old widow with one son. Edna has received a pension since her husband's death, but also works as a dentist; she has an office outsiD. the city as there is too much competition in the capital itself. Edna needs this loan to buy a compressor for her dental work and air conditioning for her office.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a compressor and air conditioner for her dental practice

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Dionicia es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Dionicia junto a su esposo venden desayunos, actividad que realizan diariamente y ambulatoriamente en dos lugares distintos de alta concurrencia. Además tienen un carro con el cual su esposo realiza taxi en la ciudad.
Dionicia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, avena, aceite y quinua.
Los sueños de Dionicia son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Dionicia is a member of Triunfo ("Triumph") Communal Bank. She is married, 39 years old, and has 3 children. She and her husband are ambulatory vendors of breakfast meals. They work in various highly transited locations. They also have a car and her husband works as a taxi driver in the city. Dionicia needs a loan of 2000 soles that she will use to purchase sugar, oats, oil, and quinoa. Dionicia's dream is that her children will grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sugar, oats, oil, and quinoa

loans.name: Modesta Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Yolanda es casada, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Yolanda vende calzados y ropa de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza de casa en casa a amigos y familiares, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados.
Los sueños de Yolanda son mejorar su negocio, tener una tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of Triunfo ("Triumph") Communal Bank. She is married, 46 years old, and has 4 children. Yolanda sells shoes and clothing as requested by her customers. She gets her products in Lima and sells them door to door among friends and acquaintances. Yolanda needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase shoes. Yolanda's dreams are to improve her business, to have a store, and that her children grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of shoes

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia Y. is a 35 year-old divorced restaurant operator who currently lives with her parents, along with her two children who attend the local school.  Felicia understands business ethics and knows that customers are her income so she provides good quality and excellent service.  She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and is generally eaten with different kinds of soup.  Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper sauce or soup.  Felicia has attracted lots of customers with her tasty meals, and it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in her food delivering service.  Also, Felicia says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to help meet her production costs.  She will use the loan to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood to prepare her meals.  She would be grateful for such assistance.  Felicia belongs to the village bank called ‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tienen 20 años, es una joven madre muy tranquila, vive con su pareja en una casa alquilada, es madre de una niña de 3 años, que es el motivo de su esfuerzo. La compra, crianza y venta de cuyes es el negocio que realiza diariamente, la carne de sus cuyes es muy solicitada en las ferias dominicales, ya que se encarga de alimentarlos bien y se preocupan de que desarrollen un buen tamaño; por ello, todos los días se levanta muy temprano  para cortar el pasto fresco para que se alimenten y no consuman las avenas ni alfalfa almacenada para los meses de sequía. Nelly cuida con mucho cariño a sus animalitos, ya que sabe que gracias a ellos captará el dinero para cubrir sus necesidades. Los 2 años que lleva en este negocio le enseñaron a criar y desparasitar a sus roedores oportunamente para ofrecer carne sana y saludable a todos sus clientes. Para más adelante, Nelly espera incrementar la cantidad de cuyes que posee, asimismo construir unas jaulas adecuadas, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es escoger la mala hierba de entre el pasto con que los alimenta, porque si no lo hace significaría la muerte de los cuyes que la coman. Nelly muy orgullosa, nos muestra a sus cuyes en la foto. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y en este crédito hace compromisos de cumplir sus pagos en las fechas programadas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a construir jaulas para sus numerosos cuyes, y de ese modo seleccionarlos de acuerdo el tamaño, también comprará alimentos concentrados para el desarrollo y engorde de sus animalitos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 20 years old, and is a very tranquil young mother. She lives with her partner in a rented home. She is the mother of a 3 year old girl, who is the motivation for her efforts. Her business is the purchase, care and sale of guinea pigs. The meat from her guinea pigs is in high demand at Sunday fairs because she feeds them well and ensures they grow to a good size. To do this, she gets up very early each day to cut grass to feed them. She prevents them from eating oats and alfalfa which is stored for months when there is drought. Nelly cares for her little animals with a lot of love, as she knows that it is thanks to them that she brings in money to meet her needs. The two years she has spent in this business have taught her to care for her animals and keep them parasite free in order to offer healthy meat to all her customers. In the future, Nelly hopes to increase the number of guinea pigs that she has, and to build appropriate cages for them. She finds that the most difficult part of her work is to root out bad weeds in the grass that she uses to feed the animals, because if she doesn't the guinea pigs that eat them will die. Nelly proudly shows us her guinea pigs in this photo. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is committed to making payments on the dates scheduled by her loan advisor. The money that she is requesting will be used to have cages built for her many guinea pigs. With this she will be able to select them according to size. She will also purchase concentrated feed for the development and fattening up of her little animals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed and construction of cages

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba D. is a 38-year-old married mother of two children. One of her children has completed junior high school and the other is still attending school.  She lives with her family in Mankessim which is in the central region of Ghana.  Aba has been a baker for four years now. She bakes bread, cakes, meat pie, and other items and sells them to her customers in the market center.  She is now having trouble to cover the cost of raw materials because of rising prices.  Therefore she requests a loan to help her remain in business.  With the loan she believes she can continue to provide for her family and most especially her children's education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To buy baking materials.

loans.name: Milcerio

texts.es: Milcerio tiene 46 años, es un hombre muy sensible y responsable, vive felizmente con su esposa que es la madre de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales viven con tres de ellos que lo apoyan en los trabajos agrícolas. La siembra y cosecha de papa es la actividad a la que se dedica diariamente desde hace 30 años, pero antes de acudir a su chacra alimenta a los animales que tiene como su burro y sus mulas, los cuales le son muy útiles para transportar los sacos durante la cosecha. Por ello que a  las 8.00am sus animales ya deben estar bien alimentados para que no sientan cansancio ni hambre durante la jornada de ida y vuelta a su almacén. Después de haber acumulado las papas, comienza la selección con la ayuda de su esposa, y finalmente los transporta al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Milcerio ama la labor que realiza, puesto que sabe que gracias a ella obtendrá el dinero para sostener a su familia. En los 30 años que lleva en esta actividad ha disfrutado de la abundancia de sus cosechas que le permitieron vivir temporadas de bonaza, como también de impotencia al ver que sus siembras se quedaban bajo el hielo y otras veces los gusanos malograban la totalidad de sus cultivos, pero esas circunstancias sólo han sido pasajeras, pues no han mellado en su ánimo de seguir luchando para mantener a su familia. Este es el cuarto crédito de Milcerio con MFP, durante los anteriores ciclos demostró mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos, y para este ciclo se compromete seguir la misma dinámica, ya que los demás integrantes son muy buenos colaboradores para el progreso de su banco comunal. Los dos mil soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Milcerio is 46 years old, he is a very sensible and responsible man. He lives happily with his wife, the mother of his 5 children, three of whom are still with them and help him work the fields. He sows and harvests potatoes, daily work that he has been carrying out for the last 30 years. But even before he starts tending to his fields he must feed the his donkey and his mules. They help him transport the large sacks of harvest. By 8a.m. the animals must already be well fed so that they do not feel tired or become hundre during the trip to and from the silos. After having collected the potatoes he and his wife must go through a selection process, and only then will they transport them to the wholesale markets in the city of Tarma. Miclerio loves his work and it is thanks to this work that he obtains money to support his family. In the 30 years that he has been working he has enjoyed abundant harvests, giving him the opportunity to live through times of plenty. He has also seen harvests fall under a sheet of ice and other harvests that were completely spoiled by pests. But these times of hardship have been temporary and they have not impeded his will to keep struggling for the sake of his family. This is the fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). In the past he has shown great responsibility in his payments and for this time around he promises to be equally responsible. The others inthe group are wonderful collaborators in the progress of their community bank. The two thousand soles he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for this next harvest.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Walberto

texts.es: Walberto es un joven emprendedor de 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, donde comparte su cuarto con sus hermanos menores. Desde muy niño apoyó en los trabajos agrícolas de sus padres, porque se dio cuenta que sus hermanos son muy pequeños y tiene muchas limitaciones con sus estudios, por eso decidió trabajar sembrando papas en chacras alquiladas, las cuales paga anualmente. Los primeros años no le resultó muy rentable, por ello se cambió a terrenos de regadío, donde sus productos tienen mejor desarrollo y su cosecha es abundante, por ello los cuida con mucho esmero, puesto que sus ganancias dependerán de su producción, y podrá apoyar a sus hermanitos. Walberto está muy complacido con sus productos, por eso le pide a su padre prestados los asnos de carga, ya que tiene varios sacos acumulados que esperan ser trasladados hasta a una zona baja, y desde allí al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, donde los comercializa. Es el 4to préstamo que tienen con MFP, durante estos ciclos ha sido muy puntual con cada una de sus cuotas, Walberto es muy gracioso e ingenioso, y sabe arrancarles sonrisas a los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. Y en este nuevo ciclo reitera su compromiso de seguir pagando puntualmente. Los dos mil soles que solicita los usará para incrementar su próxima producción, adquiriendo todo lo necesario para su siembra, de ese modo se sentirá más útil para sus hermanos menores.
texts.en:
Walberto is an enterprising young 20-year-old man. He lives at home with his parents, where he shares a room with his younger brothers. Ever since he was quite young, Walberto has helped his parents farm, since he realized that his siblings are very young and are busy with their studies. For this reason, he decided to start planting potatoes on rented farmland, which he pays for on an annual basis. The first few years were not very profitable, so he switched to irrigated land, where his potatoes grow better and he can produce abundant harvests. He takes very good care of his land, since his income depends on his production, and this way he can help support his younger siblings. Walberto takes pleasure in his work, and borrows his parents' donkeys so that he can transport the many sacks of potatoes he has accumulated to a lower-elevation area, then to the city of Tarma, where he will sell them. This is Walberto's fourth loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA; he has repaid all of his previous loan installments punctually. Walberto is very funny and clever and always knows how to make the other members of his village bank laugh. In this loan cycle, he has reiterated his commitment to making all of his payments on time. The 2000 soles he is requesting will be used to help him produce a more bountiful harvest. He will buy everything he needs for planting potatoes so that he will feel that he is helping out his siblings even more than he currently is.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de su producción agrícola

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en: Mamuna A. is 34 years-old. She is married with two children who are currently in school. She lives in Dorma Ahenkro which is in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells waakye and banku.  Waakye is cooked rice and beans that is usually served with stew, macaroni, and fish.  Banku is prepared from milled maize and is usually eaten with soup or stew.  It is sold in the mornings as breakfast.  It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy both dishes.  She also sells other food stuffs in the market.  She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, and tubers of yams to increase her stock of goods.  With the loan she believes she can help support her husband in taking care of the family needs. She belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, and tubers of yams.

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena D. is a 45-year-old married father of six children. Presently all of the kids are attending school.  Kwabena lives with his family in Dorma which is in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.  Kwabena thinks Dorma Ahenkro is a community you would love to visit because of its serene atmosphere and the unity that exists among the people who live there.  It is a farming area and the common thing that can found there, apart from the food crops they cultivate, is the use of bicycles.  Almost everyone owns a bicycle which they ride to the farm, to school - almost everywhere. Kwabena is a professional bicycle repairer and he also sells bicycle parts.  He has been in this business for the past 20 years and this is how he supports his family. 

He travels to the nearby town of Kumasi to purchase his bicycle parts. He will use the loan to buy more bicycle parts so he can better stock his inventory to avoid traveling everyday, and have more parts on hand to service his clients.  With the support of a loan he believes he can better provide a quality education for his children. He belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To buy more spare bicycle parts for his repair shop.

loans.name: Akwasi

texts.en:
Akwasi A. is a 49-year-old married father with three children.  Presently one child attends the senior high school. Akwasi lives with his family in Dorma which is in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.  Dorma Ahenkro is a community you would love to visit because of its serene atmosphere and the unity that exists among the people who live there. It is a farming area and the common thing that can found there, apart from the food crops they cultivate, is the use of bicycles. Almost everyone owns a bicycle which they ride to the farm, to school - almost everywhere. Akwasi is a professional bicycle repairer and he also sells bicycle parts. He has been in this business for the past 6 years and this is how he supports his family.

Akwasi travels to the nearby town of Kumasi to purchase his bicycle parts. He will use the loan to buy more bicycle parts so he can better stock his inventory to avoid traveling everyday, and have more parts on hand to service his clients. With the support of a loan he believes he can better provide a quality education for his children. He belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle parts for his repair services.

loans.name: Issah

texts.en: Issah M. is a married 60-year-old father of six children. Currently two of his children attend school and the others are working.  Issah lives with his family in Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Currently he has a shop in the community market where he operates a corn and vegetable milling machine.  Lots of food vendors come to him for milling.  Unfortunately the machine has been breaking down constantly and preventing him from servicing his clients. This has reduced his profit margins drastically and he is therefore appealing to you for loan assistance.  He will use the loan to repair the existing milling machine and buy new ones. He would be grateful for your assistance. He belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To repair and buy milling machines.

loans.name: Mukhtaran Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran baji is the leader of this group with four other female members.  All of these women run their own businesses and use the earnings to pay off their home utility bills.  Mukhtaran baji plans to use the loan to buy another buffalo for her milk sales business. Nasreen baji will buy scrap for her scrap business and Bashiran baji will buy shoes to resell.  Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy mason tools and Hina baji will buy some creams, cosmetics, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

As a group loan, the funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually agree to guarantee the entire loan, that is, if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk selling business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rehana Ashraf Masih Group

texts.en:
Rehana baji is the wife of A. M. and the leader of this loan group which has four other female members. All of the women live in the city of Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. They are all very hardworking and determined ladies who run their own businesses.  They use the income to pay the utility bills for their families. Rehana baji will use her part of the loan to buy wheat and rice at wholesale prices.  Allah rakhi baji will buy clothes to resell and Naziran baji plans to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.  Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart and Tahira baji will buy goats for her animal selling business.

As a group loan, the funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business, but they all mutually guarantee the entire loan.  That is, if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wheat and rice at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson A. is a 48-year-old married father of five children.  His oldest child is in senior high school and the others still attend primary school.  Johnson has been a food vendor for one year now and he sells rice with beans stew.  Many people buy from him because of the tasty meals he prepares.  He also sells grocery products like milk, canned drinks, and other items.  Johnson says the demand for his food has been high, with many customers, and he would like to use a loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, and charcoal, among other things.  He is certain that the loan would help him have more stock and be better prepared in the event of price increases.  Johnson will use the income to supports his children and their education. He says he would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his food selling business.

loans.name: Anayatan Nawab Hussain Group

texts.en:
Rani baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Sajida baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Veeru begum baji wants a loan to buy mason’s tools.

Anayatan baji is the wife of N. H. who has lived in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past ten years. She is the group leader of these ladies. She is a very responsible and a very hardworking lady. She is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart for her husband because his old cart has become rough and rotted, which is effecting his work.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for her husband

loans.name: Ansu

texts.en: Ansu G. is forty-six years old and married with five children. He lives with the family at Dorma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. He buys vulcanizing materials from Kumasi and uses them to work on his clients' cars. He is consistent with his work but he is handicapped by low working capital since car tyres and rims are very expensive. He therefore needs the loan to remain in business. He wants to use the loan to buy additional vulcanizing materials to serve his customers. He believes this will enable him to make a good income for his business. He says he would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy vulcanizing equipment and materials.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia M. U. de 54 años de edad reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo e hijos, los cuales no dependen económicamente de ella. Ana Julia posee una tienda en su casa la cual ya tiene cinco años de poseerla. Debido a que es el único negocio en el lugar, ella logra vender muchos de sus productos. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar nueva mercadería y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, ya que desea poder ayudar económicamente a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, debido a que él es carpintero y en muchas ocasiones el trabajo no es constante, Ana Julia espera mejorar las ventas y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Julia M. U. is 54 years of age and resides in the department of Ahuachapán with her husband and children, who no longer depend on her financially. Ana Julia has her own general store, located in her home. She has been in business for 5 years. Because of the fact that this is the only store in the area, she manages to sell many products. She is requesting a loan with which she can purchase more goods, thus boosting profits. She wants to be able to help her husband with the household expenses because he is a carpenter and does not have steady work. Ana Julia hopes to improve sales and increase profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is thirty-three years old and is married with two children. Kwame has been a carpenter and a mason for the past twelve years. He lives with his children and his wife who is a seamstress.

Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture. He produces dining tables, sitting room chairs, etc. 

He says for lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This, he said, slows down his work because he necessarily has to wait for funds from his customers before any work could begin. Most often this delays the work. He requests the loan to enable him to procure useful working tools and finishing materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, etc. to improve his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income to ensure good living for his family.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and finishing materials

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. is forty-five years old. She is married and the mother of six children. All of the children are in school. She has been a manufacturer of palm oil for seven years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits, and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil.

Alima produces and supplies the oil to food vendors to prepare their meals, and she even treks to the villages to purchase the finished product elsewhere when demand becomes very high. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and gallon containers to store the oil, and to increase her efficiency by producing oil in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family and to finance her children's education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means "see what the Lord has done."

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to produce palm oil in larger quantities.

loans.name: Silvia Melany

texts.es: Silvia Melany A. D. A. resiD. en Zaragoza departamento D. La libertad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo el cual trabaja como carpintero desD. ya hace siete años. Ella posee una venta D. verduras en las calles D. Zaragoza, su negocio se encuentra en un lugar muy estratégico ya que mucha gente transita por el lugar. Silvia solicita un préstamo para que D. esta manera obtenga el dinero necesario para comprar más verduras y así poder mejorar sus ventas y al mismo tiempo su condición económica ya que gran parte D. los gastos del hogar se suplen gracias a las ganancias D. dicho negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia Melany A. D. A. lives in Zaragoza, La Libertad. She lives together with her two children and her husband, a carpenter with 7 years' experience. She sells vegetables in the streets of Zaragoza. Her stand is located in a very strategic place having many people come through there. Silvia requests a loan to obtain more vegetables and to improve her sales. She will enhance her financial status because a large part of the household expenses are covered thanks to her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Naún Efraín

texts.es: Naún Efraín B. B. reside en la colonia el Cimarrón en el departamento de La Libertad. Su grupo familiar está constituido por un hijastro y su compañera de vida, la cual se dedica a vender zapatos y a hacer pupusas (comida típica salvadoreña), de esta manera ella le ayuda a su esposo con ciertos gastos del hogar. Naún posee una tienda frente a la escuela el Cimarrón, es así como el se gana la vida y obtiene el dinero necesario para mantener su hogar junto a su esposa. El solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar el inventario de su negocio, ya que cuando los niños de la escuela salen de clases compran en su tienda, circunstancia que le incentiva a seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Naún Efraín B. B. lives in the Cimarrón residential development in La Libertad Department. His family is made up of his wife and stepson. Naún's wife sells shoes and makes pupusas (a typical Salvadorian dish) in order to help him with household expenses. Naún earns a living and helps his wife support the family with his store, located across the street from the El Cimarrón School. He is requesting a loan that will allow him to increase his inventory, since when children get out of school they come right to his store. This is what motivates him to keep moving forward with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new products for store

location.town: El Cimarrón, Departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Flora Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Flora Lucila Huamán M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac” , vive en el Barrio 2 de Mayo S/N, del Distrito de Catac - Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash.  Está casada, tiene 06 hijos, de los cuales sólo 01 hija se encuentra en su poder, en tanto que el resto de sus hijos ya tienen sus familias constituidas.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró carnero para la venta de carne en el mercado de Lima – Huamantanga.  Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac” desde hace 03 años.  Ella se siente muy agradecida porque aprendió el ahorro y la práctica de la solidaridad entre otros.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siempre vendiendo en Lima, y se apoya con su esposo que también vende en Lima.  El vende verduras y papas que lleva desde el Callejón de Huaylas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará más carneros para vender la carne al por menor y así obtener mayores ganancias.
 Ella se siente una mujer realizada por haber logrado darles una profesión a sus 05 hijos y dar estudios a su hija menor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flora Lucila Huamán M. belongs to the "Las Triunfadores de Catac" ("The Triumphant Women of Catac") Village Bank. She lives in the 2 de Mayo neighborhood in an unnumbered house in Catac District, Recuay Province, Ancash Department. She is married and has six children. Just one of her daughters still lives at home, since her other children all have families of their own. With her first loan of 300 soles, Flora bought a ram so that she could sell the meat in the Lima - Huamantanga Market. She has been a member of her village bank for the past three years, and is very grateful because she has learned to save and learned about the concept of solidarity, among other things. At present, Flora has the same business selling meat in Lima. She and her husband support one another; he also works as a vendor in Lima, selling vegetables and potatoes that he brings from the Callejón de Huaylas Valley. With this loan of 800 soles, Flora will buy more rams to sell their meat by the kilo so that she can increase her income. She feels like an accomplished woman, since five of her children are now working professionals and her youngest daughter is in school.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rams to sell for meat

loans.name: Celia Agripina

texts.es:
La señora Celia Agripina G. C., es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Tiunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo S/N, del Distrito de Catac - Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Está casada y tiene un hogar bien constituido, madre de 03 hijos que todavía dependen económicamente de ella. Tiene 52 años de edad y se nota una mujer muy tranquila y emprendedora. trabaja en la Municipalidad Distrital de Catac como Registradora Civil.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, siendo socia del Banco Comunal “Villa Turística de Catac” , compró 02 cajas nucleras para la producción de miel de abeja. Tiene 03 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siempre ubicado en su casa, la gente del lugar ya la conocen y siempre le hacen pedidos por la calidad del producto. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 comprará una máquina cosechadora centrífuga que tiene un costo de S/. 1,200.00 para facilitar su proceso de cosecha.
Manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como mujer y empresaria, porque manifestó que también ha implementado sus cajas nucleares en el Centro Poblado de Síncuna ubicado en Recuay.
texts.en:
Ms. Celia Agripina G. Castillos is a member of the “Las Triunfadoras de Catac” Microfinance Institute. She is a married woman with a well-built home. She is a mother of three children who still depend on her financially. She is 52 years of age and appears to be a calm and enterprising woman. She works in the Catac District Municipality as a civil registrar.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan as a member of the Villa Turística de Catac Microfinance Institute, she purchased 2 beehives for honey production. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years.

She currently owns this same business, located in her house. The residents of the area know her and always order her products because of the quality. With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase a cappings spinner, which costs 1,200.00 PEN, to facilitate the harvesting process.

She expresses her gratitude to the Manuela Ramos Movement for allowing her to grow both as a woman and as an entrepreneur. She states that she has also set up beehives in the Síncuna settlement, located in Recuay.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase honey cappings spinner

loans.name: Benita Juana

texts.es:
La señora Benita Juana Ramírez D. H., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras D. Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 D. Mayo S/N, Distrito D. Catac - Provincia D. Recuay, Departamento D. Ancash. Está casada y tiene 6 hijos, sólo 1 depenD. económicamente D. ella.  Tiene 49 años D. edad y es una mujer muy alegre, entusiasta y emprendedora.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300.00  siendo socia del Banco Comunal “Villa Turística D. Ctac” compró lana D. Alpaca para tejer chompas y venderlas.
En la actualidad, tiene un negocio D. abarrotes, paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. productos D. artesanía (tejidos D. chompas), en un puesto alquilado en el mercado en la Av. 31 D. Mayo.
Con este préstamo D. S/.  800.00 comprará fideos, quaker, aceite, leche, gaseosas, papel higiénico y una parte lo invertirá en la compra D. un camión, con el cual podrá llevar carga (servicio) a la ciudad D. Lima.
Marina, se siente muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por haberle facilitado su primer crédito porque es allí donD. empezó a trabajar porque su esposo por motivos D. viaje no les podía mandar dinero para su gasto diario.
texts.en:
Ms. Benita Juana Ramírez D. H. is a member of the Las Triunfadoras D. Catac Microfinance Institute. She is a married mother with 6 children, only one of whom depends on her financially. She is a 49-year-old woman who is very cheerfull, enthusiastic, and enterprising. As a member of the Villa Turística D. Ctac Microfinance Institute, she obtained her first 300.00 PEN loan and purchased Alpaca wool to knit sweaters and sell them. She currently owns a general store. Moreover, she sells handicrafts (traditional handwoven sweaters) in a rented stand in the market on 31 D. Mayo Avenue.

With this 800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase noodles, oatmeal, cooking oil, milk, soft drink, bathroom tissue. She will use part of the loan to purchase a truck so that she can transport cargo to the city of Lima.

Marina is very grateful that Manuela Ramos has given her her first loan because that is how she started working when her husband was unable to send her money for her daily expenses due to travel reasons.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, cooking oil, milk, soft drinks, and other goods

loans.name: Carla Carolina

texts.es:
Carla es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Carla es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, estudia industrias alimentarías en la universidad, Carla se dedica al procesamiento de cereales produciendo harinas, cereales partidos, sus productos los comercializa a clientes ya establecidos y a pedido.
Carla necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de kiwicha, maca, quinua y soya.
Carla sueña con implementar una molinera y ampliar sus mercados.
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Microfinance Institute.

Carla is a 21-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. She is studying Food Techonology at the university. Carla processes grains to make flour and cracked grains. She sells her products to her fixed clientele, as well as by order.

Carla needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing kiwicha and maca (both South American plants), quinoa, and soy.

Carla dreams of setting up a mill and expanding her market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kiwicha, maca, quinoa and soy

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Maria es soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Maria vende cosméticos y edredones por catálogos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y edredones.
Maria sueña con ampliar sus negocios, terminar sus estudios de derecho y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Microfinance Institute.

Maria is a 37-year-old single mother with 2 children. She has her own general store, located in her parents’ home, in which she sells provisions and beverages. With the help of her children, Maria runs her business everyday. In addition, she sells cosmetics and bedspreads by catalog.

Maria needs a 1,200.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing soft drinks and bedspreads.

Maria dreams of expanding her businesses, of finishing her law studies, and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and comforters

loans.name: Vilma Maria's Group

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Vilma tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende abarrotes en general al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Vilma viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Vilma sueña con comprar un carro, una casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Ollantay Communal Bank. Vilma is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a stall in the Nery García market where she sells groceries wholesale and retail every day with her children's help. Vilma also travels to markets where she can buy grain. Vilma needs a loan for 1500 soles to buy grain. Vilma hopes to buy a car and a house, and for her children to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Victoria es casada, tiene 65 años y 4 hijos, Victoria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende tubérculos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo. Además Victoria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas.
El sueño de Victoria es descansar.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Ollantay community bank. She is 65, married, and has four children. She has a stand in the 12 de abril market where she sells root vegetables. She does this every day with help from her husband. Victoria also has a grocery store in her house. Victoria needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy soft drinks. Victoria’s dream is to rest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Domingo Antonio M. C. de 30 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San José Villa nueva junto a su abuela. El posee una venta de helados y paletas en el municipio de Zaragoza, contiguo a la alcaldía de dicho lugar. Domingo obtiene muy buenas ganancias ya que es un negocio en el cual posee cliente los cuales consumen sus productos constantemente. Es por esto que Domingo solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más helados y paletas, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ganancias las cuales lo beneficien a él y a su abuela.
texts.en:
Domingo Antonio M. C., 30, lives in the San José Villa Nueva municipality with his grandmother. He sells ice cream and popsicles by the town hall in the Zaragoza municipality. Domingo gets good earnings since he has customers who eat his products all of the time. That is why Domingo is asking for a loan to buy more ice cream and popsicles. This way he can increase his earnings, which will benefit him and his grandmother.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream and popsicles

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Olga viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz y cebada.
Los sueños de Olga son comprar una casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Ollantay community bank. She is 30, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Olga travels to the different fairs in the region to sell fruit. At the fairs she buys cereal to later sell in the Ayacucho city markets. Olga needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy corn and barley. Olga’s dreams are to buy a house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and barley

loans.name: Alberta Teodora

texts.es:
Alberta es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Alberta es casada, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Alberta tiene un puesto en un centro comercial ubicado en una avenida céntrica en donde vende CDs y mochilas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo.
Alberta necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de CDs, mochilas.
Los sueños de Alberta son ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alberta is a member of the Ollantay community bank. Alberta, 50, is married and has six children. Alberta has a stand in the commercial center, which is located on a central avenue, where she sells CDs and backpacks. She does this every day with her son’s help. Alberta needs a loan for 750 PEN to buy CDs and backpacks. Alberta’s dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs and backpacks

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Felicitas tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donD. venD. carne, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo, Felicitas viaja a las ferias en donD. compra los animales que luego beneficia en el camal D. la ciudad y venD. al por mayor.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno.
Felicitas sueña con tener otra sucursal y tener un establo en la selva ayacuchana.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Ollantay community bank. Felicitas, 53, is married and has three children. She has a stand in the Nery García market where she sells meat. She does this with her husband’s help. Felicitas travels to the fairs where she buys animals and later takes them to the city slaughterhouse. She then sells the meat wholesale. Felicitas needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy cattle. Felicitas dreams of having another branch and of having a stable in the Ayacuchana jungle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Roxana Tania

texts.es:
Ella es la señora Roxana Taina León Huamán, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo S/N, Distrito de Catac - Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Es conviviente, tiene 25 años y es madre de 01 niña.  Ahora espera otro bebe, los que dependen económicamente de ella.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró 03 chanchos para su crianza y posterior venta de carne, al misma que lleva a Lima a venderlos en el mercado de San Martín de Porras.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siempre llevando sus productos a la ciudad de Lima.  Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 comprará 03 carneros para la venta al por menor (carne).  Aprovecha sus viajes a Lima para vender lana al por menor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Roxana Taina León Huamán is a member of the "Las Triunfadoras de Catec" ("The Triumphant Women of Catec") Village Bank. She lives on 31 de Mayo Avenue in an unnumbered house in Catec District, Recuay Province, Ancash Department. She is 25 years old and has one daughter; she is currently expecting her second child, and will financially support both of her children. With her first loan of 300 soles, Roxana bought three pigs, which she raised and sold for meat. She sells the meat in the San Martin de Porras Market in the city of Lima. She is still in this same line of work, and travels regularly to Lima to sell her meat. With this loan of 300 soles, Roxana will buy three rams so that she can sell their meat by the kilo. She also takes advantage of her trips to Lima to sell wool by the kilo.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy three rams

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Julia es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Julia es artesana, realiza tejidos en palito y bordados, Julia integra una asociación llamado Basilio Auqui integrado por 18 mujeres, los trabajos que realizan son a pedido y exportan a diferentes mercados.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana.
Julia sueña con ser empresaria, ampliar sus mercados y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Ollantay Village Bank. She is 50 years old and married with five children. Julia is an artisan who does knitting and embroidery. She is a member of a local association called Basilio Auqui, made up of 18 women who take orders and export their work to different markets. Julia needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy wool. She dreams of owning her own business, of exporting to more markets, and that her children will grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for knitting

loans.name: Ana Mabel

texts.es: Ana Mabel P. V. de 52 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque junto a sus dos hijos menores de edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana posee una venta de jugos y licuados de frutas naturales, los cuales los vende de manera ambulante en Cojutepeque. Ella se esfuerza día con día para brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual tenga la capacidad de comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de los jugos y licuados, los cuales ya tiene ocho años de comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Ana Mabel P. V. is 52 years old and lives in Cojutepeque with her two children, who are still minors and are currently in school. Ana sells natural fruit juices and smoothies from a mobile cart in Cojutepata. She works hard each day to provide her children with everything they need, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to make juice and smoothies. She has had this business for the past eight years.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make juices and smoothies

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión inicia su tercer ciclo con 13 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. Ropa, abarrotes en general, cereales, golosinas, verduras, comidas y artesanías
	
Como es el caso D. Nelly que es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Nelly venD. abarrotes en general D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, además Nelly venD. cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares.
	
Mientras que Susana es casada, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Susana tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Susana venD. comida los días lunes en la feria D. las Nazarenas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 6,700 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. verduras, azúcar, arroz, leche, ropa, lanas, tintes.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios para el sustento D. sus familias, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Nueva Ilusión ("New Illusion") Village Bank has 13 members and is currently beginning its third loan cycle. The group members have different businesses, and sell clothing, basic grocery items, grains, candy, vegetables, prepared meals and art. For example, Nelly is 34 years old and married with two children. She sells basic grocery items on foot in the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells catalog cosmetics to friends and family members. Another group member, Susana, is 54 years old and married with six children. Susana runs a neighborhood grocery store from her home, which she opens seven days a week. She also sells prepared meals on Mondays at the Nazarenas market. The group members are requesting different loan amounts, such as 300, 600 or 900 soles. In total, the village bank is requesting a loan of 6,700 soles. Group members will use their loans to buy vegetables, sugar, rice, milk, clothing, wool and dyes. Some of the group members' dreams are to expand their businesses in order to better support their families, to proviD. their children with a good education, and to own their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, sugar, rice, milk, clothing, wool and dyes

loans.name: Muyurina Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Muyurina inicia su ciclo 17 con 15 socias, las socias son D. la comunidad D. Muyurina distrito D. Tambillo.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, abarrotes en general, comidas y agricultura.
	
Como es el caso D. Julia que es casada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Julia tiene un puesto en un nuevo mercadillo D. su zona en donD. venD. comida, También Julia se dedica a la agricultura, además Julia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región.
	
Mientras que Lidia es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Lidia junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo D. verduras, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados D. abasto D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo, verduras, semillas, abono y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, mejorar la producción D. sus tierras y ahorrar lo suficiente para el futuro.
texts.en:
The Muyurina Village Bank has 15 members and is currently beginning its 17th loan cycle. The group members are from the Muyurina community of Tambillo District and have different businesses. They sell vegetables, basic grocery items and prepared meals; some are farmers. For example, Julia is 44 years old and married with two children. She has a stand in the recently opened small market, where she sells prepared meals. She also has a farm and travels to different regional markets. Lidia, another group member, is 42 years old and married with three children. She and her husband grow vegetables, which they sell in the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 600 or 900 soles. The village bank is requesting a total of 10,200 soles in loans. Group members will use their loans to buy rice, sugar, pasta, vegetables, seeds and fertilizer and to pay field workers on their farms. Some of the group members' dreams are to improve their businesses, proviD. their children with a good education, improve their crop yields and save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, pasta, vegetables, seeds and fertilizer; pay field workers

loans.name: Sandra Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Sandra M. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cruz de Motupe II”, vive en la esquina del Jr. Los Trigales y Jr. Acacia S/N en un mindepartamento alquilado. Es conviviente, tiene 31 años y es madre de 01 niño que depende todavía de ella; su pareja se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró cosméticos de Unique y Esita los que se encargó de ofrecerlos en venta a sus amistades.
Hoy se siente muy apoyada por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su Banco Comunal por haberle apoyado y confiando en ella a pesar de no ser del lugar, ya que manifiesta ser de Lima pero que tiene 07 años viviendo en Huaraz y esto porque ha identificado que tiene mejor mercado en esta ciudad y todo el Callejón de Huaylas. Con este préstamo de S/.  500.00 comprará cubrecamas ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes y amistades. 
Hoy se siente comprometida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su Banco Comunal por haberle apoyado económicamente y darle la oportunidad de pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra M. S. is a member of the Cruz de Motupe II Village Bank. She lives in an unnumbered house on the corner of Los Trigales Street and Acacia Street in a small, rented apartment. She is 31 years old and lives with her partner and their son, who is still a dependent. Her partner sells hardware items. With her first loan of 300 soles, Sandra bought Unique and Esita brand cosmetics, which she sold to her friends. Today, she feels very much supported by the Manuela Ramos Movement for having placed its trust in her even though she isn't originally from the area (she is from Lima, but has been living in Huaraz for the past seven years since she decided that Huaraz and the Callejon de Huaylas Valley have a superior market). With this loan of 500 soles, Sandra will buy bedspreads to fill orders that have already been placed by her clients and friends. She is committed to the Manuela Ramos Movement and to her village bank because they have supported her financially and have given her the opportunity to belong to a group of women.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bedspreads

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Z. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cruz D. Motupe”, vive en Patay Bajo San Pedro Mz D Lt2  Distrito D. Independencia – Provincia D. Huaraz Departamento D. Ancash.  Está casada y tiene 57 años.  Es madre D. 04 hijos, 1 depenD. D. ella.
Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00  incrementó su mercadería para su negocio D. venta D. ajíes y tubérculos, compró 50kg D. ajíes. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio en un puesto alquilado del mercado informal  D. Pedregal D. la ciudad D. Huaraz, donD. ofrece sus productos a todos los moradores D. la ciudad y público en general.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1700.00  comprará D. 150 Kg. D. ajíes panca.
Actualmente es una mujer independiente y segura ya que gracias a los ingresos que genera su negocio pueD. educar a su hija que estudia ingeniería civil.
Claudia manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por haberle enseñado la cultura del ahorro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Z. D. R. belongs to the Village Bank “Cruz D. Motupe”, and lives in Patay Bajo San Pedro Mz D Lt2 Independence District– Huaraz Province, Department of Ancash. She is married and is 57 years old. She is a mother 4 children, with one who is dependent on her. With the first loan of 300.00 soles they increased merchandise for their business selling peppers and tubers, they bought 50 kg. of peppers. She has worked with the Village Bank for 2 years. Currently, she continues to work with the same business out of a rented space in the Pedregal informal market in the city of Huaraz, where they offer products to all city residents and the general public. With this loan of 1700.00 soles, she will buy 150 kg. of Panca peppers. Right now she is an independent women with security thanks to the income generated from her business, she is able to educate her daughter who is studying civil engineering. Claudia would like to thank Manuela Ramos for having taught her the culture of savings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Panca peppers.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado  del  distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  tiene estudios superiores (profesora de educación primaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años,  inicio su trabajo con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con dicho dinero compró telas para la confección de ropa de deportes (buzos).

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará materia prima (telas) y poder confeccionar ropa de deportes Buzos, polos  y gorros.
Su sueño es poder poner un taller de confección para distribuir al por mayor en todos los mercados de la región.
 
A ella le gustan  las facilidades con las cuales se les da el préstamo, también le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Roxana belongs to the Village Bank “Micaela Bastidas” located in the Ilave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department. She is 38 years old, of cohabitant marital status, and is a single mother with 2 children. She has studied higher education (primary education teacher).

She has worked the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years, she began her work with an initial loan of 300.00 New Soles, with which she bought cloth for sport clothing (diving).

With this loan of 1,000.00 New Soles, she will buy raw materials (cloth) to manufacture sport clothing for divers, polos and hats. Her dream is to have a workshop to distribute to wholesalers in all markets in the region.

She likes the facilities with which they give loans, and she also likes the Village Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material for the manufacture of diving and polo sport clothing.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora  Vilma  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado  del  distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos.  Ella tiene estudios superiores (profesora).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años,  inicio su trabajo con un préstamo inicial de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de abarrotes.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1300.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite fideos, conservas y gaseosas, de esta manera podrá aumentar su mercadería y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es poner una tienda y vender al por mayor. 
A ella le gustan  los encuentros, los ahorros  y las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma belongs to the Village Bank “Micaela Bastidas” located in the Ilave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department. She is 46 years old, and is a single mother with 5 children. She has a higher education (professor).

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 years, she began her work with an initial loan of 300.00 New Soles, in order to buy groceries.

At the moment whe requires a 1300.00 New Soles loan, in order to purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles, canned goods and sodas. With this she will be able to increase her merchandise and earn more income. Her dream is to have a store and to sell at wholesale. She likes the encounters, savings and meetings of her Village Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase sugar, milk, oil, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Amelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, vive en el Jr. Libertad cdra. 01, Distrito Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 31 años, 02 hijos aun en etapa escolar.

Amelia, una mujer que fue capaz de cumplir una de sus metas, implementando su propio negocio  de venta de abarrotes y con el apoyo de su pareja salieron adelante. Nos cuenta, que siempre las cosas que uno quiere hacer en la vida, se las puede cumplir, con esfuerzo y dedicación; con su primer crédito que obtuvo en Manuela Ramos, se inicio a vender sus productos, poco a poco fue incrementándose mas y mas.
 En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya segura que a diario acude a su bodega a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes, parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando cosméticos de la línea Esika y CyZone.

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the "Virgen de Las Mercedes" Village Bank. She lives on on the first block of Libertad Street in Juanjui District of Mariscal Caceres Province in San Martin Department. She is 31 years old and married with two school-age children. Amelia was able to achieve one of her goals when she opened her own neighborhood grocery store, and with the support of her husband she was able to get ahead in life. She believes that one can do anything in life with effort and dedication. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, Amelia started to sell her products, and was gradually able to buy more and more products. Today, she has regular customers who buy from her on a daily basis, since she stocks everything a housewife needs and always attends her clients with her own special brand of charisma. With this loan of 2000 soles, Amelia will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, different brands of canned fish, cleaning products and personal hygiene items in order to better serve her clients. She will also use part of the money to buy Esika and CyZone brand cosmetics. Today, Amelia feels like an accomplished woman, and she wants to keep working to get ahead in life and achieve her dreams. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her and many entrepreneurial women like her start and expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara abarrotes para su stock de productos

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
La señora Anatolia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, vive en el Jr. Eduardo Peña Nº 1401, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años, es madre de 03 hijos pequeños que aun están estudiando.

Anatolia, se dedica a este negocio de compra y venta de granos desde  hace varios años atrás, y junto a su familia salieron adelante, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace, tiene un local muy grande, donde le permite almacenar  sus productos.
