*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: Mr. Hok T. lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He earns a living by providing building services as a construction foreman. He has employees who help provide his service, and he has been running his business for a long time. He is married to Pol Soeun (pictured here), who is a good mother of six children, two of whom are employed as local motorbike taxi drivers. She is a snack food seller. Hok T. hopes to encourage his one single son to get a suitable job as a motor taxi driver. Because the lack of capital, Hok T. has decided to seek a loan in order to buy a motor for his son to begin running a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a motor

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia B. is from the village of Villaflor Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Lucia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lucia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for additional financial support of borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Tong V. is a 30-year-old, married woman and is the mother of two children: both are still minors and are under her care. She provides decorating services for wedding parties and other ceremonies. Most of her clients are people who live in and around the community. She is married to Vuthy, age 30, who is a truck driver for a small firm. Tong V. will use the loan money to buy a plot of land so she can rent it out to the crop farmers and earn a profit. The family lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita D. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Purita is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Purita owns & operates a business in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals for her "carenderia" or small restaurant. Purita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Purita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Purita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional working capital for her "carenderia" or small restaurant. Purita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for the food she sells in her carenderia. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Purita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: “Progress wouldn’t be achieved by an instant click” said Flordeliza A.. She is a 34 year old housewife, married to Romelo Sr., who operates a tricycle transport. Sometimes, Flordeliza also sells vegetables in their village to help her husband with their basic necessities. Flordeliza is asking for loan amounting to PHP 9,000 that they will use for the maintenance of their motorcycle. Some of their income in the business will be used by Flordeliza to buy vending products to sell in their village. The couple helps each other to earn income for the future of their children.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 51 years old and married to Julao. The couple manages a rice farming business, which is their main livelihood. Aside from that, Josefina also maintains a hog raising business as an alternate source of income to further support their most important needs. Due to lack of financial capital for their farming, Josefina is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She hopes that through the loan she is requesting, they will able to avoid asking local money lenders who charge a very high interest rate.

The couple is blessed with three children; Joseph is 29 years old but only completed elementary school, Joel is 24 years and was able to finish high school and the youngest,  Jhulina is 11 years old. Josefina hopes that her youngest daughter will finish college through the sacrifice of the family.

loans.use: Business Maintenance

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie runs a hog raising business out of her home. She is 51 years old and is married to Ricardo, who is a carpenter. The couple works hard and helps each to meet their daily financial needs. Her hog raising business is doing well however she lacks capital to sustain their daily feed supply. This is the reason why Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000. 

Rosemarie believes that through her business she can support her children until they can complete their studies in college. She has four children; Raymond is 23 years old and is a college graduate, Reynald is 22 years old and still a college student, Richard and Ronnie who are 20 and 18 respectively are also still in college. Rosemarie works hard to provide for their needs in school and is hoping that someday all her children become successful.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 46 years old and is married to Apolinario, who is a simple farmer in their village. They are blessed with three children. The eldest is Alejandre, now 27 years old and a college graduate, he is followed by Alexander who is 23 years old also a vocational graduate and now working as Technician, finally their youngest, Shamiya is 21 years old. Through hard work the couple has been able to sustain their daily needs and support their children through school.

Sherlita is engaged in hog raising and vending business. According to her, the business she manages needs additional working capital so that she may expand it. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 and she hopes that through this loan, she will someday convert both of her businesses into profitable ones.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita M. owns a small sari-sari store. She is 46 years old and has 4 children. She told CEVI, " I just don't like to sit here and wait for husband and children to come. I want to help. I want to contribute something especially in the family income". This is the main reason why she started her business which she has been doing for three years already.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her sari sari store. The loan will really help her grow her business so that it will be very easy for them to pay for school, electricity and other expenses in the family.

Through CEVI, Perlita M. was able to sustain her livelihood for years. She has access to the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari sari store.

loans.name: Edickson

texts.en:
Edickson operates a passenger tricycle in his village. He has been in business for two years and it provides family a good standard of living. He is again requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to be used in the maintenance of his passenger tricycle and to invest in another livelihood. He hopes he can obtain the loan because his tricycle’s wheels need to be replaced. He also would like to obtain a permit for his motorcycle so that there would be no problem anymore when it comes to transportation laws. 

Edickson is 23 years old and is a resident of Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela. He has a family with two kids. Edilyn is his eldest child, he is two years old, his youngest child is Patricia and she is four months old. The mother of his children is Belinda La Puebla, they have been together since they had their first child. Unfortunately he has not been able to marry her yet due to financial problems. They have plan to get married when they have sufficient savings.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad L. buys and sells sound systems.  She has four children.

She asks for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy sound systems for sale. She is also considering other business opportunities. In this way, she thinks she could sell more and earn enough for the family.

Through tghe help of CEVI, Mrs. L. was able to sustain her business for a long time already. She is provided with loans but also with training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy sound systems for sale

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигине Камоловой 43 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает в России. Она же занимается земледелием. В этом ей помогают дети. Нигина сеет в основном овощи, а потом продает их на рынке. Этим видом деятельности она занимается более 10 лет. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить минералы и семена. И использовав их собрать благоприятный посев для продажи.
texts.en:
Nigina K. is 43 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is currently working in Russia and she herself grows vegetables for the local market. Her children help her in taking care of the crops. Negina has 10 years of experience growing vegetables and would like to take out this loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. This will allow her to harvest an abundant crop for sale this season.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline sells dresses and other clothes in their village that she purchases in Manila. She goes house to house selling her products, which also include frozen foods. Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 as additional working capital for her business. She wants to prove to herself that she can improve her business on her own, allowing her to feel more empowered and confident. Evangeline is 52 years old and married to Leandro S., a village carpenter and farmer. They live in Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela, a rural place near the Cagayan River. They have three children who all have their own livelihoods and are preparing for their future families.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en: The group of borrowers consists of four peopL.. Its leader, Mrs. Lon L., 37, makes a living selling various grocery products, such as cooking ingredients, plastic products, and sweets. She started the business four years ago, and currently earns approximately US$4 per day. Her husband is a local construction worker. Mrs. Lon L. has three children, all attend school and help her business when they are not studying. Currently, the family's living conditions are not so comfortabL. due to the surrounding their house is full of pollutions, which is harmful for their health. Therefore, Mrs. Lon L. is requesting a loan to purchase piece of land to cover the pollution places. The other three borrowers are C., 48, who is a cleaner for a company and also needs a loan to buy groceries to sell; N., 45, who works as a cleaner and needs money to build a kitchen; and R., 29, who earns a living selling vegetables and needs a loan to expand her business. All of the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase piece of land to cover the pollution places

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
" My six years experience in  business have taught me very important lessons that I can use to sustain my business. My husband is a fisherman and I sell shells of different kinds to be used for decorations. I have been doing this for many years already and my only wish is that I can sustain this for the coming years so that I will be able to send all my children to school", says Cheryl D., 25-year old mother of four.

She would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. The loan will truly help her grow her business even more. 

Through CEVI, Mrs. D. was able to sustain her store. She has now access to CEVI credit assistance plus training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy additional shells to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 43 years old and cooks glutinous rice cakes in their village in Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Rodolfo A. who is now 50 years old. They have three children; the eldest is now married, her second child is working in a private company while her youngest child Jonicio, who is 19 years old, does not want to continue college.

Fely is requesting a second loan of PHP 7,000. She has been in business since 1994 and would like to use her loan to market her products outside of her village and increase her income. She is currently able to generate PHP 500 daily income from selling her glutinous products. She is thankful that from her daily income, she is able to help her husband with their important necessities at home. According to her, it really requires a lot of patience if you want to gain more in your business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Muhtabarhon

texts.ru: Мухтабархон Рахимова проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 38 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Мухтабархон более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Она продает как  национальную, так и другую одежду. Ее муж работает водителем маршрутного такси. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Muhtabarhon R. lives in the Vakhdat region of Tajikistan. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. Muhtabarhon has 10 years of experience in sales and sells national and casual clothes at the local market. Her husband works as a taxi shuttle driver. Mrs. R. would like to take out this loan to increase the number of goods she can offer for sale this season.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of inventory

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 28 years old and is married to Benjie B., who is 30 years old. Benjie makes his living driving a passenger tricycle. They live in Purok (district) Raniag Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela. They were blessed with three children; their eldest child Jaymark is 8 years old, next is Rhea Angeline who is 7 years old and the youngest child Johnie is 5 years old.  Having three children is also a large responsibility, she is paying for them all to attend school and hopes that they will be able to complete university. She is very happy that her family’s standard of living has increased because her husband has begun to earn more money.

Gemma's main business is raising hogs. She is requesting a second loan of PHP 9,000 as additional working capital to further expand her business. She sells her hogs when they reach an average weight of 80-90 kilos, which takes about 3 months. She will use her loan to purchase hog feed for the animals and is hoping that through the financial assistance from lenders, she will be able to generate higher income from the business.

loans.use: Business capital and to purchase feed.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 59 years old and sells generic medicines in her village. She has been a widow for about 18 years. Her husband passed when her youngest child was merely four years old. She has six children and is glad that some of them have their own good jobs that support their own families. Her youngest is now 22 years old and still lives with her. Josefina’s grandchildren inspire her every time she sees them and that keeps her working hard to expand her business.  

Josefina sells generic medicines in different villages near her place to generate a daily income to support her children's and grandchildren’s need. She is very proud that even though she is already a widow it has not been a hindrance for her to pursue working and provide financial support to her children. Josefina is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 which will be used as her additional working capital in expanding her current business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rifoat

texts.ru: Рифоат Ризоева имеет собственную хлебопекарню, которая находится на рынке. Она занимается производством и реализацией хлеба. Возраст 44 года. Проживает она в районе Вахдат. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж тоже помогает жене по бизнесу. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить объем своих продаж.
texts.en:
Rifoat R. owns a bakery at the local market. There she makes and sells bread and baked goods of her own production. She is 44 years old, married, has 4 children and lives in the Vakhdat region. Her husband helps her at the bakery. Rifoat is taking out this loan in order to increase the volume of baked goods for sale she can offer.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Ruku

texts.en:
Mrs. Ruku H. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. It is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in seasonal farming. Mrs. H. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband Mr. Kul Bahadur H. works in a private office. Her sons are studying in grades 12 and 7 respectively. 

Mrs. H. is a wholesaler in the potato business.  She sells potatoes cheaply in the local market. She buys potatoes from the Kalimati bazaar which is one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu valley. She has already taken a first loan from Kiva and has cleared her loan. Now Mrs. H. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 30000.00 to buy potatoes for her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for her business

loans.name: Huor's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. The group leader, Mrs. C. T., age 43, makes a living selling all kinds of groceries from home. She sells items like cooked ingredients, soft drinks, sweet cakes, and canned foods. She is able to earn income of $5 a day in order to provide for her entire family's living expenses. A source of additional revenue comes from her husband who is a military policeman. The couple now has five single children, all of whom are school age. Recently, C. T. sold all her items to her villagers and so she has applied for a loan from Kiva in order to purchase many kinds of grocery inventory to sell. The other two borrowers who have jointed the loan are:
Mrs. D. is a fritter seller, who is requesting a loan to buy necessary ingredients in order to make cake to sell. 
Mrs. Y. is a widow, who sells different kinds of soft drinks and is applying for a loan to accrue a greater quantity of drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase many kinds of grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Musalama

texts.ru: Муслама Хамдамова уже более 10 лет занимается торговлей национальных материалов. Проживает она в районе Вахдат. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится в России, на заработках. Мусламе по бизнесу помогают обе дочки. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы пополнить свой ассортимент и увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Musalama H. has been selling national Tajik fabrics for the last ten years. She is 50 years old now and lives in the Vakhdat region. Musalama is married and has three children, but her husband in currently working in Russia. However, her two daughters help Musalama in her business. Mrs. H. would like to take out this loan in order to expand her inventory and increase her sales.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increaseing sales

loans.name: Janaki

texts.en: Mrs. Janaki M. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is located in lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.  Mrs. Janaki M. lives in a single family home with her husband and one son. Her son is studying in grade 8.  Both Mrs. M. and Mr. M. are engaged in agricultural farming. They own their own land for farming. Mostly they grow green vegetables in their land. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily. They fulfill all the requirements of the family by the income of their farming.   Now Mrs. M. is requesting for Rs 10000.00 loans to buy seeds and fertilizers for the farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipa K. is a 36-year-old lady who lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Mrs. Dipa K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 11 and her son is studying in grade 8. Mrs. Dipa is a center chief in her group. Being a center chief means she has taken responsibility for all her center members.

Mrs. Dipa and her husband, Mr. Ramesh K., opened their veterinary pharmacy four years ago. They sell different types of domestic-animal medicine in their shop. They both contribute equally in their shop because they don’t have any other jobs. Mrs. Dipa K. already has taken her first loan with Kiva and has cleared it. With the previous loan she was able to buy various medicines for her shop. Now Mrs. Dipa is requesting Rs 30000.00 to expand her business and buy more necessary medicines for her shop.

loans.use: To buy medicines for domestic animals

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.ru: Собирджон Мухамадчонов проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 44 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Собирджон имеет собственную хлебопекарню. Он занимается производством и продажей хлеба. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 20 лет. В этом ему помогает вся семья. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы увеличит объем производства.
texts.en:
Sobirjon M. lives in the Vakhdat region of Tajikistan. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. Sobirjon owns a bakery and has been baking and selling bread for the last 20 years. His entire family helps him in the bakery. Sobirjon would like to take out this loan in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding production

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi B. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Sainbu-Bhashipati, Lalitpur. She opened her grocery shop two years ago. Her main aim in opening her shop was to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize and various snacks in her shop. Due to the lack of money she cannot further expand her business. So Mrs. B. is requesting a Rs 15000.00 loan to add other kinds of grocery goods to her shop.

Mrs. B. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a farmer and both her sons are working in small offices.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Shaheen Asif Qamar Arshad Group

texts.en:
Shaheen baji is married to A. Q. A. and they have been living together in Kot Radha Kishan city since the past 10 years. She is the group leader of six other women and all of them belong to a poor family, but they respect each other a lot. They spend independent lives doing their own businesses. They work mainly to pay house utilities. Shaheen baji is applying for a loan to buy medicines for her pharmacy.

Razia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Musarat baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switch boards and switches) for her electric shop. Veenus baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: The grocery shop belongs to Razia baji.

loans.use: To buy medicines to resell

loans.name: Doeurn's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Konh Taing Commune in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Doeurn R., 47, has been selected as the group leader by the other members. Doeurn R. grows different kinds of crops, and she sells the produce to the buyers every three months after she begins planting them. She is the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local primary school. To support the family's food needs a little more, her husband works as a domestic building worker. The family spends a lot of money on taxi for touring requirements. They hope to reduce the transportation cost, which is why Doeurn R. is seeking a loan added with her personal saving to purchase a motorcycle to transport her produce to the market for sale. 

N. sells pork in the local market and she requests a loan to buy additional pork for sale. S. is a grocery seller, who is applying for a loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for family's riding requirements

loans.name: Nazia Azeem Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Nazia baji is married to A. A. and they have been living together in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan, since past 11 years. She is a noble and a kind lady and the group leader of five other women. Her husband is an electrician and runs an electrical goods shop. He has three years of experience in this business. Nazia baji is applying for a loan to buy electric goods (wires, switch boards and switches) for their electrical goods shop.

Kiran baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Sarafeen baji and Razia baji each want loan to buy buffalos for their milk-selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switches and switch boards) for her electrical shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal-selling business.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: The buffalo belongs to Sarafeen baji.

loans.use: To buy electrical good to sell

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра Чаборова проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 38 лет. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Зухра имеет собственный магазин. Она продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности она занимается более 5 лет. Ей в этом помогают ее дети. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот. На полученный доход хочет  оплатить за обучение сына, т.к. ему в этом году надо пступать в университет.
texts.en:
Zuhra J. live in the Varzoba region of Tajikistan. She is 38 years old, divorced and has 2 children. Zuhra owns a small store where she has been selling groceries for the last 5 years. Her children help her with this business. Zuhra would like to take out this loan to expand her store and offer more goods for sale. She wants to use the extra revenue to pay for the education of her son, since in the next year he is entering college.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

loans.name: Iram Waseem Javed Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. 
Parveen baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy goats for their animal-selling business. 
Karam baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.   
Iram baji is the group leader of these four ladies. They all are very hardworking ladies and manage their own businesses easily. Iram baji is married to W. J. who runs a tailoring center. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine to increase the profit of her husband’s tailoring center. 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Мирзошоев Алишер занимается услугой такси. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 3 лет. До этого 3 года работал по своей специальности, шофером. Алишер женат, имеет 3 детей. Проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 31 год. Услуга такси является основным источником дохода. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою автомашину, т.к. машина-это основной источник дохода.
texts.en:
Alisher M. has been working as a taxi driver for the last three years. Until then he worked as a professional truck driver for many years. Alisher is married and has three children. He is 31 years old and lives in the Vakhdat region. His taxi business is the main source of income for the family. Alisher needs to take out this loan in order to repair his car, since this car is the main source of income for his family.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Nasreen Rauf Group

texts.en:
Waiza baji and Shaheena baji each want a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switchboards and switches) for their electric shops. 
Shagufta baji and Riaz baji each want a loan to buy goats for their animal-selling business.

Nasreen baji is the group leader of these four ladies. They all belong to a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Her husband's name is R.. He has an animal-selling business. He specifically sells goats to the butchers. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy goats to expand her husband’s animal-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) to resell

loans.name: Ram Maiya

texts.en:
Ram Maiya M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Thecho is also famous for woodcarving.
Mrs. Ram Maiya M. lives in a joint family with her mother-in-law, husband, one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 12 and her son is in grade 11.
Both Mrs. M. and Mr. M. are engaged in their own sweet shop. They opened their sweet shop more than five years ago. In their shop, they make different varieties of sweet items. Mostly people buy sweets on the occasion of festivals. 
Now Mrs. M. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan to buy food materials needed for their work.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Buddi Maiya

texts.en:
Buddi Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur. She has eight members including herself in her family. She lives with her husband, three sons, two daughters-in-law and one grandson. Her older two sons work in private offices and her younger son is studying in BBS level. Both her daughters-in-law are engaged in household work. Her grandson is studying in pre-primary school.

Both Mr. and Mrs. M. are engaged in poultry farming and agricultural farming. They open their poultry farming business two years ago. They buy all the small chickens and food grains for chickens from the dealers. They are successfully running their poultry farm and earn a good profit from their business. Now she seeks an Rs 10000.00 loan to buy small chickens to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens for her business

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Чаборова Барно проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Барно занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей бычков. Муж работает на цементном заводе. Этим видом предпринимательства занимается более 15 лет. Ей также помогают ее дети. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить бычка, откормить а потом продать. А на полученную прибыль приобрести еще одного бычка.
texts.en:
Brano C. lives in the Varzoba region of Tajikistan. She is 46 years old, married and has four children. Barno raises and sells cattle while her husband works at the cement plant. She has 15 years of experience fattening calves for sale and her children help her with the animals. Barno would like to take out this credit in order to buy an additional calf for feeding and sale at the meat market. With the money she makes from the sale of this calf she will able to pay back the loan and purchase another calf for herself later.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Shila

texts.en:
Mrs. Shila M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in agricultural farming. 
Mrs. M. lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, husband and three children. Her older son is studying in grade 12 and her younger son is studying in grade 8. Her daughter works in her own cosmetic shop.
Both Mrs. and Mr. M. are engaged in their own small restaurant. They opened their restaurant two years ago. They sell different types of food items in her shop. Especially they sell Newari food in her shop because the demand for Newari food is increasing. They also sell tea and coffee in her hotel. Now Mrs. M. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan to expand her business to purchase necessary food material for her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa M. D. C. vive en Santa Tecla departamento La Libertad, Maria vive junto a su esposo y 3 hijos adoptivos. Maria cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que ya esta jubilado y recibe una pensión mensualmente, Maria y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración D. pan dulce y pan frances, pero esta pareja no se cansa del trabajo y ahora están montando una pequeña tienda dentro D. su misma casa, es por ello que solicitan un crédito ya que su negocio va empezando y desean surtirlo con variedad D. productos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa M. D. C. lives in Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. Maria lives with her husband and three adopted children and is able to count on support from her husband, since he is retired and receives a monthly pension. Maria and her husband make Sweet and French breads for a living. However, since this couple never gets tired of working, they are now starting a small store in their home. This is why they are asking for a loan. Their business is already moving along and they would like to stock it with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: para surtir su tienda

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a resident of Purok (district) Namnama Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 43 years old and is married to a farmer named Victor Rossel. They are blessed with three children; Marjorie, the eldest, is 20 years old and presently studying in college, Jenny Rose is 18 years old and is also studying in college, finally Victor M. Jr., is 16 years old and will graduate from high school next year. As a mother who dreams for all of her children to finish their studies, she will do everything to provide for their needs. Their studies are her priority, and she is willing to sacrifice to reach their goals in life, for she believes their goals are also her goals and that their success someday will also be her success.

Marites cooks snacks like “pansit” out of her snack house in her village. Sometimes, she also sells house to house and fortunately she is generating enough income to sustain their daily needs. She is again hoping for a loan of PHP 5,000. This little amount will provide the capital she needs in her business. Marites hopes that she will manage to continuously support the financial needs of her two children who are studying in college. Their tuition fees are very high and she is really working hard just to pay their tuition fees in school and provide them their daily allowances. By patience, Marites believe, she will overcome the hardship of life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Atalia Acacio

texts.pt:
Atalia nasceu em maputo tem 27 anos de idade e viuva estudou ate a 7 classe devido as mas condiçao financeiras dos seus progenitores.e  mae de um filho de 7 anos de id
ade que se encontra a estudar na escola primaria de mugado.

 Atalia tinha apenas 6 meses quando saiu de maputo a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia devido a separaçao do seus pais e passa a viver em casa da sua tia, esta que a maltratava. Inicia os estudos muito tarde e quando frequentava a 7 classe esta fica gravida e e expulsa  de casa sendo assim teve  que interromper os estudos.no mesmo ano Consegue aranjar um emprego no restaurante sondela e trabalha durante 4 anos teve que abandonar o emprego quando fica doente de tuberculose e tinha que cumprir com os tratamentos num periodo de um ano, apois sua recuperaçao aranja um emprego nas aguas de namaacha como servente, e funcionaria permanente a mais de 3 anos aufere por mês 2.500.00mt. mas devido a morte do seu marido ela não consegue mais cubrir com as dispesas porque vive numa casa alugada onde paga 800.00mt  por mês e responsabiliza se pela sua mae esta que vive em gaza enviando lhe por mês um valor de 500.00mt para pagar a empregada que toma conta dela pois já e muito idosa. entao aproxima se a hluvuku e solicita um emprestimo no valor de 8.000.00mt para compra de um terreno valor este que reembolsou com muito sucesso e pede estes 12.000.00mt para dar inicio da sua propria obra. 
 

Este e o segundo emprestimo de atalia na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva,os primeoros 8.000.00mt ela comprou um terreno e pede este segundo emprestimo de 12.000.00mt para iniciar com a construçao da sua propria casa. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo determinado e pedir um outro para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Atalia was born in Maputo. She is 27 years old and a widow. She attended school through the 7th grade due to difficult financial circumstances of her parents. She is the mother of a 7-year-old child who is studying in elementary school.

Atalia was only 6 months old when she left Maputo to go to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, due to her parents' separation. She began to live in her aunt's house, who was abusive to her. She started school very late and when she was in 7th grade, she became pregnant and was kicked out of her house. She then had to stop going to school. The same year, she was able to arrange a job at a Sondela-style restaurant and worked for 4 years. She had to quit her job when she became ill with turberculosis and had to complete the treatments over the course of a year. After her recovery, she arranged a job at the Namaacha Water company. As a permanent employee for over 3 years, she earns 2500 per month.

Due to the death of her husband, she has not been able to take care of her expenses because she lives in a rented home where she pays 800 meticais per month and also takes care of her mother. Her mother lives in Gaza Province, so she sends her 500 meticais per month to pay the woman who takes care of her, since she is very elderly. She approached Hluvuku and requested a loan in the amount of 8000 meticais to purchase land. She repaid that amount successfully and is at this time requesting 12,000 meticais to start construction.

This Atalia's second loan from Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. She used the first 8000 meticais loan to purchase land and is requesting this second loan of 12,000 meticais to start construction of her own home. She is confident that she will repay the loan before the stated loan term and ask for another to furnish the house.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building material

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Оева Мухаббат проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 30 лет, замужем и имеет одного ребенка.
Муж находиться в России на заработках. Сама Мухаббат уже 15 лет занимается бизнесом. Привозит продукты питания из города Душанбе, покупая в магазинах оптовой торговли и реализует у себя в кишлаке. Имеет магазин .В месяц магазин приносит 300 сомони чистой прибыли. Сумма небольшая так как товарооборот не позволяет увеличить ассортимент товара. Поэтому она обратился к нам за кредитом и на получаемый кредит сможет увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Muhabbat O. lives in the Varzob region. She is 30 years old, married and has one child. Her husband is gone to work in Russia. Muhabbat has been running her own business for the last 15 years. She buys groceries wholesale in Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan and sells them at her village in her own grocery store. Every months the grocery store makes 300 somoni ($70) of profit. The profit is modest because limited cash flow does not allow Muhabbat to expand her inventory. This is why she has turned to Kiva for a loan and is hoping to expand her business using this money and improve her store's profits.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Gay Rose

texts.en:
Mary Gay Rose is 41 years-old. She manages a general store in her village. She is married to Merlito R. who is 38 years-old and works as a house carpenter. They are living happily in Barangay Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela. The couple is blessed with two children.  Anne Marie is 14 years-old and studying in the secondary school and John Gayle is in pre-school.

Mary Gay Rose has run a retailing business for seven years. She manages a typical community based store where she sells a variety of small items. She is requesting a second loan to be used in expanding her business. She believes that “time is gold” which is why as soon as she started the business she begun saving for the future of her children. Her priority is their studies, and hopefully with the help of God and with this lending program, her dreams will become reality. She hopes that she can provide education for her children someday by working hard and by having strong determination to succeed.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L. is from the village of Gala Ozamiz City. She is 35 years-old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a business making and selling food, mainly bananas. Vivian is just starting this business.  Vivian joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services that would help her improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Vivian is now requesting her second loan in the amount of 15000 PHP which will be used to expand the business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to fund her children's education. 

About GDMPC:  
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To expand her food sales business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco L. A. vive el departamento de Ahuachapán  junto a su esposa y su hijo, Francisco tiene 46 años de edad y se dedica a su negocio que es un taller de estructuras metálicas y carpintería. Francisco hace su trabajo desde la producción de cada sala y comedores hasta la comercialización de los mismos, los clientes llegan al negocio de Francisco a comprar un juego de sala y Francisco les da facilidades de pago, a raíz de esto Francisco ve un buen nicho en su negocio e inclinarlo más a un almacén de este tipo de productos y con facilidades de pago,  este es el sueño de este hombre, que su negocio crezca y pueda tener más inventario a la vista, pero por el momento ahora el solicita un crédito porque le han pedido una gran cantidad de muebles y no posee la materia prima suficiente para elaborarlos.
texts.en:
Francisco L. A. lives in the department of Ahuachapán together with his wife and their son. Francisco is 46 years old and is dedicated to his business, which is a metals and carpentry workshop. Francisco produces furniture for every room including dining sets and sells all of this himself. Clients come to Francisco's business to buy furniture sets and Francisco offers them easy forms of payment, which is where Francisco sees a strong niche for his business and why he is inclined to add more of this type of products to a warehouse and still offer ease of payment. This is the dream of this man, that his business grows and that he may be able to have a larger inventory for display, but for the moment, he is requesting a loan because his clients have requested a great quantity of furniture and he does not have the raw materials to make it all.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.ru: Меликова София проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 58 лет, вдова . Одна воспитывает троих детей. Работает в продуктовом магазине. Занимается бизнесом уже 5 лет. Магазин приносит около 500 сомони в месяц. В данный момент София решила увеличить товарооборот. Для этого она обратилась к нам за кредитом. На полученные деньги она сможет завезти новый ассортимент.
texts.en:
Sofia M. lives in the Varzob region. She is 58 years old and a widow. Sofia has been raising her three children alone. For the last five years she has been managing a grocery store which makes about 500 ($100) somoni every month. Currently Sofia wants to expand her inventory and so increase profits from the store. For this purpose she has turned to Kiva for a loan. She will use the money to bring in additional goods for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 36-year-old woman and is married to Serafin Enrique who is also 36 years-old. Her husband works as the treasurer in their village at Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela. He also operates his passenger tricycle for extra income. The couple was blessed with three children.  Sermay Michelle is 17 years-old and currently studies nursing in Manila.  Sermil Michael is 14 years-old and is in high school, and Shiella May is 10 years-old and studies in primary school.

Mildred has managed a mini-grocery store in their home for about three years. She needs additional working capital and is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She plans to purchase more groceries to meet the needs of her customers. She hopes that her loan request will be granted because it would be of great help for the improvement of her business. Her eldest child is undergoing chemotherapy while at the same time studying patiently because she really wants to acquire a degree. The family must pay PHP 8,000 monthly for the chemotherapy treatment. She is so thankful that her good sister has assisted in the payment for the medication of her child. She is at least happy that, together with her husband, they both do their best to work and be able have sufficient income for their expenditures.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Mrs. Aida Zingalwa is a 41-year-old widower.  She is a baker and the owner of a little bakery in P4 Gango, Ozamiz City. She has been blessed with 3 children.  One is in college and the other two are in elementary school.  Besides baking bread, Aida also takes orders for cakes and tortas. She does this type of work because she loves baking. Mostly her customers are her neighbors and residents of the neighboring barangays. In addition to her income, she also receives a a small amount of financial support from a friend abroad.  Now she is applying for her 4th loan under the PDP-LP Program, in the amount of P7,000.00.  The main purpose of the loan is to purchase additional ingredients for bread making and additional utensils and equipment to improve her bakery. She is hoping that her existing business will prosper and be known to all so she can send all her children to school through college so they can have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.ru: Акрамов Бахриддин житель города Вахдат. возраст 37 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Закончил торговый техникум, но работает в сельском хозяйстве. Занимается земледелием уже семь лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена овощей(лук и др.) и удобрения. Кредит поможет ему своевременно произвезти посев и вовремя получить качественный урожай.
texts.en:
Bahriddin A. lives in the city of Vakhdat. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. Bahriddin has a degree in management but works in agriculture. For the last seven years he has been raising crops for sale. Bahriddin wants to take out this loan to purchase seeds (onion etc.) and fertilizer. The loan will allow him to plant everything in time and harvest a quality crop in the coming fall.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 52 years old and raises both swine and chicken. She is married to a house carpenter, Felimon M.. Her family lives in Barangay Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela, a rural village. They have five children who were unfortunately unable to continue their studies through college because of poverty. Some of them are already married. Nida is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for the maintenance and expansion of her livestock business. Nida was happy that in spite of having a big family, she was able to send her children to school, even if it was just through high school. She was also glad that her children are very understanding and they really have good relationships with each other even though most of them are already married. According to her, patience and diligence is the key to have a successful business and family relationships.

loans.use: Business Maintenance and Expansion

loans.name: Jonathan Omar

texts.es: Jonathan Omar L. G. vive en Santa Tecla departamento La libertad,Junto a su novia y su padre y madre.Jonathan se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de Santa Tecla, sus principales clientes son los vendedores del mercado ya que Jonathan ofrece sus productos a mayoreo, a pesar de tener tan solo 22 años de edad Jonathan tiene  11 años de experiencia en el negocio, ya que sus padres también se dedican a la venta de verduras desde que el era un niño hasta la fecha. Jonathan solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Jonathan Omar L. G. lives in the La libertad neighborhood of Santa Tecla with his girlfriend, mother, and father.

Jonathan sells vegetables in the Santa Tecla market. His primary clients are other sellers in the market, and therefore Jonathan offers his products wholesale. Although he is only 22 years old, Jonathan has 11 years' experience in the business, as his parents also sell vegetables and have done so since he was a child.

Jonathan seeks this loan in order to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory of vegetables

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela. They are blessed with three children who are all now attending school. Regina hopes to sustain her vending business because it is where she gets most of the money to pay for her children’s education.

Regina runs a vending business where she sells products including snacks, vegetables and cooked foods/viands. She is requesting a loan to support the development of her vending business. She is requesting around PHP 4,000 only. She is planning to add more products to sell, which will allow her to increase her daily income. She usually generates an average income of PHP 400 a day. She dreams of seeing her children have a good life someday and this will become possible if she can continue to finance their studies through college. She believes she can do this by working hard and having patience to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Nabila Faqeer Hussain Group

texts.en:
Voilet baji and Sharifan baji each want a loan to buy wood for their furniture-making business. 
Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 

Nabila baji is the group leader of these three ladies. She is married to F. H. who drives a horse cart. He uses this cart as a public transport and charges different fares area wise. Her group is very responsible; they manage their own businesses to pay off the utilities and to give ease to their husbands. Nabila baji is also applying for a loan to buy a new horse cart, because the old one became rotted and rough from different areas.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new horse cart

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario P. is 51 years old and married to Noli P. who is a laborer. They live in the village of Magsaysay, Naguillian, Isabela. They are blessed with four children; Charlon is 18 years old and is presently studying in college, Chester is 17 years old and is also studying in college, Noli P. Jr. is 13 years old and is studying in secondary school, and their youngest, Noli Rose, is 11 years old and is studying in primary school. Rosario is thankful because they still can manage to eat three times a day. 

She hopes that she can have the PHP 10,000 loan she is requesting. She will use the loan for her poultry business. This is an important business for her family because it helps pay for a large portion of her children’s education. She has been in business for two years and feels that she is ready to expand her business and increase her income. Especially now that two of her children are studying in college, their school costs are getting higher and an increase in income would be very helpful. She is trying to be more diligent in her work to help her husband support their daily needs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Очилова Саломат проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 39 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. По специальности  бухгалтер. Проработала бухгалтером 4 года. Теперь занимается бизнесом. Торгует одеждой на рынке Вахдата. планирует получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Получив кредит она сможет завезти сезонный товар и обеспечить рынок необходимыми вещами.
texts.en:
Salomat O. lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is 39 years old, married and has four children. She has a degree in accounting and 4 years of job experience as an accountant. Currently she sells clothes at the Vakhdat market. Salomat would like to take out this loan to expand her inventory. This loan will allow her to bring in seasonal goods and provide the local markets with necessary clothes.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en:
Cinderella O. has been a businesswoman for almost three years. She is currently residing in Zone 10, Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City in Northern Mindanao, Philippines. She owns a variety store in their village where she sells all the basic needs of her customers. She earns PHP 500.00 in a day and manages to purchase additional items for her variety store twice a week. Aside from that, Cinderella is engaged in the hog-fattening business. She raises piglets and sells them in the market. They are worth PHP 1200.00 each.

Cinderella is working hard for the future of her child. She wants to help manage her family with her husband. At the present time, her husband is working in Montaña Subdivision as a contractual mason or locally known as "panday". Cinderella assesses that this is not enough to feed their needs, especially that they now have their child. This is the reason why Cinderella wants to expand her business. In connection with that, she is now applying for a loan to HSPFI-KIVA partner. She is looking forward to the possible action regarding her request.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Variety Store

location.town: Zone 10, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Letesia

texts.en:
Letesia has been a handcraft artist in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for seven years. She belongs to Dodoma C group loan (Group code 2028).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  


Letesia is 37 years old, married, and has four children: ages 18, 15, 13 and 7. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ganga Maiya

texts.en:
Ganga Maiya M. is a 33-year-old woman and she lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Ratna Kazi M., works in the coke factory. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 7 and daughter is studying in pre-primary school.
Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop five years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to increase the stock of food in her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits and others. She wishes to use her income to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Rehana Kosar Muhammad Saleem Shahid Group

texts.en:
Jannat baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy a horse cart for loading.
Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. 
Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. 
Rehana kosar baji is the group leader of these four ladies. They all belong to a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Rehana baji is married to M. S. S. who is a driver of a vehicle named auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rehana baji helps him with her sewing clothes business. She sews clothes to pay for the utilities of her house. She is applying for a loan to pay the remaining installments of her husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To pay off the remaining installments of auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Evandre Celio Joaquim

texts.pt:
Evandre nasceu em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia, um dos distritos mais desemvolvidos da Provincia de Maputo tem 25 anos de idade e solteiro e actualmente mora com seus três irmãos mais novos e sua mãe.

Apois dois anos de estudo em Manhiça sai com titulo de Professor  e autorizado a dar aulas no ensino Primario no mesmo Distrito, anos depois e trânsferido para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilandia onde e afecto na Escola  Maria  Auxiliadora, Evandre cresceu em uma família católica, frequentando a missa todos os finais de semana. Devido a paixão  pela musica e também  convidado para trabalhar   no
Departamento cultural da Administração Distrital de Namaacha.Hoje trabalha das 7:30 horas as 15:30 horas planejando e organizando o calendário cultural do distrito, vocado no setor de musica. Em termos financeiros nada mudou, Evandre continua sendo um empregado do governando e ganha um salário base de MTn 4,700 por mês, mais uma casa para morar não consegue poupar nenhum valor por mês devido as dispesas que ele tem que asssumir. Atualmente  com sua mãe e irmã, com uma filha, moram com ele. Embora Evandre esteja feliz com o progresso de sua vida profissional, ele sente que o salário não é o suficiente para realizar seu sonho:( a construção de sua própria casa. ) tem consciência que se perder o emprego sua família não terá onde morar. Assim  decidiu pedir seu primeiro empréstimo para a Hluvuku, apos ouvir da irmã que é também  nossa cliente. Estes MTn 10,000 serão usados para comprar material de construção e dar continuidade das  obras. Ela já tem o terreno, areia e pedras, alem da aprovação da planta feita pelo arquiteto. No futuro Evandre gostaria de conseguir construir um estúdio adjacente a sua casa para poder tocar com os amigos e ate quem sabe gravar suas próprias musicas. 
 
Este  e o segundo emprestimo de evandre na hluvuku e kiva os primeoros 10.000.00mt foram usados para comprar material de construçao, estes outros 10.000.00mt seram usados para o mesmo fim,esta ciente que vai reembolsar cem nenhum problema  e muito feliz pois nos finais deste ano ira viver em sua propria casa.
texts.en:
Evandre was born in Namaacha, a town on the border with Swaziland, one of the most developed districts in Maputo Province. He is 25 years old and single. Currently, he lives with his three younger siblings and their mother.

After two years of study in Manhiça, he graduated with a teaching degree, with authorization to teach primary school classes in that district. Years later, he transferred to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, where he works at the Maria Auxiliadora School. Evandre grew up in a Catholic family, attending mass every weekend. Due to his passion for music, he has also been invited to work in the Department of Cultural in Namaacha's District Administration. He currently works from 7:30 am to 3:30 pm planning and organizating the district's cultural calendar, focused on the area of music.

In financial terms, nothing has changed, Evandre continues to be employed by the government and earns a base salary of 4700 meticais per month. He hasn't been able to save for buying a home at all due to the expenses he has to take on. Currently, his mother and sister, with a daughter, live with him.

While Evandre is happy with the progress of his professional life, he feels that the salary is not adequate to realize his dream (building his own home). He is aware that if he loses his job, his family will not have a place to live. So, he has decided to ask for his first loan from Hluvuku, after hearing about it from his sister who is also a Hluvuku client.

These 10,000 meticais will be used to buy construction material and provide continuity to the construction. He already has the land, sand and stones, in addition to drawings approved by the architect. In the future, Evandre would like to be able to build a studio next to his home to be able to play with friends, and who knows, even record his own songs.

This is Evandre's second loan from Hluvuku and Kiva. The first 10,000 meticais were used to buy construction material. These additional 10,000 meticais will be used for the same purpose. He plans to repay without any problem and is very happy since at the end of this year, he will go to live in his own home.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Dil Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Dil Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.
Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband and three sons. Her husband, Mr. Ram Chandra, is a driver. Her older two sons are studying in higher level and younger son is in primary school.
Mrs. Dil Maiya M. is a beautician. She has completed the beautician training. Now she wants to open her own beauty salon, but due to a lack of funds, she cannot open her own beauty salon. Mrs. M. is requesting an Rs 20000.00 loan to open her own beauty salon. She wants to open the beauty salon to uplift the economic condition of her family.

loans.use: To open a beauty salon

loans.name: Nalongo's Group

texts.en: M. Nalongo is the leader of the Mabira group that has been together for 10 years. She is a hardworking and talented lady when it comes to sales and this is why her retail shop business is doing well. Her shop mainly sells soda, juice and mineral water in Najjembe, Mabira. She sells to customers in the stopping vehicles along the highway. You find that most of Nalongo’s customers show up once in a while but because there are so many cars on the highway, this does not matter so much to her, most especially now that she employs girls and boys to do the selling since they have speed. Nalongo is married with eight children, three of whom are still in school, while she cares for two dependants. She needs a loan partly for paying school fees as well as to buy more crates of soda and mineral water for her stock.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks like soda, mineral water and juice.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and she is a widowed woman.

She has owned a small food vendor store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 10 years. She belongs to Mafifi south group loan (Group code 2026).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately $115. Each day she works at her business for 12 hours.  


Ana is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items to add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi S. is a grocery shopkeeper in Tangal, Lalitpur. She opened her grocery store one year ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her grocery store. She feels proud to help her husband in fulfilling the needs of the family. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, noodles, biscuits etc in her shop. Now she is requesting Rs 20000.00 to buy different varieties of grocery items for her shop.
Mrs. Laxmi S. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband is engaged in the garment business. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 2 and daughter is in grade 5.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Rubina Munawar Hussain Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji is married to M. H. and is the group leader of four other women. She has been living in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Her husband is a musician and runs a musical group of 10 people. They sing songs on occasions such as weddings and birthdays when people call them for providing entertainment. Rubina baji is engaged in the cot-knitting business. She knits cots on orders and earns income. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy a musical instrument (guitar) for her husband’s musical group.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. Nazia parveen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Razia baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a musical instrument for musical group

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of an 8-year-old child. She also cares for two additional dependents. Rehema has been a bites seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for past three years. She belongs to Dodoma road C group loan (Group code 2030). She currently earns an average monthly profit of ~$100.Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Luís Francisco

texts.pt:
Luis nasceu em namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia, tem 23 anos de idade vive maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos o primeiro de 4 anos e uma recem nascida de apenas uma semana de vida a mais velha estuda no centro infantil.

Em 2007 Luis começa a trabalhar como professor primário numa escola na localidade de matsequenha no mesmo distrito durante um ano, em 2008 foi transferindo para trabalhar como técnico de património na Direcção Distrital de Educação de Namaacha tem um salário mensal de 4,700.00mtn trabalhando das 7h as 15:30h excepto sábados e domingos.Mas não consegue poupar nenhum valor nos finais do mês porque ainda esta construir a sua casa, pois vive com a sua família na casa dos pais. Luís na tentativa de coleccionar o material de construção o que era lhe difícil com o valor do salário, fica a saber da existência da Hluvuku com um dos seus primos que já era cliente da mesma instituição. Então aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt para dar continuidade da sua obra, mas devido aos preços elevados do material ele não consegue concluir, e solicita mais uma vez nos nossos serviços, para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus pais enviando lhes uma sexta básica em cada 3 meses no valor de 1000.00mt.

Este e o segundo empréstimo de Luís na hluvuku e kiva.os primeiros 10.000.00mt foram usados para comprar material de construção, e pede estes 15.000.00mt para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer manuntençao de pintura e energia. Tem como objectivo dar contunuidade da sua carreira estudantil.
texts.en:
Luis was born in Namaacha, a town on the border with Swaziland. He is 23 years old and married. He is the father of 2 children, the first aged 4, and a newborn who is just one week old. The oldest attends a nursery school.

In 2007, Luis started to work as a primary teacher at a school in Matsequenha in the same district. During 2008, he was transferred to work as an asset manager in the District Administration Office of Education in Namaacha. His monthly salary is 4700 meticais, and he works from 7 am to 3:30 pm except Saturdays and Sundays. He hasn't been able to save at all at the end of the month because he is still building his home, as he lives with his family at his parents' house. Luis is trying to get construction material, which is difficult for him at his salary.

He found out about Hluvuku from one of his cousins who was a Hluvuku client. He then approached Hluvuku to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 meticais to continue with his building project, but due to the high prices for material, he was not able to complete it. He is requesting Hluvuku's services once again. In addition to his children, he cares for his parents, giving them support every 3 months in the amount of 1000 meticais.

This is Luís's second loan from Hluvuku and Kiva. The first 10,000 meticais were used to buy construction material and he is asking for 15,000 meticais for the same purpose. He is confident that he will repay before the end of the loan term and will ask for a new loan to paint and do electrical work. His goal is to continue on his career path.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia Elizabeth C. vive en un pequeño cantón llamado el rio, ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos; a pesar que Sonia cuenta con la ayuda económica de su esposo no es suficiente para los gastos básicos de la casa ya que son 3 hijos aun son menores de edad , es por ello que Sonia ha montado un negocio en un puesto muy céntrico para que las personas compren sus productos que son a precios muy accesibles entre ellos ropa interior para niñas y damas, ropa para bebé, vestidos de niñas y  otros adornos como centros de mesa. Sonia está solicitando este crédito por que quiere surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Elizabeth C. lives in a small canton called the river, located in the department of Ahuachapán with her husband and their three children. Although Sonia has the financial support of her husband, it is not sufficient for the basic household expenses since the three children are still minors. This is why Sonia has set up a business in a very central position so that people can buy their products at very affordable prices, including underwear for girls and women, baby clothes, baby dresses for girls and other frills such as table decorations. Sonia is requesting this loan to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Shazia Yousaf Masih Group

texts.en:
Shazia Y. M. is the group leader of other four women. They all live in the city of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. They are hard-working and are satisfied with their struggle. Shazia manages a cot-knitting business. She earns income from the orders that she gets from the community. Shazia baji is applying for a loan to buy wood for her husband’s wood-selling business.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her vegetable-selling business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Razia baji wants a loan to pay the remaining installment of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shazia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor R., 26, is single and a business woman in her own right. According to her, she is happy to know that, with her own struggle and perseverance, she has been able to come up with a good business that earns enough to provide all her needs. With her variety store, Flor is striving to make it more stable. She's doing this to extend help to her family and also to prepare for her future. To make her store more profitable, she is applying for her 3rd cycle loan of PHP 11,000 with HSPFI, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her variety store

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nazia Muhammad Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Nazia baji is the group leader of two other women. She is married to M. N., who runs a cloth-selling business. He buys clothes from Lahore, a city famous for its varieties, and sells to his native city Kot Radha Kishan. Nazia baji is a very supporting lady. She stitches embroidered dresses on orders and, with the income earned, she pays off the utilities of her house. In fact, the other two members of her group also engage in the embroidered clothes business for the same purpose. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes for her husband’s cloth-selling business.

There is another Nazia baji in the group who wants a loan to buy peanuts to resell. Noreen baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. They all belong to a city named Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan.

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: Adelfa S. is from Tuburan, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 48 years old and is a widow with three children. She supports her family through traditional gold mining. She is also engaged in food-processing business wherein she uses her skill to make pan cakes and rice cakes and then peddles it to her neighboring village. She uses her income to support the educational expenses of her children, to improve her existing business and to buy daily necessities for consumption. She intends to expand her business and hence is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 payable in five months.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food processing business

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria T. is from the village of Litapan Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old. Eneria is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eneria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eneria has been in this business for 8 years.

In 2006, Eneria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eneria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Eneria is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the  second loan taken out by Eneria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to sustain her family's needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive co-operatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
