Gulzar and Siddiqa want loans to buy buffaloes for their milk selling businesses. Parveen wants a loan to buy furniture to sell. Sajida wants a loan to buy goats to resell. Naseem J. wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps and pipes) to sell.

Razia resides in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. Her husband is affiliated with a dairy business. Presently, they have one buffalo and Razia takes care of that buffalo. She is the group leader. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's dairy business.

This is a group loan. Loan funds will be distributed among members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy another buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
"I sell chickens and rice. My husband and I are farmers. We till a small parcel of land together. When it is not so busy, my husband will drive his own motorcycle around looking for passengers. We both work to provide for our children," says Mercy L., 27, mother of two children.

She would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI to purchase fertilizers and seeds. The loan will truly help her improve the soil condition and harvest.

Through CEVI, she has been able to sustain her business for a long time. Besides loans, Mercy receives training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a retail store.

The main source of income for the business comes from selling products like shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. Marilou has been in business for over 10 years and earns about 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and engage in business. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bravo Plus Group

texts.fr: Thérèse M. a une boutique d’articles divers et vend du bois. Elle a acheté avec le crédit reçu au mois de mai courant, 100 bottes de bois à revendre en vue d’accroitre son revenu. Elle a été initiée au commerce par sa grande sœur en 1975 à l’âge de 13 ans. C’est en 1984 qu’elle s’est engagée à vendre ses propres produits, un bassin de 50 pains avec un capital initial de $5. De 1984 – 1990, par un dur travail et une bonne gestion, elle est arrivée à diversifier son activité en y ajoutant du sucre, du pétrole etc… qui totalisaient un montant de $200. De 1990 – 2002, Thérèse a encore diversifié son affaire en y ajoutant des mèches qui ont augmenté son capital à $1150. De 2002 – 2006, Thérèse a rencontré des difficultés d’écoulement de ses produits dans son quartier à cause de la saturation.  Cela l’a amenée de 2006 jusqu’à ce jour, d’ouvert un autre point de vente en dehors de son quartier. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $220 par mois. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une pharmacie à cause de la demande qui est grande dans son milieu à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Thérèse a 47 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés de 18 à 29 ans dont le plus âgé est indépendant et les trois autres étudient.
texts.en:
Thérèse M. has a shop for various goods, and she sells wood. She used the loan received in May to buy 100 bales of wood to resell with the goal of growing her revenues. She was introduced to commerce by her older sister in 1975 at the age of 13. It was in 1984 that she dedicated herself to selling her own merchandise, fifty loaves of bread in a basin, with $5 of initial capital. From 1984-1990, through hard work and good managing, she came to diversity her business by including sugar, kerosene, etc... which totaled $200. From 1990-2002, she diversified again by including hair extensions that increased her capital to $1,150. From 2002-2006, she ran into difficulties with the turnover of goods in her district due to saturation. What has carried her from 2006 to today was opening another sales outlet outside her district. Currently her business generates a monthly profit of $220. Her ambition is to open a pharmacy because of the demand, which is big in her area west of Kinshasa. Thérèse is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four children, ages 18 to 29. The eldest is on his own, and the other three are students.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 bales of wood for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rani Sharafat Group

texts.en:
Azra wants a loan to buy ice to sell. Khursheed wants a loan to buy timbers to sell. Zareena wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Safia wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Zainab wants a loan to buy shoes to sell.

Rani has lived in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for 10 years. She is the group leader and a very good lady. Her members are very happy with her. Her husband is a delivery man and delivers items (fruits & vegetable).

Zainab baji is applying for a loan to buy a new horse cart.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a new horse cart.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Махфират Кахарова проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 38 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Махфират более 16 лет работает учителем. Она просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить дойную корову для семейного использования, т.е. употребление молока. Погашать она будет за счет своей заработной платы, также ей помогает муж, высылет деньги.
texts.en:
Mahfirat K. lives in the Varzoba region. She is 38 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is currently earning money in Russia. Mahfirat herself has been working for 16 years as a teacher. She would like to take out this loan to purchase a milk cow for her family needs, e.g. to drink it's milk. She will be paying back the loan using her own salary as well as the money that her husband sends her every month.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vinancia

texts.en:
Vinancia P. and her husband's primary source of income is fishing. Their fish is sold at a public market and neighboring village.

It’s a daily challenge for her to pay her loan on time but this is now become a habit for Vinancia, 60, who is married with three children.

She is able to nurture her children well. Vinancia’s happy that she is able to send her children to school. She applied for a loan of Php5,000. This loan will be use to purchase fishing nets to catch more fish. She also hopes to have their own stall in the public market, to increase customers.

loans.use: Buy fishing net.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui B. lives with her husband and teenage son in Bayanzurh, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son is an 8th grader at a local high school. Nergui selling meat. She started the business with her husband in a local food market. Since it started in 1998, her business has done well and has expanded; wholesale and individual sales.

Nergui usually buys livestock such as sheep, goats, and cattle in the spring when prices are low and hires a herder to feed the livestock until the meat prices peak in the fall. She slaughters and sells them wholesale and to individuals in the local market. In the future, she would like to expand her butcher business by raising more livestock. She requests a loan to purchase more livestock for her business.

loans.use: Purchase more livestock for her business.

loans.name: Toshboy

texts.ru: Тошбой - мужчина средних лет 1968 года. Женат и отец 5-х детей. Тошбой занимается купле-продажей скота на скотном рынке. Он закупает скот и продает сразу же, если найдется хороший клиент. Или продает через неделю или две недели. Тошбой закупает скот дешево по 5-10 голов и продает их в розницу подороже. Таким образом Тошбой зарабатывает на жизнь и оборачивает свой капитал. Тошбой содержит всю семью. Ему помогают сыновья. Тошбой кредитуется в нашей организации более 2-х лет. Он всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Тошбой благодарен кредитной организации за финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Toshboy is a middle-aged man who was born in 1968. He is married and the father of five children. Toshboy buys and sells cattle at the cattle market. He purchases cattle, and either sells them immediately if he can find a good buyer, or within a week or two. Toshboy purchases five or ten head cheaply, then resells them at a markup, thus earning a living and turning over his capital. Toshboy supports his family, and his sons help him. He has been a loan customer at MicroInvest for more than two years, and always uses his loans purposefully. Toshboy is grateful to the loan institution for the financial assistance.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle trade

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P., 43, is a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Married, she has devoted her life to her business for the future of her family. She tried selling “puto” (rice pancake snack). Her loyal customers are her relatives and neighbors.

Lorna is in her third year of membership to Paglaum MPC where she gets working capital. She feels fulfilled. Lorna applied for php7,000 for her snack vending business. Lorna hopes she will become a big-time business woman.

loans.use: Capital for snack vending.

loans.name: Saifidin

texts.ru: Шафиев Сайфидин ремонтирует, занимается покраской автомашины. Этим видом деятельности занимается со старшим сыном, более 10 лет. Проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы запаситься нужным материалы, т.е. краской, автозапчатями, чтобы обслуживать побольше клиентов.
texts.en:
Saifidin S. repairs and paints cars in his automotive workshop. He has been managing his business with his oldest son for the last 10 years. Saifidin lives in the Varzoba region, he is 39 years old, married and has three children. He would like to take out this loan to purchase repair supplies wholesale, such as paint and spare parts so that he can continue offering his service to his clients.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and paint

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata T. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier  Darsalam  de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Secrétaire de Direction de formation, c’est après son mariage qu’elle s’est investie véritablement dans le commerce notamment celui de l’encens et d’habits. Elle jouit d’une très grande réputation aujourd’hui surtout en ces périodes de mariages, auprès des femmes de Ségou. 
 Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est  en relation  depuis 42 mois. Après  2 prêts individuels et 3 prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, une pièce de bazin riche, deux pièces de bazin moins riche, dix pièces de pagnes wax « hytterget ». Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes au grand marché de Bamako (capitale du Mali). Madame Aminata T.  vend en détail au comptant et à crédit chez elle à domicile et en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner, supporter certaines dépenses familiales et  rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata T., age 42, is married and the mother of three. She lives with her husband and children in the Darsalam district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A personal secretary by training, she essentially invested herself, upon marrying, into commercial business, notably in incense and clothing. She enjoys an enormous reputation today, especially during the marriage season, among women in Ségou. With the goal of augmenting her working capital, in order to satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 42 months. After two individual loans and three solidarity loans, all correctly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. This new loan will be used to buy a bolt of rich damask fabric, two bolts of less-rich damask, and ten bolts of Hitarget pagnes (colorful West African cloth). Supplies are gotten from wholesalers at the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of Mali). Sales are made at the retail level out of her home, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women. She intends to realize an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings, covering certain expenses, and repaying the loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva U., 45, is married and lives at Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has three children. Since she had skills and experienced in manicure/pedicure it was a way for her to earn a living.

Oliva joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in October 2006 to avail its loan facilities and benefits. She really wanted to help her husband who is a motor cab driver. She applies for php5,000 to buy variety of colors of nail polish. Through this economic activity, she will be able to address the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: Buy nail polish.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 56, a Rwandan entrepreneur is a widow who has one child, age 18 and two orphans, ages 13 and eight. She lives in Nyamirambo, Nyarugenge district, Kigali city, Rwanda.

She sells clothes and tissues to tailors who make outfits. Fatuma is an ambitious and courageous woman and she has many clients because of her quality products.

U. seeks her second loan from Vision Finance Company worth 600000 Rwf and this loan will be used to expand her business to respond to the needs of her clients.

Fatuma has no other income and is earning approximately $365 per month and hopes the loan will help increase her profits so she can reinvest in her business. Fatuma has 32 years experience in this business. She starts her daily operations at 8:00 a.m and finishes at 5:00 p.m.

loans.use: Expand the business.

loans.name: Zikra

texts.fr:
Madame  Zikra  M. est âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Missira dans la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
N’ayant pas été à  l’école pour des considérations sociales, parents très religieux qui voyaient en l’école des blancs, une porte de déperdition. Dès sa tendre enfance elle s’adonna au petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait du riz. Riche d’une solide expérience acquise au chevet de sa mère, après son mariage elle décida d’évoluer de ses propres ailes  en menant depuis 20 ans le commerce d’articles divers (thermos, cartes prépayées, tasses, chaussures, téléphones portables etc.) et jouit  d’une grande notoriété. 
C’est dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, qu’elle a fait recours à  Soro Yiriwaso depuis 30 mois. Après 1 prêt individuel et 3 prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel qui  sera utilisé pour acheter, 50 thermos, 10 paires de chaussures, 3 douzaines de tasses, 10 téléphones portables et un carton de cartes prépayées de l’opérateur téléphonique Orange. Elle s’approvisionne  en cartes de recharge et téléphones portables à Bamako, en thermos, tasses et chaussures au Ghana. Elle vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle à domicile et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement d’hommes.   
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner, acheter des animaux petit à petit et rembourser le prêt. 
Son ambition est d’épargner le plus que possible afin de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zikra M. is 53, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her husband and children in the Missira neighborhod of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Never having attended school because of socio-economic reasons, she had very religious parents who saw the "white man's school" as the road to perdition. Since she was very young, she busied herself with petty trading, working with her mother who sold rice. Rich in experience gained at her mother's side, she decided after her marriage to go out on her own and has been in business for 20 years, selling various items (thermos bottles, prepaid phone cards, dishes, shoes, portable phones, etc.) and has a very good reputation.

It is with the intention of increasing her working capital that she joined Soro Yiriwaso, 30 months ago. After 1 individual loan and 3 solidarity loans, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her second individual loan which will be used to buy 50 thermos bottles, 10 pairs of shoes, 3 dozen bowls, 10 portable phones, and a carton of prepaid phone cards from "Orange" cell telephone server. She buys her telephones and rechargeable cards in Bamako; her thermos bottles, bowls and shoes come from Ghana. She sells for cash and credit, out of her home and door-to-door, to a clientele composed primarily of men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 70,000 F CFA which will be used to add to her savings, buy some animals little by little, and reimburse the loan.

Her ambition is to save as much as possible so as to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Sakina Sameer Khan Group

texts.en:
Zareena wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Seema wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Asia, Anufe and Reshma want loans to buy buffaloes for their dairy business. Sakina has lived in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband runs a dairy business. Presently, they have one buffalo and Sakina takes care of it. Sakina is the group leader and is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans. If one does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy another buffalo for the dairy business.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Amadou D. est âgé de 31 ans, célibataire et père d’un enfant. Il  habite dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses parents dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème  région du Mali).
Ayant très tôt abandonné l’école, il commença dès sa jeune enfance les activités commerciales. C’est ainsi qu’il s’initia aux bricoles des  appareils électroniques, électroménagers en Gambie où il était en aventure. Depuis son retour au bercail il y a  6 ans, il mène la même activité. Il  tient son atelier  dans le quartier Darsalam aux abords de la route nationale à 200m de  la nouvelle gare routière de Ségou. Il jouit d’une grande réputation et du qualificatif de génie de l’électronique malgré qu’il ait  appris ce métier sur le tas.
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire il fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso depuis 7 mois. Après un premier prêt individuel correctement remboursé, il est à son 2ème qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 100 façades, 100 batteries pour téléphones et 100 chargeurs. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Monsieur  Amadou D.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes, de jeunes et de vieux. 
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA  qui lui permettra de rembourser ses prêts et d’aider sa famille.
Son ambition est de faire le commerce entre le Mali et les autres pays du monde.
texts.en:
Mr. Amadou D., 31, is single and the father of one child. He lives in a traditional family with his parents in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (4the region of Mali).

Having left school at a young age, he began early on to work to earn his living. Thus, he began to make repairs on electronic apparatus and household appliances in Gambia where he had gone to see the world. Since he returned to his native land, 6 years ago, he has continued the same business. He has his workshop in the Darsalam neighborhood alongside the National Road, 200 meters from the new bus station of Ségou. He has a good reputation and is considered quite a genius at repairing electrical gadgets, even though he just picked up his know-how along the way.

With the intention of adding to his turnover, he came to Soro Yiriwaso 7 months ago. After a first individual loan, correctly reimbursed, he is on his second which he intends to use to buy 100 panels, 100 telephone batteries and 100 chargers. He does his buying in Bamako (capital of Mali). Mr. Amadou D. sells for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women, young and old.

With this loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will permit him to reimburse his loan and help his family. His ambition is to become involved in trade between Mali and the rest of the world.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of electronics materials

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Ризоев Джура более 15 лет занимется животноводством. Он покупает скот откармливает и продает.  Джура работает на цементном заводе. Проживает он, в районе  Варзоба. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Сын работает водителем такси. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить мелко рогатый скот для откормки и продажи. На период кормления погашать он будет за счет заработной платы.
texts.en:
Jura R. has been working in animal husbandry for the last fifteen years. He purchases cattle, fattens them and sells them at the meat market. Jura also works at the cement plant in the Varzoba regions, where he lives. He is 47 years old, married and has six children. His son works as a taxi driver. Jura wants to take out this loan to purchase rams for fattening and sale. While he fattens the rams he will pay back his loan using his salary.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Prisque

texts.fr:
H. Prisque est née le 8 Septembre 1976 à Abomey Calavi dans le Département de l'Atlantique au Sud du Benin. Prisque est mariée et mère de deux enfants: Romain âgé de dix ans en sixième année du cours primaire et Ermine âgée de huit ans en quatrième année du cours primaire. Prisque est couturière de formation. Prisque vend aussi des tissus qu’elle distribue aux fonctionnaires à crédit et passe après pour récupérer son argent selon le délai convenu avec le client. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Prisque achète ses tissus. Prisque a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé pour augmenter le niveau de son activité. Prisque sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son capital dans le but de satisfaire la forte demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Prisque was born on September 8, 1976 in Abomey Calavi, in Atlantique County in southern Benin. She is married and the mother of two children: Romain, age 10 and in the 6th year of primary school; and Ermine, age 8 and in the 4th year of primary school. Prisque is a seamstress by training. She also sells cloth that she distributes to civil servants on credit. And she comes by afterward to collect her money according to what is a suitable wait for the customer. There, in Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin, she buys her cloth. She has already had three ALIDÉ loans for increasing her business level. She's requesting a fourth loan to boost her capital with the goal of satisfying the strong demand from her customers. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 bolts of Hitarget cloth (12 m each) and 5 bolts of Hollandais cloth (12 m each)

loans.name: Sétou

texts.fr:
Madame  Sétou D. est une   veuve  de 62 ans, qui vit en location avec ses 5 enfants  dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Technicienne de santé à la retraite, elle est venue au commerce grâce à sa mère qui vendait des céréales. Elle commença ses activités génératrices de revenus par le tricotage des habits  pour enfants, le commerce d’articles divers etc. Très vite elle opte pour la fabrication et la vente des jus de boissons locaux non alcoolisés et de la glace. Elle mène cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année et  jouit   d’une grande renommée  dans le quartier et même dans la ville de Ségou. 
Pour préparer des jus, elle utilise 2 kg de sucre,  4 sachets de poudre de jus  plus  6 sachets de sucre vanille et des arômes.  
Afin d’acheter un congélateur d’une grande capacité pour  satisfaire sa clientèle, elle  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel  tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter un congélateur sur place à Ségou auprès des commerçants qui se sont spécialisés  dans le domaine  de l’électroménager. Madame  Sétou D.  vend au comptant et à crédit chez elle à domicile et en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants.   
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner et subvenir à certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Sétou D. is a 62-year-old widow who is renting her place with her five children in the Bagadadji district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A retired health technician, she came into commerce thanks to her mother, who used to sell grains. She started her income-generating business with the knitting of clothing for children, commerce in various goods, etc. She very soon opted for making and selling local non-alcoholic juice drinks and ice cream. She has been in this business for a dozen years and enjoys great fame in her area, and even in the city of Ségou. To make juices, she uses 2 kg of sugar, 4 bags of juice powder, 6 bags of vanilla sugar, and some flavorings. In order to buy a large-capacity freezer for satisfying her customers, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso 36 months ago. After four solidarity loans and an individual loan, all correctly repaid, she is now on her second individual loan. This loan will be used to buy a freezer, locally in Ségou, from merchants who specialize in household appliances. Ms. D. makes her sales out of her home and door-to-door, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men, women, and children. She intends to realize an average monthly profit of 37,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings and covering certain family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy  freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of carrots, cabbages, lettuces, peppers, parsley, and cucumbers

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Amda has been a firewood and juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She belongs to the Mapatano group (code 2070). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy firewood for resale and fruits and sugar for juice. Amda is hoping that through this loan, she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Amda is 45 years old, married, and has six children: ages 25, 20, 15, 12, 10 and five. Amda will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Arafa. who has her own small business selling juice and fish in Zanzibar.

loans.use: Buy more firewood, fruits and sugar.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a firewood seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Ujamaa group (Code 2016). Every day she works at her business.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood for resale, to expand her business. Subira is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Subira is 39 years old, married, and has three children: ages 20, three and one.

loans.use: Buy more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Karima

texts.en:
E. Karima is 54 years old (daughter is pictured). She is married with three children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age.

For about 13 years she has purchased young sheep and calves from the local market, then fattens and sells them. Karima is a very hard-working, and her diligence is incredible. She looks for a way to provide extra income to her home.

Karima wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls. She is supporting her children with education. Her daughter who is pictured helps with the business. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy calves to expand her business. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ About Tajikistan and IMON International... Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase livestock to expand the business.

loans.name: Ulfatoy

texts.ru: Улфатой - молодая женщина 1983 года рождения. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Улфатой занимается переработкой козьей шерсти и производства шерстяной нити. Она этим занимается вместе со своей свекровью. Они домохозяйки, нигде не работают и дома занимается этой деятельностью. Их мужья занимаются скотоводством. Они перепродают скот, откармливают крупно-рогатый скот.  Улфатой и её свекровь помогают мужчинам в увеличении их семейного бюджета. Улфатой кредитуется в нашей организации более 2-х лет. Она успешно закончила свой предыдущий займ и хочет взять новый.
texts.en:
Ulfatoy is a young woman, who was born in 1983. She is married and the mother of three children. Together with her mother-in-law, Ulfatoy processes goat's wool and spins wool yarn. They are housewives without jobs outside the home, and run their business out of the house. Their husbands raise livestock, fattening large-horned cattle. Ulfatoy and her mother-in-law help the men to increase the family's income. Ulfatoy has been a loan customer of MicroInvest for more than two years. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and would like to take out a new one.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Processing of goat's wool and spinning wool yarn

loans.name: Gulomali

texts.ru: Гуломали Юсупов проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 37 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена работает в интернате "Чорбог". Гуломали работает учителем более 19 лет. Помимо этого он занимается животноводством. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить дойную корову для семейного пользования. Погашение будет проводит  за счет заработной платы.
texts.en:
Gulomali Yusupov lives in the Varzoba region. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. His wife works at the boarding school "Chorbog". Gulomali himself has been working as a teacher for more then 19 years. To supplement his salary he also raises cattle. Gulomali would like to take out this loan to purchase a milk cow for personal use. He will be paying back the loan using his salary.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
Murodjon is 28 years old.  He is married and has two children. Murodjon’s wife is a housekeeper.  Murodjon is the bread-winner in the family.  For 10 years he has sold bed-clothes and towels.  He tries to choose various goods of good quality and attractive prices which helps him keeping his clientele.  The business brings in a stable income and allows Murodjon to improve the living conditions for his family.  

Murodjon requests a $1500 loan to purchase more bed-clothes and towels to increase the range of his goods. He would like to thank everybody for supporting him.  The progress of Murodjon’s business is in your hands. Your support will really help him.   
-----------------------------------
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase obed-clothes and towels.

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr:
D. Agnès est originaire du Département de l'Ouémé dans la Commune d'Adjarra au Sud du Bénin. Agnès est mariée à OWOLABI François mécanicien de profession. Agnès est mère de quatre enfants: deux de ces enfants sont scolarisés; les deux autres n’ont pas encore l’âge d’être scolarisés. Agnès collecte des bouteilles vides auprès des ménages et les revend aux artisans et coopératives pour d’autres usages. Agnès a eu déjà deux crédits à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé. Mais toujours est-il que Agnès n’arrive pas encore à satisfaire toutes les commandes qu’elle reçoit par manque de moyens financiers. Alors Agnès sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour y arriver. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Agnès comes from the Ouémé Department from the township of Adjarra in the south of Bénin. Agnès is married to Owolabi François, who is a trained mechanic. Agnès is the mother of 4 children; two of them are enrolled in school and the other two are not yet old enough to go to school.

Agnès collects empty bottles from households and re-sells them to artisans and cooperatives for other uses. She has already had 2 loans from ALIDé to bolster her working capital, and she reimbursed them in a timely manner. However, Agnès still doesn't manage to fill all the orders she receives because she lacks financial means. For this reason, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The signification of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "a pathway always exists for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a little country in West Africa next to Nigeria, and its annual per capita income stands at US$1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of empty bottles and cans

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
K. Zuhro (husband pictured) is 36 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children.

Zuhro breeds cattle. She buys cattle in the market at low prices, feeds them and then resells them at the same market at a profitable price. Her husband also attends to the business. Zuhro works hard in order to make the business successful and she generates stable income for the family.

Zuhro is planning to purchase cattle for her household for raising and further selling. She requests $1000. Zuhro would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency. ------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle for selling.

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
K. Ikromjon is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He's the father of three adult children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Ikromjon has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of cattle to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Ikromjon comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Abdusalloh

texts.ru: Манонов Абдусаллох проживает в Варзобском районе. Работает  учителем в средней школе. В 2008 году был выбран лучшим учителем года. Кроме того занимается сельским хозяйством и разведением крупно рогатого скота. Покупает молодых телян для откормки. После откормки продает на рынке. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Хочет купить двух молодых телят. Абдусаллох женат и имеет четверых детей.
texts.en:
Abdusalloh M. lives in the Varzob region. He works as a school teacher and in 2008 was honored as the best teacher of the year. To supplement his salary he also raises vegetables and cattle. Abdusalloh purchases calves for fattening and sells them at the meat market once they are fully grown. He would like to take out this loan to enlarge his herd by buying two additional calves. Abdusalloh is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two calfes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mamir

texts.en:
Mamir is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Mamir hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sohib

texts.ru: Содиков Сохиб житель Варзобского района. Возраст 34 года , женат и имеет двоих детей. Образование высшее. Поспециальности историк. Но попрофессии не работает. Занимается животноводством. Разводит коров российской породы. для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота он решил получить кредит и купить породистую корову.
texts.en:
Sohib S. lives in Varzob region. He is 34 years old, married and has two children. Sohib has a bachelor's degree in history but currently works in animal husbandry. He breeds cows of the Russian breed. To expand his herd he has decided to take out this loan and purchase a purebred cow.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a purebred cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.en:
Fakhridin is a hard-working entrepreneur from Penjikent, Tajikistan. He has operated his own business producing wooden doors and window frames for the past eight years. Fakhridin has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. He works hard to earn a good income and support his family. He and his wife Raihon have four children. Fakhridin has requested a loan of $3000 USD to buy some tools and woodworker that he needs for his business. Fakhridin appeals to your generosity so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase tools and woodworker

loans.name: Mamarachab

texts.ru: Мамарачаб - мужчина средних лет 1968 года рождения. Женат и имеет 5-х детей. Занимается продажей горюче-смазочных материалов около своего дома. Он продает бензин, солярку для заправки и масло для смазки. Он закупает товар у оптовиков и продает попутным машинам, так как его дом находится близко к трассе. Мамарачаб кредитуется в нашей организации уже 2 года. За этот период он успешно закончил 4 займа. Он очень благодарен кредитной организации за эту поддержку.
texts.en:
Mamarachab is a middle-aged man who was born in 1968. He is married and has five children. Mamarachab sells fuel and lubricants near his home. He sells gasoline, diesel fuel, and oil. He purchases goods from the wholesalers and sells to passing cars, since his house is located near the highway. Mamarachab has been a loan customer with MicroInvest for two years. In that time, he has successfully repaid four loans. He is very grateful to the loan institution for this support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.ru: Азизов Шараф житель района Варзоб. Возраст 29 лет, холост. Живет  с родителями и семьей брата. Работает на Врзобской гидроэлектростанции охранником. Кроме того в свободное он занимается животноводством.Имеет небольшое хозяйство. Планирует получить кредит на который хочет купить дойную корову.Ухаживать за коровой будет его мать. Молоко , которое будут получать смогут использовать в хозяйстве , а часть даже смогут продавать.
texts.en:
Sharaf A. lives in the Varzob district. He is 29 years old and a bachelor. He lives with his parents and brother's family, and works as a security guard at the Vrzobskaya hydroelectric station. In his free time he also raises livestock on a small scale. He would like to use a loan to buy a dairy cow, which his mother will care for. Milk from the cow will be used by the family, and maybe part will even be sold.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand number of livestock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.en: A. Fazliddin is a very hard working man who comes from Penjikent, Tajikistan. After having been rejected for various jobs he decided to start his own business providing welding services. He started it eight years ago from his home. The good service that he offers has brought him a lot of clients and now he employs someone to help him meet his clients’ needs. Fazliddin’s desire is to keep growing as a micro businessman and, in order to do this, he is asking for a loan of $3000 to refurbish his shop and to buy some equipment. In this way he can improve the quality of service that he offers so that his business can continue to grow. Your support will be very useful for Fazliddin and he sincerely thanks you for your trust. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To refurbish his shop and buy some equipment

loans.name: Tingnéré Nènè

texts.fr:
Madame Tingnéré Nènè Dembélé est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants  dans le quartier Darsalam I  de la ville  de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso ). Enseignante dans une école publique  de Koutiala il y a plus de 10 ans, elle mène en plus de cette profession des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la teinture et la vente des bazins teintés qu’elle a apprise auprès d’une de ses collègues de service depuis 7 ans. Elle fait des prestations pour beaucoup de demandeurs de son quartier et de la ville en teinture, elle  reçoit également des commandes de différentes structures professionnelles de Koutiala et des tierces personnes.  
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et générer plus de  bénéfice, elle a décidé de faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y’a  2 mois. 
Elle est à son  premier prêt individuel qui servira à acheter, 5 pièces de bazins moyen riche, des colorants (teintures) et de la potasse. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Koutiala et souvent à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elle effectue ses ventes dans la ville de Koutiala (tant dans les structures professionnelles étatiques que privées et dans le quartier) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes à crédit ou au comptant. 
Elle compte réaliser sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qu’elle  utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance, s’entretenir et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Dans ses perspectives, elle compte ouvrir un centre d’apprentissage en teinture qui demande un fonds important, pour cela elle fonde son espoir sur Soro  Yiriwaso et son partenaire Kiva pour réaliser ce projet.
texts.en:
Ms. Tingnéré Nènè Dembélé, age 42, is married and the mother of four. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Darsalam I district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). A teacher in a Koutiala public school for over ten years, she also earns revenues from business, particularly the dyeing of cloth and selling dyed damask fabrics, that she learned from one of her service colleagues seven years ago. She offers a range of cloth dyeing services for many requestors in her district and in the city. She also receives orders from different professional organizations of Koutiala and from third parties. To satisfy her customers and to generate more profit, she decided to turn towards the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two months ago. She is on her first individual loan, which will be used to buy five bolts of medium-rich damask, colorants (dyes), and some potash. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Koutiala and often in Bamako (capital of Mali). Sales are made in Koutiala City (in professional state organizations as much as in private organizations and in her district) to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted. She is counting on realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan, for supporting herself, and for investing the rest in her business. Looking ahead, she intends to open a center for apprentices in cloth dyeing that demands sizable funding. Her hopes rest upon Soro Yiriwaso and its partner, Kiva, for this plan to be realized.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of damask fabrics and dyes

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат – 34 лет. Она замужем и мать 3-х детей. Её муж уехал в Россию работать. Здесь он не смог найти хорошую работу, чтобы накопить денег и купить для себя скот. У Инобат было всего лишь 10 овец. Но год назад она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Сейчас у Инобат две дойной коровы. Пока ее муж найдет работу в России и пришлет ей деньги, ей будет помогать ее брат. Инобат очень рада что в трудный момент ее жизни наша организация помогает ей.
texts.en:
Inobat is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband left for Russia to find work. He was not able to find a good job Tajikistan, and was unable to save money to buy them cattle. Inobat has only ten sheep, but a year ago she learned of the MicroInvest loan program, and came to take out a loan to purchase a milk cow. Now Inobat has two milk cows. Until her husband has found work in Russia and sends her money, her brother is helping out. Inobat is pleased that at this difficult time in her life, MicroInvest is assisting her.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr:
L. Marcelline est née le 11 janvier 1969 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans le Département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin. Marcelline est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Les enfants de Marcelline sont: Anzim âgé de vingt ans, Andilath âgée de seize ans, karim treize ans et Toyibathv âgé dix ans respectivement en sixième, troisième, deuxième et première année du cours secondaire. Marcelline vend des chaussures, sacs, bijoux et ustensiles de cuisine en plastique. Marcelline vendait ses articles de façon ambulante. Aujourd’hui, Marcelline a ouvert une petite boutique dans laquelle elle vend désormais ses articles. Marcelline a bénéficié déjà de deux crédits de ALIDé. Marcelline a bien remboursé ces crédits et a pu amener avec, son activité au stade où elle est aujourd’hui. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement, Marcelline sollicite un troisième crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
L. Marcelline was born on January 11, 1969 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, in the Littoral Department located in the south of Benin. Marcelline is married and the mother of 4 children. The children of Marcelline are: Anzim, 20, Andilath, 16, Karim, 13, and Toyibathv, 10. They are in 6th, 9th, 10th and 11th grades respectively.

Marcelline used to sell shoes, handbags, costume jewelry, and plastic kitchen utensils, going from door to door. Today, Marcelline has opened a little shop where she now sells her items. She has had 2 loans from ALIDé. Marcelline reimbursed the loans in a timely manner and used them to bring her business to the point where it is today. To bolster her working capital, Marcelline is requesting a third loan.

The signification of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "a pathway always exists for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a little country in West Africa next to Nigeria, and its annual per capita income stands at US$1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes, handbags, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Ozodoy

texts.en:
H. Ozodoy is 44 years old. She is married with three children. She started her own business three years ago because her husband’s salary wasn’t enough for their family expenses. Ozodoy sells confectionery items like candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income generated from her business allows Ozodoy to support her family. She dreams that her children will attain a higher education. Today she requests $2,500 that she will use for the confectionery to enlarge the range of goods she offers. The income she plans to spend for the well-being of her family as well as for educating her children.

loans.use: Purchasing confectionery items for enlarging the range of goods

loans.name: Mahmadjon

texts.en:
I. Mahmadjon is 25 years old and is married. He is an expert in computer services and cell phone repairing. He provides computer services such as: printing, scanning, lamination and etc. He is in this business for 2 years already. Mahmadjon tries to use modern up-to-date technologies in his work so that satisfying the demands and requirements of the customers. Now he is planning to purchase additional tools and spare parts requiring for the repair of cell phones. With this purpose Mahmadjon requests $ 3000 US Dollars. This is the first loan of Mahmadjon and he thanks all for support and promises not to let down and to pay the loan in time.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of tools and spare parts requiring for the repair of cell phones.

loans.name: Il'yos

texts.ru: Гафуров Ильёс-молодой мужчина 33 лет,имеет 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и купля продажей скота  на протяжении 10 лет. Он имеет большой опыт в сфере животноводства, так как занимается этим с юных лет..  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена занимается переработкой шерсти скота и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Гафуров Ильёс  в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Il'yos G. is a young man of 33, and he has two children. For the past ten years he has raised and traded in cattle. He has a great deal of experience in caring for livestock, having done so since his youth. He purchases cattle at the market and, after fattening them for two to three months, sells them at the same market. His wife processes the wool and sells it at the market and, in addition, helps out around the farm. In that fashion, she is able to assist her husband in improving the family finances. Il'yos G., in turn, wants to increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
D. Hamida is a married mother of six children. She has a business selling clothing for kids in the market of Dushanbe. Hamida’s business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last 15 years. Hamida is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard-working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar products or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued, respected and heard. Hamida is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so she can continue to support her children.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Kosimjon

texts.en: I. Kosimjon is a 26-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children. He runs a business raising and selling cattle and has five years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Kosimjon has become a very successful businessman. He has a friendly family who always try to help each other. Thus his wife helps him with his business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. Now Kosimjon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. For that, he applied for a loan of 5,000 Somoni. Kosimjon thanks all lenders for their support. With your help Kosimjon can get ahead. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Bomoko Plus Group

texts.fr: Jacquie T. a comme activité commerciale la vente d’épices, d’œufs, et a aussi un restaurant. Elle a planifié d’acheter avec le crédit de mois de mai courant 5 cartons d’œufs dans le but d’accroitre le revenu de son affaire. Elle a commencé à vendre des beignets en 1997 avec un capital initial de $2. En 1998, son amie lui demande de l’aider à préparer la nourriture dans son restaurant à coté d’une Institution universitaire au nord de Kinshasa. Jacquie acquiert de l’expérience pendant cette période et décide d’ouvrir son propre restaurant en 2000. En travaillant avec détermination et bonne gestion, elle est parvenue à développer son affaire jusqu’à totaliser un capital de plus de $500. En 2001, une mesure de la ville interdit le fonctionnement des restaurants à coté de cette Institution universitaire et mets fin à son activité.  De 2001 à ce jour, Jacquie s’est lancée dans la vente d’épices au marché et a ouvert un autre restaurant au même endroit. Elle décide en 2006 d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope dénommé « Bomoko » qui signifie « Unité » en français, en vue de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un magasin des denrées alimentaires. Elle est cliente fidèle de Hope, elle a reçu 7 crédits qu’elle a remboursés totalement à temps. Jacquie a 30 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 8 et 13 ans. Leurs deux enfants vont à l’école. Actuellement, son capital est de $900 et son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $ 85 par semaine.
texts.en:
Jacquie T.'s business is selling spices and eggs, and she also has a little restaurant. Her plan is to use her loan this month of May to buy 5 cartons of eggs in hopes of raising the income she makes from her little restaurant.

Jacquie began to sell fritters in 1997 with an initial capital of US$ 2. In 1998, her friend asked her to help make food for her little restaurant near the university, in the north of Kinshasa. Jacquie gained experience during this period and decided to open her own restaurant in 2000.

Working with determination and good management skills, she developed her little business so that she had a working capital of more than US$ 500. In 2001, the city passed a decree forbidding restaurants near the university and put an end to her activity.

From 2001 till today, Jacquie has been selling spices in the market and has opened another restaurant at the same place. In 2006, she decided to join one of the HOPE groups called "Bomoko", which means "unity", hoping to realize her dream of one day opening a grocery store. She is a faithful client of HOPE. She has received 7 loans that she reimbursed in a timely manner.

Jacquie is 30, married and the mother of 2 children aged 8 and 13. Both children go to school. Presently her working capital stands at US$ 900 and her business brings in a profit of US$ 85 per week.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 cartons of eggs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Umedullo

texts.en: M. Umedullo is a young clothing merchant from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He started his small business when he was in his late 20’s and gradually, though much hard work, has been able to develop it into quite a successful enterprise. Umedullo has the qualities it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur. Goal-oriented, hard-working and punctual, he is a natural business man. Funding from IMON International has been instrumental in helping Umedullo build his business. His first loan was for $600 and since that time he has benefited from one additional loan while establishing a great credit history. He has now requested a loan of 6200 Somoni to add to his available working capital. The ability to purchase large quantities of inventory in bulk saves time and expense for merchants such as Umedullo. He would like to buy a supply of women’s and children’s clothing that will boost his inventory before the busy summer season. Umedullo appreciates the availability of funding through IMON International. It allows him to take advantage of good opportunities and focus on growing his business so that he is able to adequately provide for himself and his family. loans.name: Idimoh

texts.en: T. Idimoh is an enterprising, capable, and very hard-working woman. She lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan and sells women’s clothes. She began her own business because her husband’s salary was not sufficient for their large family including their five children. Her business is allowing Idimoh to provide for her children with necessary food and education. Currently she needs a loan of 7500 Somoni to buy merchandise in order to increase her sales. Idimoh wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Support her! loans.name: Hatanisa

texts.ru: Хатаниса женщина 1953 года рождения. Вдова и имеет 6-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с сыновьями. Хатаниса откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Хатанисы продают их на скотном рынке. Хатаниса кредитуется в нашей организации более 1 года. Она успешно закончила два предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Хатаниса планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Хатаниса очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Hatanisa is a woman who was born in 1953. She is a widow with six children and, she and her sons raise and sell cattle. Hatanisa fattens the cattle at home, and her sons sell them at the livestock market when they are ready. Hatanisa has been a loan customer with MicroInvest for more than a year. She has successfully repaid two previous loans, and now wants to take out her next loan. Hatanisa is planning to increase the size of their herd, and in so doing increase her family's profits. She likes the terms MicroInvest offers, and is pleased that there such public-minded institutions exist.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.en:
T. Shamsullo is 23 years old. In spite of the fact that he does not yet have his own family, he is supporting his parents.

Shamsullo sells confectionery and has been in this business already for six years. This activity generates the main income for the his family.

Since Shamsullo became very popular in the market by selling fresh and tasty pastry, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today he requests 5,000 Somoni to increase the variety of confectionery that he sells. With your help, Shamsullo will be able to make his business succeed and, in the very near future, make his own family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more confectionary to sell and also to buy fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Boymurot

texts.ru:
Куранов Боймурот – мужчина  44-х лет, женат, имеет 3-х детей.
Он  занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Боймурот  кредитуется уже 2 года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было очень малое количество скота. Сейчас у Боймурота большое количество мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Боймурот планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Boymurot K. is a 44-year-old man, who is married and has three children. He raises and sells cattle, while his wife processes and sells the milk. For two years, Boymurot has been taking out loans. When he first came for financing, he had very few cattle. Now he has a large number of small-horned cattle, but his wife only has one milk cow. Boymurot is planning to purchase an additional milk cow with a calf for his wife, and he is grateful to MicroInvest for the assistance in carrying out his plans.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.en: Ten years ago, Mavdjuda started her women's clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, she has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family of three children. Throughout the last year, IMON International has provided assistance to Mavdjuda’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Mavdjuda has used her previous loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 5,000 Somoni to replace her depleted inventory, hoping to continue expanding her business and support her family.
